original: gti mug ni byang @111b chub po //
analyzed: gti mug ni byang @111b chub po //
translated: Delusion is enlightenment.

original: ci ltar yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one enter into reality?

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /
translated: When one does not enter into the extinction of desire,

original: zhe sdang zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /
analyzed: zhe sdang zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /
translated: does not enter into the extinction of hatred,

original: gti mug zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs pa de'i tshe na yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gti mug zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs pa de'i tshe na yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: and does not enter into the extinction of delusion, then one enters into reality.

original: 'das pa'i sems ni chags par mi byed ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang chags par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems ni chags par mi byed ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang chags par mi byed de /
translated: The past mind is not made desirous, nor is the future mind made desirous.

original: 'das zin pa'i phyir dang ma 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩda ltar gyi sems kyang chags par mi byed de da ltar ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i lung gi don de grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi don khungs des 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams
analyzed: 'das zin pa'i phyir dang ma 'ongs pa'i phyir ro // da ltar gyi sems kyang chags par mi byed de da ltar ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i lung gi don de grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi don khungs des 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams
translated: Because it has already passed, and because it has not yet come.üîΩThe present mind is not made desirous, because the present has no abiding.üîΩThe meaning of this and other such scriptural passages is established.

original: cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of these authoritative passages is established by that source, and so desire, the desirous one, and so forth, are established as being devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Likewise, the Questions of SubƒÅhu Perfection of Wisdom S≈´tra says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
translated: SubƒÅhu, form is not a phenomenon that is attached

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a phenomenon that is free from attachment.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not phenomena that are attached

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: nor are they phenomena that are free from attachment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the suchness of form, which is not a phenomenon that is attached

original: gzugs 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: nor is it a phenomenon that is free from attachment.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa /
translated: The suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness

original: 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not the reality of passion, nor is it the reality of the absence of passion.

original: gzugs ni zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
analyzed: gzugs ni zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
translated: Form is not the reality of aversion,

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the reality of the absence of aversion.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the reality of aversion,

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //üîΩgzugs zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin ba dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no // gzugs zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin ba dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa de ni /
translated: nor are they the reality of the absence of aversion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩtshor ba dang / @112a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // tshor ba dang / @112a * //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not the reality of form that is the reality of aversion, nor is it the reality of the absence of aversion.

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not the reality of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that is the reality of aversion, nor is it the reality of the absence of aversion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs ni gti mug gi chos can nam /
analyzed: gzugs ni gti mug gi chos can nam /
translated: Form is not a phenomenon of delusion,

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a phenomenon free from delusion.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gti mug gi chos can nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gti mug gi chos can nam /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not phenomena of delusion,

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: nor are they phenomena free from delusion.

original: gzugs gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That form is not the true nature of delusion, nor is it the true nature free from delusion, that is the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
translated: That feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the true nature of delusion, nor are they the true nature free from delusion, that is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is not defiled or purified.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not defiled or purified.

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the non-defilement and non-purification of form.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the non-defilement and non-purification of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi don
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi don
translated: This is established as the meaning of the scriptures.

original: de dag la sogs pa yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs de dag la sogs pas kyang 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /üîΩde ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs de dag la sogs pas kyang 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te / de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
translated: And so on refers to the fact that the scriptures that establish and are authoritative for those scriptures also establish that all phenomena such as attachment and one who is attached are devoid of intrinsic reality.üîΩThe establishment of those authoritative scriptures is a quality of the teaching that all phenomena such as attachment and one who is attached are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de @112b dag bstan bcos 'dis sgrub pa'i yul nyid du bstan pa ni slob dpon gyi zhalüîΩsnga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de @112b dag bstan bcos 'dis sgrub pa'i yul nyid du bstan pa ni slob dpon gyi zhalüîΩsnga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs yin no //
translated: The teaching that all phenomena such as attachment and one who is attached are devoid of intrinsic reality in limitless Mahayana sutras is taught in this treatise to be the object of establishment. This is the great wave of knowledge of the master Nagarjuna.

original: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyi 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyi 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, I have not taught that all phenomena are essenceless through my own speculation, through mere dry sophistry.

original: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa /
translated: For, there are also these scriptures.üîΩThis concludes the commentary on the sixth chapter, the analysis of desire and the desirous one, in the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: shes rab sgron ma las 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa drug pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: shes rab sgron ma las 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa drug pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Lamp of Wisdom, composed by the master Avalokitavrata, is complete.

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the aggregates and so on are essenceless by the power of the meaning of the refutation of the distinctions of the negation of emptiness, the seventh chapter is begun.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúpower‚Äù in this context should be viewed as having the sense of a reason for engaging in a thesis and as having the sense of being related to the topic that will be presented later in the text.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dbang du byas nas da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dbang du byas nas da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of the sense of a reason for engaging in a thesis, now the text says, ‚ÄúBy the refutation of the specific nonconcordant factors with regard to emptiness.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
translated: When the author of the treatise began the first chapter, the chapter on conditions, he set forth the thesis that all things are unarisen.

original: 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Therefore here also, in terms of the sense of a reason for engaging in that thesis, just as it was set forth by the author of the treatise earlier, the text says, ‚ÄúBy the refutation of the specific nonconcordant factors with regard to emptiness.‚Äù Emptiness is one‚Äôs own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Its counteragent is the side that opposes it.

original: 'di lta ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: It is the side that advocates the inherent existence of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: The ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs prior position that the aggregates, elements, and sense bases do exist.

original: 'og nas don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'du byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'og nas don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'du byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Later on, it will be said, ‚ÄúUltimately, only conditioned entities, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, should be apprehended as having the nature of the conditioned,

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: because they are endowed with the characteristics of the conditioned, such as arising.‚Äù

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy refuting that‚Äù means that the seventh chapter is begun in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩphung po la sogs @113a * //
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas / phung po la sogs @113a * //
translated: In terms of the meaning that will be explained below,üîΩthe seven chapters are composed in order to teach that the aggregates and so on

original: pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: are essenceless.üîΩThe meaning of the following passage from the seventh chapter,üîΩthe examination of arising, enduring, and ceasing, is that the aggregates and so on are taught to be essenceless.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bdun pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bdun pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said in terms of that meaning.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de thob ce na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de thob ce na /
translated: What is the result of this chapter? By what method is that result attained?

original: phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching that the aggregates and so on are essenceless is its result.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: The treatise is composed in order to attain that result by means of the refutation of the special counteragents to emptiness, and so the author of the commentary has taught the means and the result of the means in this introductory section of the treatise.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúHere, someone might say,‚Äù and so on.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag de ltar bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag de ltar bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even though the aggregates, elements and sense-fields have been refuted in this way, those of our own schools who are attached to them cannot bear this and so they say the following.

original: de'i phyir don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, one should apprehend that conditioned things, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, have the nature of conditioned things,

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: because they possess the characteristics of conditioned things, such as arising.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These are to be connected respectively with the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ma bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ma bzung ste /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not apprehended as possessing the characteristics of conditioned things,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: like the horn of an ass. This is the example of the dissimilar class.

original: phung po la sogs pa dag ni skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag ni skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The aggregates, etc., exist as possessing the characteristics of conditioned things, such as arising. This is the application of the reason.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi mthu ji skad smos pas blo gros kyi 'du byed bskyed pa dag ni 'dus byas phung po la sogs pa dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar smra'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi mthu ji skad smos pas blo gros kyi 'du byed bskyed pa dag ni 'dus byas phung po la sogs pa dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar smra'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras
translated: Therefore, those who generate the mental factor of intelligence through the power of the reason say that compounded phenomena such as the aggregates definitely have the nature of being compounded.

original: bu yin te /üîΩ'di na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa gang dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ma bzung ba de dag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gang @113b
analyzed: bu yin te / 'di na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa gang dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ma bzung ba de dag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gang @113b
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.üîΩHere, those things such as the horns of a rabbit that are not apprehended as possessing the characteristics of compounded phenomena do not ultimately exist.üîΩThose things such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are taught as possessing the characteristics of compounded phenomena definitely have the nature of being compounded ultimately.

original: dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par bstan pa de dag la ni don dam par 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi mthu ji skad smos pas blo gros kyi 'du byed bskyed pa kho bo
analyzed: dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par bstan pa de dag la ni don dam par 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi mthu ji skad smos pas blo gros kyi 'du byed bskyed pa kho bo
translated: Therefore, those who generate the mental factor of intelligence through the power of the reason say that compounded phenomena such as the aggregates definitely have the nature of being compounded.

original: cag bye brag tu smra ba dag mdo sde pa dag ni 'dus byas phung po la sogs pa dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar smra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cag bye brag tu smra ba dag mdo sde pa dag ni 'dus byas phung po la sogs pa dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar smra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Sautrantikas say that conditioned phenomena such as the aggregates exist as conditioned entities.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /üîΩ'di la khyed skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de dag nyid ci 'dus byas dag yin nam 'on te 'dus ma byas dag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa / 'di la khyed skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de dag nyid ci 'dus byas dag yin nam 'on te 'dus ma byas dag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains here:üîΩYou assert arising and so on to be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena. Are they conditioned or unconditioned?

original: chos mngon pa'i sde snod gsum po 'di la bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa khyed skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de dag nyid 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid yin la 'dus byas gzhan gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod dam 'on te de dag
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i sde snod gsum po 'di la bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa khyed skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de dag nyid 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid yin la 'dus byas gzhan gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod dam 'on te de dag
translated: You Vaibhasikas and Sautrantikas assert that arising, enduring and disintegrating are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena. Do you assert that they are the entity of conditioned phenomena and the characteristics of other conditioned phenomena?

original: nyid 'dus ma byas kyi ngo bo nyid yin la /üîΩ'dus byas gzhan gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod ces brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid 'dus ma byas kyi ngo bo nyid yin la / 'dus byas gzhan gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod ces brtag pa yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that it is the characteristic of that which is conditioned.üîΩThis is the investigation.

original: gal te de dag 'dus byas dag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag 'dus byas dag yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are conditioned,üîΩthen arising would be conditioned.

original: de la re zhig skye ba'i dbang du byas te bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de dag 'dus byas dag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la re zhig skye ba'i dbang du byas te bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de dag 'dus byas dag yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that arising and so on are conditioned phenomena and the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, then arising would be conditioned.

original: de la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa gsum las re zhig skye ba 'dus byas yin na /
analyzed: de la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa gsum las re zhig skye ba 'dus byas yin na /
translated: But if arising, enduring, and disintegrating are conditioned phenomena, then arising would be conditioned.

original: de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi rung bas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pas /
analyzed: de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi rung bas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pas /
translated: But it is not tenable that it is the characteristic of that which is conditioned. Therefore, because it would be without characteristics, the meaning of your argument, ‚ÄúArising and so on are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena,‚Äù would not be established.

original: don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i dbang du byas te /üîΩtshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i dbang du byas te / tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: showing that conditioned phenomena, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, do not have the entity of conditioned phenomena.

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
translated: it would have three characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni mtshan nyid gsum po dag tshogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni mtshan nyid gsum po dag tshogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Having three characteristics would be having a collection of three characteristics,üîΩlike having three legs.üîΩIf that arising taught as the characteristic of conditioned phenomena were itself conditioned, it would have three characteristics.

original: chang ba gsum dang ldan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du bstan pa de nyid 'dus byas yin par gyur na de la yang mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshan nyid gsum
analyzed: chang ba gsum dang ldan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du bstan pa de nyid 'dus byas yin par gyur na de la yang mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshan nyid gsum
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚Äúit would have three characteristics‚Äù indicates that arising would have the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena, arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: po dag tshogs par 'gyur ba ste dper na rtsva chang ba gsum dang ldan pa'i tshoms la chang ba gsum tshogs pa @114a * //
analyzed: po dag tshogs par 'gyur ba ste dper na rtsva chang ba gsum dang ldan pa'i tshoms la chang ba gsum tshogs pa @114a * //
translated: The collection of the three is the collection of the three pitchers.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir / de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir ro don dam par skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /üîΩ'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bzhin no // de'i phyir / de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir ro don dam par skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de / 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe collection of three pitchers is a collection of three pitchers.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, in order to teach the measure of that, he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is taught that the ultimate arising and so on are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, they are not asserted to be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.‚ÄùüîΩBecause they are conditioned phenomena, they are like the basis of characteristics.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang gal te 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par miüîΩ'dod do ; gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i dpe mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma
analyzed: dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang gal te 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod do ; gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i dpe mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma
translated: For example, just as the basis of those characteristics is not asserted to be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena because it is conditioned, so too arising and so on are not asserted to be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena because they are conditioned.üîΩIf you say that it is not definite that the example is similar to the subject because the basis of those characteristics is the characteristic that indicates another basis of those characteristics,

original: nges pa nyid yin no zhes skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa nyid yin no zhes skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: then you are criticizing the example of the Followers of the Middle Way, saying that it is not definite that the example is similar to the subject.

original: de dag na re dper na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa de ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang yin la /
analyzed: de dag na re dper na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa de ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang yin la /
translated: For example, the mark of a great being, a wheel with a thousand spokes, is the basis of those characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the characteristic that illustrates the basis of characteristics.

original: 'di ltar 'khor lo de rtsibs stong dang lte ba dang mu khyud la sogs pa 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid gzhan dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor lo de rtsibs stong dang lte ba dang mu khyud la sogs pa 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid gzhan dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang yin la /
translated: Thus the wheel is the basis of characteristics of other characteristics such as the thousand spokes, the hub and the rim.

original: de skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin pas des na re zhig 'dus byas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin pas des na re zhig 'dus byas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is also the characteristic that illustrates the basis of characteristics of other bases of characteristics called a great man.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin du 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin du 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, since conditioned states are the basis of characteristics, how could conditioned states be the characteristic of conditioned states, like the basis of characteristics?

original: 'on te 'dus byas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan gyi mtshan nyid yin pa bzhin du 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhiüîΩdper mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'dus byas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan gyi mtshan nyid yin pa bzhin du 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is uncertain that it is the characteristic of conditioned states, it is not suitable as an example.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The basis of characteristics is not uncertain because it is not the case that it is not the characteristic of conditioned states in relation to another basis of characteristics.

original: 'dir smra bar 'dod pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'khor lo rtsibs stong @114b dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhis skyes buüîΩchen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid yin pa zhig yod na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba zhig na mi mthun pa'i phyogs de med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin
analyzed: 'dir smra bar 'dod pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'khor lo rtsibs stong @114b dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhis skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid yin pa zhig yod na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba zhig na mi mthun pa'i phyogs de med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin
translated: Here, if the basis of the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon were to indicate conditionedness to another basis of the characteristic that is not itself the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon, then the basis of the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon would be a basis of the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon that is not itself the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon.üîΩIf that were so, then it would be indefinite. But since that is not the case, it is not indefinite.üîΩüîΩ

original: te / 'di ltar 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de ni skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba'i don gzhan nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
