original: smra bar 'dod pa'i 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas des na 'dus byas kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byedüîΩpa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa'i 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas des na 'dus byas kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Because there is no dissimilar class, since the conditioned itself is not indicated as the basis of the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'khor lo yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'dra bas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'dra bas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the wheel is the basis of the characteristics, the term ‚Äúgreat being‚Äù is not indicated as the basis of the characteristics of the conditioned.üîΩSince they are similar, it is not indeterminate.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas nyid yin du zin na yang skyed par byed pa dang gnas par byed pa dang 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas nyid yin du zin na yang skyed par byed pa dang gnas par byed pa dang 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag
translated: If arising and so on were the conditioned itself, they would be the characteristics of the conditioned because they generate, endure, and disintegrate.

original: 'di snyam du skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po de dag 'dus byas nyid yin du zin na yang gzhan skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di snyam du skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po de dag 'dus byas nyid yin du zin na yang gzhan skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba zhes bya zhing /
translated: If you think that those three characteristics of conditioned states such as arising and so on are conditioned states, then arising is said to generate other conditioned states,

original: gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa zhes bya la /
translated: endurance is said to endure them and

original: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: destruction is said to destroy them.

original: de lta na yang de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no snyam du sems shing de skad ces zer ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no snyam du sems shing de skad ces zer ba yin no //
translated: Even so, they are characteristics of conditioned states.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary states: That is mere assertion because it is not established.

original: khyod kyis smras pa'i don de la ni 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa'i don de la ni 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The meaning of your statement is that arising and so on are characteristics of conditioned states.

original: skyed par byed pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Since there is no example, this is mere assertion and therefore unacceptable.

original: skye ba ni skye ba yin la gnas pa ni gnas pa yin 'jig pa ni 'jig pa yin pa las /üîΩskye ba la sogs pa dag gi bya ba nyid la skur pa btab ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba yin la gnas pa ni gnas pa yin 'jig pa ni 'jig pa yin pa las / skye ba la sogs pa dag gi bya ba nyid la skur pa btab ste /
translated: Arising is arising, enduring is enduring, and ceasing is ceasing.

original: de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po @115a * //
analyzed: de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po @115a * //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by saying that if arising and so on are accepted as agents, then their activity is denied.

original: dag 'dod pa ltar skye ba la sogs pa de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs na de dag gi bya ba nyid la skur pa btab pa'i phyir de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: dag 'dod pa ltar skye ba la sogs pa de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs na de dag gi bya ba nyid la skur pa btab pa'i phyir de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par ston te /
translated: If arising and so on are accepted as agents in the way they are asserted by the opponent, then their activity is denied. Therefore they are not characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'di ltar yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du ni skye ba'i bya ba ni skye ba zhes bya la gnas pa'i bya ba yang gnas pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du ni skye ba'i bya ba ni skye ba zhes bya la gnas pa'i bya ba yang gnas pa zhes bya /
translated: In terms of worldly convention, the activity of arising is called arising, the activity of enduring is called enduring, and the activity of ceasing is called ceasing.

original: 'jig pa'i bya ba la 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin pa las /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bya ba la 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin pa las /
translated: The activity of disintegration is called disintegration.üîΩBut since the opponent asserts that arising and so on cause arising and so forth, they accept that they are agents.

original: pha rol po dag gis skye ba la sogs pa de dag skye bar byed pa la sogs par smras pas de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir de dag gi bya ba la skur pa btab pas de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis skye ba la sogs pa de dag skye bar byed pa la sogs par smras pas de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir de dag gi bya ba la skur pa btab pas de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin
translated: Therefore, since they deprecate the activity of those, they are not characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: no // de'i phyir tha snyad du yang byed pa po nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: no // de'i phyir tha snyad du yang byed pa po nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, conventionally, if they were agents, etc.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is stated because the validity of that is taught.

original: skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Arising is not a characteristic of conditioned phenomena

original: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: because it is an agent, for example, like a father who is not the characteristic of his son.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na pha ni bu skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na pha ni bu skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example. For example, a father is not the characteristic of a son because he generates the son. In the same way, arising is not a characteristic of the produced because it generates the produced.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, endurance is not a characteristic of the produced because it endures the produced.

original: gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na zas lus gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na zas lus gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin nam /
translated: For example, food is not a characteristic of the body because it endures the body.

original: bran mo bum thogs ma bum pa 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bran mo bum thogs ma bum pa 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: For example, the four foods are not characteristics of the body because they maintain the body, and the female slave who carries the water pot is not a characteristic of the pot because she sets it down.üîΩFor example, the four foods are not characteristics of the body because they maintain the body, and the female slave who carries the water pot is not a characteristic of the pot because she sets it down.

original: dper na zas bzhi ni lus gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang / chu chun ma la sogs pa bran mo bum thogs ma dag kyang bum pa 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du gnas pa yang gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na zas bzhi ni lus gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang / chu chun ma la sogs pa bran mo bum thogs ma dag kyang bum pa 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du gnas pa yang gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, endurance is not a characteristic of conditioned states because it endures.

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, destruction is not a characteristic of conditioned states because it is destruction.

original: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na tho bas 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can @115b dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na tho ba ni 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na tho bas 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can @115b dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na tho ba ni 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property to be proven, and the example are applied in order. For example, a hammer is not the characteristic of a pot because it is a destroyer. Likewise, destruction is not the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon because it is a destroyer.

original: yin no // de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te
translated: Therefore, since arising and so on are not established as the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, the meaning of the reason is either not established or contradictory. This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

original: de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag na re don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yodüîΩpa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag na re don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the opponent says that ultimately conditioned phenomena, such as the aggregates, elements, and bases, are apprehended as having the nature of conditioned phenomena.üîΩBecause they possess the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, such as arising.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de don dam par sgrub na ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de don dam par sgrub na ni ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the meaning of that reason is established ultimately, it is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If it is established conventionally, it is contradictory.üîΩTherefore, one who wishes to completely avoid the faults mentioned should not understand that arising is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: de lta bas na ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas skye ba 'dus byas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas skye ba 'dus byas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa ste /
translated: This is the addition.

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were a conditioned phenomenon,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
translated: it would possess three characteristics.

original: zhes bya bas gal te skye ba 'dus byas yin na de yang mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur bas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo zhes ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas skye ba 'dus byas yin no zhes bya baüîΩde ltar shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gal te skye ba 'dus byas yin na de yang mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur bas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo zhes ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas skye ba 'dus byas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to completely avoid the error stated should not assert that arising is conditioned.

original: de ltar re zhig skye ba 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i skyon bstan zin to zhes bya bas ni brtag pa snga ma shos kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skye ba 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i skyon bstan zin to zhes bya bas ni brtag pa snga ma shos kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated that if arising were conditioned, the error of its being untenable as the characteristic of conditioned phenomena would ensue.

original: da ni brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: da ni brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the latter alternative, if one who wishes to completely avoid the error stated asserts that arising is unconditioned,

original: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
translated: then how could it be the characteristic of conditioned phenomena?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: And so on.

original: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas pa yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi rung bas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas don ma grub
analyzed: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas pa yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi rung bas mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas don ma grub
translated: But if arising were unconditioned, it would not be suitable as a characteristic of conditioned phenomena, because it would be devoid of a characteristic.

original: pas don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid @116a * //üîΩdag yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: pas don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid @116a * // dag yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause arising and so on are characteristics of conditioned phenomena,‚Äù is not established, it demonstrates that ultimately conditioned phenomena, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, do not have the entity of conditioned phenomena.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir skye ba la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid med de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir skye ba la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid med de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúArising is not a characteristic of conditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas ni rang nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rang nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that unconditioned phenomena do not exist.

original: de nyid tshad mas bsgrub pa'i phyir yang na 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni 'dus ma byas nyid yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de nyid tshad mas bsgrub pa'i phyir yang na 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni 'dus ma byas nyid yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to establish that by means of a valid cognition, he says, ‚ÄúOr else, because an unconditioned phenomenon is unconditioned.‚Äù

original: skye ba 'dus ma byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'dus ma byas nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye ba 'dus ma byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'dus ma byas nyid yin no //
translated: If arising were unconditioned, the reason that proves it is not a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon is that it is itself unconditioned.

original: don dam par skye ba 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par skye ba 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: Arising that is ultimately unconditioned is not suitable to be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon.üîΩBecause it is unconditioned, like space, it is illogical to say that it is a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon.

original: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dag la gnod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dag la gnod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, predicate, reason, example, and conclusion are applied in order.üîΩFor example, space is not suitable to be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon because it is unconditioned.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin
translated: In the same way, arising that is unconditioned is not suitable to be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon because it is unconditioned.

original: no // skye ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nyid gzung ba'i phyir gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis kyang nye bar blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: no // skye ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nyid gzung ba'i phyir gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis kyang nye bar blangs pa yin te /
translated: Since arising is taken as the mode of the term ‚Äúcharacteristic,‚Äù endurance and destruction are also included.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the opponent asserts that they are characteristics of conditioned states,üîΩthose two are also negated in the same way, so it is unnecessary to state their negation.

original: de gnyis kyang de bzhin du dgag pa yin pas yang de gnyis dgag pa brjod mi dgos so zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid gsum dgag pa 'dra bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang de bzhin du dgag pa yin pas yang de gnyis dgag pa brjod mi dgos so zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid gsum dgag pa 'dra bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is an explanation that demonstrates the similarity of the negation of the three characteristics, such as arising,

original: 'dir skye ba 'ba' zhig gi dbang du byas te bshad pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba 'ba' zhig gi dbang du byas te bshad pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: and here, the explanation from the perspective of arising alone is merely an illustration, since it includes the mode of the term ‚Äúcharacteristic.‚Äù

original: des gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis kyang nye bar blangs pa yin te de gnyis kyang pha rol po dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis kyang nye bar blangs pa yin te de gnyis kyang pha rol po dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since endurance and destruction are also included, since the opponent asserts that they are characteristics of conditioned states,

original: de gnyis kyang skye ba bzhin du 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas yin na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad par dgag pa yin pas yang de gnyis logs shig tu dgag pa brjod mi dgos so //üîΩyang gzhan yang 'di la skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du brtag par bya na de dag so so 'am 'dus pa la brtag grang na zhes bya ba ni yang rnam pa gzhan du na pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar skye
analyzed: de gnyis kyang skye ba bzhin du 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas yin na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad par dgag pa yin pas yang de gnyis logs shig tu dgag pa brjod mi dgos so // yang gzhan yang 'di la skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du brtag par bya na de dag so so 'am 'dus pa la brtag grang na zhes bya ba ni yang rnam pa gzhan du na pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar skye
translated: Also, if those two were like arising, they would be either compounded or uncompounded. But since it is untenable that they are characteristics of a compounded phenomenon, it is unnecessary to state a separate refutation of those two.üîΩMoreover, if these arising, etc., are to be investigated as the characteristics of a compounded phenomenon, are they to be investigated as occurring sequentially or as occurring simultaneously in a single entity?

original: ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'dus @116b byas kyi mtshan nyid du brtag par bya na de dag rim gyis 'byung ba la brtag gam /üîΩ'on te dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu 'byung ba la brtag grang na gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'dus @116b byas kyi mtshan nyid du brtag par bya na de dag rim gyis 'byung ba la brtag gam /üîΩ'on te dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu 'byung ba la brtag grang na gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: If, as the opponent asserts, these arising, etc., are to be investigated as the characteristics of a compounded phenomenon, are they to be investigated as occurring sequentially or as occurring simultaneously in a single entity?üîΩIt is shown that both are untenable.

original: de ni re zhig brtag pa snga ma ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs gsum so sos //
analyzed: de ni re zhig brtag pa snga ma ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs gsum so sos //
translated: The three, arising and so on,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid bya bar ni //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid bya bar ni //
translated: are not individually capable of acting as the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: nus min / skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag so sos ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: nus min / skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag so sos ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus te /
translated: The three, arising and so on, are not individually capable of acting as the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'di ltar lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid 'dus pa dag gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshon par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid 'dus pa dag gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshon par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The intention is that the basis characterized, a cow, for example, is indicated by the collection of characteristics, such as a dewlap.

original: 'di ltar yang 'jig rten la grag pa'i tshul ni lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid 'dus pa dag gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang mtshon par nus pa yin pas skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag so sos ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid byar miüîΩnus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'jig rten la grag pa'i tshul ni lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid 'dus pa dag gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang mtshon par nus pa yin pas skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag so sos ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid byar miüîΩnus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that the basis characterized, a cow, for example, is indicated by the collection of characteristics, such as a dewlap.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba nyid du khas len na yang 'di ltar dngos po ma skyes pa la ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag med pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba ni skye
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba nyid du khas len na yang 'di ltar dngos po ma skyes pa la ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag med pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba ni skye
translated: If you accept that arising and so on occur sequentially, then since an unarisen thing has no arising, enduring, or disintegrating, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena would lack the power to act.

original: ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba nyid du khas len na yang 'di ltar re zhig dngos po ma skyes pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag med pas de dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba nyid du khas len na yang 'di ltar re zhig dngos po ma skyes pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag med pas de dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste /
translated: If you accept that arising and so on occur sequentially, then since an unarisen thing has no arising, enduring, or disintegrating, they would not occur sequentially.

original: 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag ni dngos po la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag ni dngos po la brten pa yin te /
translated: In this way, arising and so on are dependent on things.

original: bum pa'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: bum pa'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya na /
translated: If the arising, enduring, and disintegrating of a vase are called the arising, enduring, and disintegrating of a vase,

original: bum pa de ma skyes pa la ni skye ba la sogs pa dag med pas de dag so sos bum pa ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bum pa de ma skyes pa la ni skye ba la sogs pa dag med pas de dag so sos bum pa ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
translated: then since arising and so on do not exist for an unarisen vase, they cannot individually characterize an unarisen vase.

original: 'gags pa la yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag med pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'gags pa la yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa med
analyzed: 'gags pa la yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag med pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'gags pa la yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa med
translated: Because a basis of those characteristics does not exist in that which has ceased, arising, enduring, and disintegrating do not exist. Therefore, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena do not have the power to function.üîΩArising, enduring, and disintegrating do not occur sequentially in a thing that has ceased because that which is called ‚Äúceased‚Äù is destroyed and does not exist.

original: pas de dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste 'di ltar 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni zhig cing med pa yin pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir de la skye ba la sogs pa dag med pas de dag so sos dngos po 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid bya barüîΩmi nus so //
analyzed: pas de dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste 'di ltar 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni zhig cing med pa yin pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir de la skye ba la sogs pa dag med pas de dag so sos dngos po 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Since a basis of those characteristics does not exist, arising and so on do not exist. Therefore, each of them is not able to function as the characteristic of a thing that has ceased.üîΩBecause that which has arisen does not arise again.

original: skyes pa la ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po la skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa la yang skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: skyes pa la ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po la skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa la yang skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste /
translated: Arising and so on do not occur sequentially in a thing that has arisen and not ceased.

original: 'di ltar bum pa'i dngos po skyes pa dang ma 'gags @117a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa'i dngos po skyes pa dang ma 'gags @117a * //
translated: This is because a vase that has arisen and not ceased

original: pa la ni yang skye ba med pa'i phyir gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pas de dag so sos 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: pa la ni yang skye ba med pa'i phyir gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pas de dag so sos 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Because that which is already arisen does not arise again, that which is already ceased does not cease again, and that which is already enduring does not endure again, therefore, since enduring and cessation do not exist, they cannot individually function as characteristics of conditioned states.

original: gnas pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po gnas pa la yang skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnas pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po gnas pa la yang skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis mi 'byung ste /
translated: Because cessation is not possible for that which is enduring.üîΩAlso, arising and so on do not occur sequentially for a thing that is enduring.

original: 'di ltar bum pa'i dngos po gnas pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas par 'gyur ba yang med pas de dag so sos 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa'i dngos po gnas pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas par 'gyur ba yang med pas de dag so sos 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Because cessation is not possible for a thing that is enduring, arising and enduring do not exist. Therefore, they cannot individually function as characteristics of conditioned states.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re de ltar khyod kyis gnas pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pas de la 'gag pa mi srid kyang bla ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re de ltar khyod kyis gnas pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pas de la 'gag pa mi srid kyang bla ste /
translated: Here, others say: In that case, since you have said, ‚ÄúBecause cessation is not possible for that which is enduring,‚Äù then it is acceptable that cessation is not possible for that which is enduring.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yod par khas blangs pas mtshan nyid gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yod par khas blangs pas mtshan nyid gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The earlier position that was implied, namely, that since the characteristic of endurance is accepted as existent, another characteristic would also exist, is answered here by the author of the commentary.

original: gnas pa ni mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause endurance is related to impermanence.‚Äù

original: dngos po gnas pa'i dus na yang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid med de mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa'i dus na yang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid med de mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even at the time when things endure, the characteristic of endurance does not exist because it is related to impermanence.

original: de nyid khungs bstan pa'i phyir de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon 'phags pa lhas dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgya pa las gsungs pa gzhung 'og ma dag bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid khungs bstan pa'i phyir de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon 'phags pa lhas dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgya pa las gsungs pa gzhung 'og ma dag bstan to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, the master ƒÄryadeva says in the following passages from the treatise called the Hundred, beginning with ‚ÄúThus,‚Äù which are cited in the text below.

original: gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How can there be an entity without endurance?

original: ces bya ba ni gnas pa med pa dngos po nyid kyang ga la yod de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / mi rtag pas na ga la gnas //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gnas pa med pa dngos po nyid kyang ga la yod de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / mi rtag pas na ga la gnas //
translated: How can there be a thing that is non-abiding? There is none.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pas na ga la yod de med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pas na ga la yod de med do //
translated: Since it is impermanent, how can there be abiding? There is none.

original: gal te dang po gnas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te dang po gnas gyur na //
translated: If it were to abide from the beginning,

original: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not age at the end.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te dang po nyid nas mi rtag pa nyid med de gnas par gyur na ni des na tha mar yang rnyings par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ma yin te dang po nas mi rtag pas rtag pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te dang po nyid nas mi rtag pa nyid med de gnas par gyur na ni des na tha mar yang rnyings par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ma yin te dang po nas mi rtag pas rtag pa med par bstan to //
translated: If it were to abide from the beginning, not being impermanent, then it would not age at the end. But that is not so. It is shown that there is no permanence because of impermanence from the beginning.

original: gal te de ltar na mi rtag pa nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mi rtag pa nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then impermanence exists.

original: de'i lan du /üîΩgal te khor zug mi rtag yod //üîΩkhor zug gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lan du / gal te khor zug mi rtag yod // khor zug gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In response to that, it is said:üîΩIf there were permanent impermanence,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: there would be permanent abiding.

original: gal te khor zug tu mi rtag pa yod na khor zug tu gnas par ye mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas mi rtag pa yang med do //
analyzed: gal te khor zug tu mi rtag pa yod na khor zug tu gnas par ye mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas mi rtag pa yang med do //
translated: If impermanence existed from the beginning, it would never remain. But since that is not the case, impermanence also does not exist.

original: gal te de lta na rtag pa nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rtag pa nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, permanence exists.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: yang na rtag par gyur pa las //
analyzed: yang na rtag par gyur pa las //
translated: If it were permanent,

original: phyis ni mi rtag par yang 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis ni mi rtag par yang 'gyur //
translated: later it would become impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba smras te rtag pa nyid yod na da ltar mi rtag @117b pa snang bas dang po rtag par gyur ba las phyis mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas rtag pa yang med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te rtag pa nyid yod na da ltar mi rtag @117b pa snang bas dang po rtag par gyur ba las phyis mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas rtag pa yang med do //
translated: If permanence existed, since impermanence would appear now, the error would arise that it would become impermanent later, having been permanent from the beginning. Therefore permanence also does not exist.

original: ci ste mi rtag pa nyid dang dngos po snga phyi med de lhan cig nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste mi rtag pa nyid dang dngos po snga phyi med de lhan cig nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If impermanence and the thing are not sequential, but you imagine that they exist simultaneously, that is also untenable.üîΩIf a thing and impermanence

original: gal te dngos po mi rtag dang // lhan cig gnas par yod gyur na //üîΩmi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: gal te dngos po mi rtag dang // lhan cig gnas par yod gyur na // mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
translated: existed simultaneously,üîΩimpermanence would be false,

original: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: or permanence would be false.

original: de ltar re zhig rtag pa snga ma shos bstan zin to //üîΩda ni brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir ci ste skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod na de lta na yang /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rtag pa snga ma shos bstan zin to // da ni brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir ci ste skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod na de lta na yang /
translated: Thus, first of all, permanence is refuted.

original: 'dus pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'dus pa yin na yang /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the latter refutation, he says, ‚ÄúBut if arising, etc., are accepted as the characteristics of the conditioned, even though they are assembled,

original: gcig la dus gcig ci ltar rung /üîΩde dag 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi dngos po gcig la dus gcig na med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig ci ltar rung / de dag 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi dngos po gcig la dus gcig na med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: how could they be assembled in one thing at one time?‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag 'dus pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag 'dus pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par ston to //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the three, arising, etc., are not the characteristics of the conditioned even though they are assembled.

original: gal te de ci ltar nges par gzung bar bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ci ltar nges par gzung bar bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow can that be ascertained?‚Äù this is a question from the opponent.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúIf they are assembled, they are not the characteristics of the conditioned.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig pa shin tu mi mthun pa nyid dag dngos po gang yang rung ba cig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar ni sems bde bar gnas pa dag gis brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig pa shin tu mi mthun pa nyid dag dngos po gang yang rung ba cig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar ni sems bde bar gnas pa dag gis brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is illogical for those who are sane to conceive that the incompatible states of arising, enduring, and disintegrating occur simultaneously in any one thing.

original: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu de gsum 'byung ba ni smyos pa dang gdon gyis brlams pa ma gtogs pa sems bde bar gnas pa dag gis brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu de gsum 'byung ba ni smyos pa dang gdon gyis brlams pa ma gtogs pa sems bde bar gnas pa dag gis brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is illogical for those who are sane to conceive that those three occur simultaneously in one thing, except for those who are insane or possessed by spirits.

original: mdo sde pa dag gis smras pa rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthu las 'byung ba'i rgyud la dus gcig kho nar dngos po skye bar 'dod pa ma byung ba las 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag gis smras pa rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthu las 'byung ba'i rgyud la dus gcig kho nar dngos po skye bar 'dod pa ma byung ba las 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba yin la /
translated: The Sautrantikas say: We assert that things arise simultaneously in a continuum due to the power of the individual determination of causes and conditions. That which arises from what has not yet occurred is arising.

original: skad cig ma snga ma'i rgyud kyis nges par gnas pa yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma'i rgyud kyis nges par gnas pa yin /
translated: It definitely endures due to the continuum of the previous moment.

original: skad cig ma snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid ni rga ba yin /üîΩbyung nas bral ba ni 'jig pa yin pas de ltar ltos pa nges pas skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma gcig la dus gcig na yod pas sgrub pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir mdoüîΩsde pa dag na re dngos po rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthu las 'byung ba'i rgyud gcig la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po dag skad cig ma gcig la dus gcig kho nar yod pas khyed dbu ma @118a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid ni rga ba yin / byung nas bral ba ni 'jig pa yin pas de ltar ltos pa nges pas skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma gcig la dus gcig na yod pas sgrub pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde pa dag na re dngos po rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthu las 'byung ba'i rgyud gcig la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po dag skad cig ma gcig la dus gcig kho nar yod pas khyed dbu ma @118a * //
translated: The separation after having arisen is destruction.üîΩThus, since the necessity of dependence is definite, the characteristics of the produced, such as arising, exist simultaneously in one moment.üîΩThe Sautrantikas say: The four characteristics of the produced exist simultaneously in one moment in a single continuum that arises from the power of causes and conditions that are individually ascertained.üîΩYou Madhyamikas say that it is illogical for the three extremely incompatible states of arising, enduring and disintegrating to occur simultaneously in any single thing, but

original: pa na re 'di ltar skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig pa shin tu mi mthun pa nyid dag dngos po gang yang rung ba cig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar ni sems bde bar gnas pa dag gis brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i
analyzed: pa na re 'di ltar skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig pa shin tu mi mthun pa nyid dag dngos po gang yang rung ba cig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar ni sems bde bar gnas pa dag gis brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i

original: sgrub pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: But we do not refute such an assertion.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such a statement, the author of the commentary states:

original: de ltar yongs su rtog na yang /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rtog na yang /
translated: Even though you conceive of them in this way,

original: rgyud rdzas su med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rgyud rdzas su med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: because the continuum is not substantially existent, etc.

original: mdo sde pa khyed de ltar yongs su rtog na khyed kyis kyang de mi rung bar shes pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa khyed de ltar yongs su rtog na khyed kyis kyang de mi rung bar shes pa'i rigs te /
translated: If you Sautrantikas conceive of them in this way, you should understand that this is also untenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po rdzas su gyur pa 'ba' zhig yod na ni des na de'i rgyud gcig la skye ba la sogs pa dag brtag tu yang rung grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po rdzas su gyur pa 'ba' zhig yod na ni des na de'i rgyud gcig la skye ba la sogs pa dag brtag tu yang rung grang na /
translated: If only substantially existent things exist, then it would be tenable to investigate whether arising, etc. exist in the same continuum.

original: khyed ni skad cig mar smra ba yin pas rgyud rdzas su med pa'i phyir ji ltar mtshan nyid gsum po dag rgyud gcig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar rigs te mi rigs so //
analyzed: khyed ni skad cig mar smra ba yin pas rgyud rdzas su med pa'i phyir ji ltar mtshan nyid gsum po dag rgyud gcig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar rigs te mi rigs so //
translated: But you assert that things are momentary and because the continuum is not substantially existent, how could the three characteristics be logically found in the same continuum at the same time? It is illogical.

original: ltos pas skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na skye ba'i gnas skabs la ltos nas skye bar rtog cing skyes pa
analyzed: ltos pas skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na skye ba'i gnas skabs la ltos nas skye bar rtog cing skyes pa
translated: If arising is conceived in dependence on the phase of arising,

original: la ltos nas gnas pa rtog la /
analyzed: la ltos nas gnas pa rtog la /
translated: enduring is conceived in dependence on that which has arisen,

original: gnas pa la ltos nas 'jig par rtog na de lta na ltos pas skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa la ltos nas 'jig par rtog na de lta na ltos pas skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin te /
translated: and destruction is conceived in dependence on enduring, then because arising, enduring and so on are conceived in dependence, the three characteristics are conventional, not ultimate.

original: dper na thung ngu la ltos nas ring po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na thung ngu la ltos nas ring po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like long in dependence on short.

original: ci'i phyir don dam pa pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don dam pa pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not ultimate?

original: de'i phyir gnas pa'i dus na yang de dang mi mthun pa 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa'i dus na yang de dang mi mthun pa 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To answer that, he says, because even at the time of enduring, that which is incompatible with it, destruction, does not exist.

original: skye ba'i dus dang gnas pa'i dus na yang de gnyis dang mi mthun pa 'jig pa med la /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus dang gnas pa'i dus na yang de gnyis dang mi mthun pa 'jig pa med la /
translated: At the time of arising and at the time of enduring, those two do not exist, since they are incompatible with disintegration.

original: 'jig pa'i dus na yang de dang mi mthun pa skye ba dang gnas pa gnyis med pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag cig la dus gcig na med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus na yang de dang mi mthun pa skye ba dang gnas pa gnyis med pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag cig la dus gcig na med do //
translated: And at the time of disintegration, those two are not present, since they are incompatible with disintegration. Therefore the three characteristics do not exist at the same time.

original: de yang skyon sngar bstan pa las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang skyon sngar bstan pa las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is a summary of the refutation.

original: mod sde pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: mod sde pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa de yang ngo //
translated: The Vatsiputrƒ´yas say: That which is imputed by the Vatsiputriyas is also.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re dngos po sngon ma byung ba las bdag nyid thob pa ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re dngos po sngon ma byung ba las bdag nyid thob pa ni skye ba yin la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Arising is the acquisition of an entity‚Äôs own nature that did not previously exist.

original: skye ba gnas pa ni gnas pa yin /
analyzed: skye ba gnas pa ni gnas pa yin /
translated: Enduring is the abiding of that which has arisen.

original: gnas pa rnyings pa nyid ni rga ba yin /
analyzed: gnas pa rnyings pa nyid ni rga ba yin /
translated: Aging is the change in that which abides.

original: rgas pa 'gag pa @118b 'jig pa yin pas skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba nyid 'dus byas nyid las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir de dag mtshan nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: rgas pa 'gag pa @118b 'jig pa yin pas skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba nyid 'dus byas nyid las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir de dag mtshan nyid du grub pas /
translated: Since disintegration is the cessation of that which has aged, arising and so on occur sequentially. Since there is no error in the conditioned, they are established as characteristics.

original: skye ba la sogs gsum so sos //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs gsum so sos //
translated: The three such as arising are not

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid bya bar ni //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid bya bar ni //
translated: Capable of acting as characteristics of conditioned states.üîΩThis is illogical.

original: nus min / zhes smras pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po dag skad cig ma re re la rim gyis 'byung ba nyid mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'dus byas las
analyzed: nus min / zhes smras pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po dag skad cig ma re re la rim gyis 'byung ba nyid mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'dus byas las
translated: Here Vaibhasikas say: The four characteristics of conditioned states arise in sequence in each moment.

original: mtshan nyid yin par 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir de dag mtshan nyid nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir de dag mtshan nyid nyid du grub pas /
translated: Since there is no confusion that the characteristics arise from the basis of characteristics, they are established as characteristics.

original: dbu ma pas skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag so sos 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so zhes smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma pas skye ba la sogs pa gsum po dag so sos 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so zhes smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it is illogical for Madhyamikas to say the three such as arising are not capable of acting as characteristics of conditioned states.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary says: This is illogical.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gang yin pa las nam yang 'khrul par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gang yin pa las nam yang 'khrul par mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, that which is called a characteristic never errs from the basis of those characteristics.

original: dper na sra ba nyid sa las 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dag skyes bu chen po las 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na sra ba nyid sa las 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dag skyes bu chen po las 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, solidity does not err from earth, and the marks of a great being do not err from a great being.

original: yang 'jig rten grags pa'i tshul ni de lta bu yin na /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten grags pa'i tshul ni de lta bu yin na /
translated: If the mode of the world is like that,

original: khyed kyis mtshan nyid bzhi po dag skad cig ma re re la rim gyis 'byung bar smos pas skad cig ma gcig la mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gang byung ba de la mtshan nyid gzhan med pas de dag mtshan nyid kyi gzhi las 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir 'dus
analyzed: khyed kyis mtshan nyid bzhi po dag skad cig ma re re la rim gyis 'byung bar smos pas skad cig ma gcig la mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gang byung ba de la mtshan nyid gzhan med pas de dag mtshan nyid kyi gzhi las 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir 'dus
translated: then since you say that the four characteristics arise sequentially in each moment, since another characteristic does not exist in that which arises as the basis of those characteristics in a single moment, they would err from the basis of those characteristics.

original: byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas khyed kyi sgrub pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas khyed kyi sgrub pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since they are not the characteristics of conditioned states, your proof is illogical.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag ni dngos po rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag ni dngos po rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi rung ste /
translated: ultimately, arising and so on are not suitable as the characteristics of the conditioned of things,üîΩbecause they occur sequentially, just as the specific states of clay, lump, spinningüîΩwheel, attachment to the form of a vase, and the completed vase are not the

original: rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'jim pa dang gong bu dang smyad pa dang glebs pa dang bcum pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag bum pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'jim pa dang gong bu dang smyad pa dang glebs pa dang bcum pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag bum pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: characteristics of the conditioned of the vase.üîΩThe subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, the specific states of clay and so on are not the characteristics

original: dper na 'jim pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin te /
translated: of the conditioned of the vase, because they occur sequentially.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni dang po 'jim pa'i gnas skabs @119a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni dang po 'jim pa'i gnas skabs @119a * //
translated: For example, first, the vase is in the state of clay, then in the state of a lump,üîΩthen in the state of spinning on the wheel, then in the state of attachment toüîΩthe form of a vase, and finally in the state of completion.

original: yin la / de'i 'og tu 'jim pa las mchod rten 'dra bar gong bur byed do //
analyzed: yin la / de'i 'og tu 'jim pa las mchod rten 'dra bar gong bur byed do //
translated: and then, from that, a lump of clay like a stupa.

original: de'i 'og tu gong bu las spyi bo lag pas smyad de zhi ba'i mtshan 'dra bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gong bu las spyi bo lag pas smyad de zhi ba'i mtshan 'dra bar byed do //
translated: Then, from that lump, he makes a head with his hands, like the sign of peace.

original: de'i 'og tu smyad pa de'i steng nas glebs te gdugs 'dra bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu smyad pa de'i steng nas glebs te gdugs 'dra bar byed do //
translated: Then, from that head, he makes a parasol-like shape with his hands.üîΩThen, from that shape, he makes a winnowing basket-like shape with his hands.

original: de'i 'og tu glebs pa de las dkyil du lag pa bcug ste kha bcum nas sbyang 'dra bar byed de 'jim pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par de dag rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin pa de bzhin
analyzed: de'i 'og tu glebs pa de las dkyil du lag pa bcug ste kha bcum nas sbyang 'dra bar byed de 'jim pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par de dag rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin pa de bzhin
translated: Since these particular states of clay, etc., occur in sequence, arising, etc., are not the characteristics of the produced of a pot.

original: du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: In the same way, since arising, etc., occur in sequence, they cannot be the characteristics of the produced of things.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni 'khrul pa med de /
translated: Arising, etc., are not erroneous.

original: 'dus ma byas la de dag med pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag yang skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'dus byas la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid nyid yin par
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la de dag med pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag yang skye ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis 'byung yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'dus byas la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid nyid yin par
translated: This is a statement that proves that arising and so on are characteristics because they are not confused about conditioned states, the basis of those characteristics, even though they arise sequentially.

original: sgrub pa'i tshig yin te de dag na re khyed dbu ma pas skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa yod pas de dag mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes smras pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i tshig yin te de dag na re khyed dbu ma pas skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa yod pas de dag mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes smras pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: They say that you MƒÅdhyamikas say that arising and so on are not characteristics because they are confused about conditioned states, but that is not so.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs la yang yod na ni des na de dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin no zhes smra bar yang rigs pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs la yang yod na ni des na de dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid ma yin no zhes smra bar yang rigs pa zhig na /
translated: If arising and so on also existed in the unconditioned, then it would be correct to say that they are not characteristics of conditioned states because they are confused about conditioned states.

original: skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs la med pa'i phyir des na de dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa med pas rim gyis 'byung yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs la med pa'i phyir des na de dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa med pas rim gyis 'byung yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because birth and so on do not exist in the unconditioned, they are not confused about conditioned states. Therefore, even though they occur sequentially, they are characteristics of conditioned states.

original: de skad ces zer ba'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis nye bar brtags pa yin gyi don dam par yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis nye bar brtags pa yin gyi don dam par yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThis is a hypothetical response, but it is not ultimately tenable.‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus ma byas la med du zin kyang gal te dngos po gcig gi rgyud la dus gcig na gsum char yod na ni des na de dag 'dus byas la 'khrul pa med do zhes brjod par rigs shing de dag 'dus byas kyi
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus ma byas la med du zin kyang gal te dngos po gcig gi rgyud la dus gcig na gsum char yod na ni des na de dag 'dus byas la 'khrul pa med do zhes brjod par rigs shing de dag 'dus byas kyi
translated: Even though birth and so on do not exist in unconditioned states, if all three existed in the continuum of a single thing at one time, then it would be logical to say that they are not confused about conditioned states.

original: mtshan nyid nyid yin par yang 'gyur grang na de lta ma yin pa de dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid nyid yin par yang 'gyur grang na de lta ma yin pa de dag 'dus byas las 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: If you think that they are characteristics because they exist in conditioned phenomena, then they are not characteristics of conditioned phenomena because they are mistaken with respect to conditioned phenomena.

original: ci ste 'dus ma byas la de dag med pa'i phyir 'dus byas la rim gyis 'byung @119b yang mtshan nyid nyid yin par rtog na ni nye bar brtags pa yin gyi don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'dus ma byas la de dag med pa'i phyir 'dus byas la rim gyis 'byung @119b yang mtshan nyid nyid yin par rtog na ni nye bar brtags pa yin gyi don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that they are characteristics because they exist in conditioned phenomena, but not in unconditioned phenomena, then they are imputed, but they do not exist ultimately.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang ma skyes pa la gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang ma skyes pa la gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because arising is refuted and that which has not arisen does not endure or disintegrate.

original: skye ba'i dus na yang gnas pa med pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i bdag nyid de dag ni de dag gi bdag nyid ma yin pas de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i dus na yang skye ba gnas pa dang 'jig pa
analyzed: skye ba'i dus na yang gnas pa med pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i bdag nyid de dag ni de dag gi bdag nyid ma yin pas de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i dus na yang skye ba gnas pa dang 'jig pa
translated: At the time of arising, they do not have the nature of enduring and disintegrating. Since they do not have that nature, they do not possess it.

original: med pa'i bdag nyid can ni gnas pa dang 'jig pa de dag gi bdag nyid ma yin pa skye ba de gnas pa dang 'jig pa de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //üîΩphyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis de dag gi bdag nyid can nyid du rtog na yang tha snyad tsam du zad pas ci skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas la mtshan nyid gsum da ltar med kyang /
analyzed: med pa'i bdag nyid can ni gnas pa dang 'jig pa de dag gi bdag nyid ma yin pa skye ba de gnas pa dang 'jig pa de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no // phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis de dag gi bdag nyid can nyid du rtog na yang tha snyad tsam du zad pas ci skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas la mtshan nyid gsum da ltar med kyang /
translated: That which has the nature of nonexistence is not the nature of endurance and destruction, because arising is not endowed with those two, endurance and destruction. Therefore those two are not the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.üîΩIf you imagine that they have the nature of those two by way of arising later, that is just a convention, and therefore the fault stated above is not averted.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid gsum po de dag gi bdag nyid can nyid du rtog na yang tha snyad tsam du zad pas de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid gsum po de dag gi bdag nyid can nyid du rtog na yang tha snyad tsam du zad pas de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
translated: Although the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena do not exist in the present, if you imagine that they have the nature of those three characteristics by way of arising later, that is just a convention, and therefore the fault stated above is not averted.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag so so dang 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma ldog go zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /üîΩde ltar mtshan nyid yod par ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis sngar don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag so so dang 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma ldog go zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te / de ltar mtshan nyid yod par ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis sngar don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since arising and so on are not established as the characteristics of the conditioned individually or collectively, the fault of the reason remains unresolved.üîΩThis is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.üîΩSince characteristics are not established in that way, the previous argument of the opponent that ‚Äúultimately conditioned phenomena, the aggregates, elements, and bases, are only to be apprehended as having the nature of conditioned phenomena

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub par sngar bstan pa'i skyon de nyid ma ldog par so na gnas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub par sngar bstan pa'i skyon de nyid ma ldog par so na gnas so //
translated: because they possess arising and so on, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena‚Äù is not established. The fault previously explained remains unresolved.

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya bas ni skye ba la sogs pa gang dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dus bstan pa de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod dam 'on te med ces gal te gnyis su brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya bas ni skye ba la sogs pa gang dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dus bstan pa de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod dam 'on te med ces gal te gnyis su brtag pa ston to //
translated: Moreover, by saying ‚ÄúFurthermore,‚Äù it shows that the analysis is twofold: whether arising, etc., which are taught as the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, have other characteristics or not.

original: de la brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the first of those analyses, he says:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //üîΩgal te yod na thug pa med //üîΩde la yang gzhan zhig yod cing de la yang @120a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni // gal te yod na thug pa med // de la yang gzhan zhig yod cing de la yang @120a * //
translated: If conditioned phenomena have other characteristics,üîΩThere would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yod de thug pa med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzhan yod de thug pa med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If they had other characteristics, there would be an infinite regress, because there would be other characteristics of those characteristics, and there would be other characteristics of those. That is unacceptable, so one should not assert that they possess arising, etc.

original: brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second analysis, he says:

original: ci ste de ltar gyur pa 'dod //
analyzed: ci ste de ltar gyur pa 'dod //
translated: If you assert that they are like that,

original: ces zer na /
analyzed: ces zer na /
translated: then he says:

original: de la yang de nyid bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang de nyid bzlas par bya ste /
translated: That should be repeated for that.

original: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If they do not have other characteristics, they are not conditioned phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba smras te ci ste thug pa med par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med par sems na de dag 'dus bas ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te ci ste thug pa med par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med par sems na de dag 'dus bas ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that it is unacceptable that there be an infinite regress, and that those formations do not have other characteristics of conditioned states, then they would not be conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas ma yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not conditioned states, they would not be characteristics of conditioned states.

original: ci ste skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas nyid yin par yang 'dod la /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas nyid yin par yang 'dod la /
translated: But if you assert that arising and so on are conditioned states,

original: thug pa med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te skye ba la sogs pa dag gis 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: thug pa med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te skye ba la sogs pa dag gis 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: then there would be no infinite regress, because the characteristics of conditioned states are those that characterize conditioned states as conditioned states by means of arising and so on.

original: dper na bkra shis pa dang mi shis pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin du 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med pas thug pa dang gnas pa dang mu thug de med par yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na bkra shis pa dang mi shis pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin du 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med pas thug pa dang gnas pa dang mu thug de med par yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, the characteristics of auspiciousness and inauspiciousness are not the characteristics of conditioned states, because there are no other characteristics of conditioned states. Therefore, there would be no infinite regress, no infinite duration, and no infinite repetition.

original: pha rol po dag na re skye ba la sogs pa dag la mtshan nyid gzhan med pas thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la de dag nyid kyis 'dus byas mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re skye ba la sogs pa dag la mtshan nyid gzhan med pas thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la de dag nyid kyis 'dus byas mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The opponent says: Since arising and so on do not have other characteristics, there is no infinite regress, and since they characterize conditioned phenomena, they are characteristics.

original: dper na bkra shis pa'i mtshan 'khor lo la sogs pa dang bkra mi shis pa'i mtshan dag mtshan gzhan med par thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la de dag nyid kyis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid byed pa yin pa bzhin no zhesüîΩzer ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na bkra shis pa'i mtshan 'khor lo la sogs pa dang bkra mi shis pa'i mtshan dag mtshan gzhan med par thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la de dag nyid kyis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid byed pa yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: For example, the characteristics of auspiciousness, such as a wheel, and inauspicious characteristics do not have other characteristics, so there is no infinite regress, and since they characterize the basis of characteristics, they are characteristics.üîΩIn response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni sngar ji ltar don dam par skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni sngar ji ltar don dam par skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that ultimately arising and so on are characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bstan pa bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin par 'dod par mi bya'o zhes smras so
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bstan pa bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin par 'dod par mi bya'o zhes smras so
translated: Since arising and so on are similar to that, therefore arising and so on should not be asserted to be conditioned in the ultimate.

original: // 'o na skye ba la sogs pa dag la mtshan nyid gzhan med pas 'dus byas kyang ma yin zhing thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la de dag nyid kyis 'dus byas mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid kyang yin no zhes zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: // 'o na skye ba la sogs pa dag la mtshan nyid gzhan med pas 'dus byas kyang ma yin zhing thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la de dag nyid kyis 'dus byas mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid kyang yin no zhes zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: But since arising and so on do not have other characteristics, they are not conditioned and there is no infinite regress, and since they are indicated by those characteristics, they are characteristics.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag @120b 'dus ma byas yin na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid du mi rung ste /
