analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag @120b 'dus ma byas yin na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: Arising and so on are not suitable to be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena even if they are unconditioned.

original: 'di ltar de'i lan kyang 'dir //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i lan kyang 'dir //
translated: In response to that, this is said:

original: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If they do not exist, they are not conditioned.

original: zhes bya bas btab zin to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas btab zin to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This response has already been given here.

original: de'i phyir yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang /
translated: Therefore this is also said:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog med do zhes bya ba na mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩbrtag pa gnyi ga'i sgo nas mtshan nyid yod par ma grub pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon sngar bstan pa nyid ldog pa med de so na gnas so /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog med do zhes bya ba na mjug bsdu ba yin te / brtag pa gnyi ga'i sgo nas mtshan nyid yod par ma grub pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon sngar bstan pa nyid ldog pa med de so na gnas so /
translated: The phrase the faults that have been taught cannot be averted is the conclusion.

original: // / bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
translated: Since the existence of the characteristics is not established by either of the two analyses, the previously explained fault that the opponent's reason is not established cannot be averted; it remains.

original: 'dir gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /üîΩskye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus byas kyang yin la thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan thos gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag na re skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid
analyzed: 'dir gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag gis smras pa / skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus byas kyang yin la thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan thos gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag na re skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid
translated: Here the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya say:üîΩArising, enduring, and disintegrating are conditioned phenomena, but it does not follow that there is an infinite regress.

original: dag la nye ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang yod la de dag gcig gis gcig la bya ba byed pas thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to //
analyzed: dag la nye ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang yod la de dag gcig gis gcig la bya ba byed pas thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to //
translated: This passage from the Commentary teaches the scriptural exegesis of the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya ≈õrƒÅvakas who say that arising and so on are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ces bya ba ni sngon kun du rgyu gnas pa zhes bya ba zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas des slob ma rnams la gang zag tu smra ba'i tshul bdag tu smra ba dang 'dra ba dag bstan
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ces bya ba ni sngon kun du rgyu gnas pa zhes bya ba zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas des slob ma rnams la gang zag tu smra ba'i tshul bdag tu smra ba dang 'dra ba dag bstan
translated: The Vatsiputrƒ´ya school is so called because in the past there was a wandering mendicant called Vatsiputra who went forth in the doctrine of the Buddha. He taught disciples a doctrine of the person that was similar to the doctrine of self.

original: pa de dag la gang dag ma bzhin du sems pa de dag gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa de dag la gang dag ma bzhin du sems pa de dag gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Those who thought of him as their mother were called the Vatsiputrƒ´ya school.

original: de dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir gal te ji ltar zhe na /üîΩgang gi phyir 'di la chos ni bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir gal te ji ltar zhe na / gang gi phyir 'di la chos ni bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate their texts, it says, ‚ÄúIf you ask how?‚Äù

original: chos de dang / de'i skye ba dang / de'i gnas pa dang / de'i 'jig pa dang / de'i ldan pa dang / de'i gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang / 'dir gal te chos de dkar po yin na de'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: chos de dang / de'i skye ba dang / de'i gnas pa dang / de'i 'jig pa dang / de'i ldan pa dang / de'i gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang / 'dir gal te chos de dkar po yin na de'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: Because fifteen things arise in this way: the phenomenon itself, its arising, its enduring, its impermanence, its possession, its transformation from abiding, its being white, its being black, its being pure, its being impure, its liberation, its nonliberation, its being conditioned, and its being unconditioned.

original: ci ste nag po yin na log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / gal te chos de nges par 'byung ba yin na de'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: ci ste nag po yin na log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / gal te chos de nges par 'byung ba yin na de'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: If that phenomenon is definite emergence, then its definite emergence arises.

original: ci ste nges par 'byung ba ma yin na nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid skye ste /
analyzed: ci ste nges par 'byung ba ma yin na nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid skye ste /
translated: But if it is not definite emergence, then its nondefinite emergence arises.

original: de dag ni 'khor zhes bya'o //üîΩda ni skye ba'i skye ba dang gnas pa'i gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i ldan pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am log pa'i rnam par grol ba'i @121a * //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor zhes bya'o // da ni skye ba'i skye ba dang gnas pa'i gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i ldan pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am log pa'i rnam par grol ba'i @121a * //
translated: These are called the cycle.

original: log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba nyid dam nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyang skye ste /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba nyid dam nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyang skye ste /
translated: Now, the arising of arising, the endurance of endurance, the destruction of destruction, the possession of possession, the transformation of transformation, the right liberation of right liberation, the perverted liberation of perverted liberation, the definite emergence of definite emergence, and the nondefinite emergence of nondefinite emergence arise.

original: de dag ni 'khor gyi 'khor zhes bya ste de ltar chos bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor gyi 'khor zhes bya ste de ltar chos bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye'o //
translated: These are called the retinue of the retinue. Thus fifteen things arise.

original: de la rtsa ba'i skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi skyed par byed do //
translated: In this regard, the primary origination generates fourteen things, excluding itself.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de 'ba' zhig skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de 'ba' zhig skyed par byed do //
translated: The origination of origination generates just that primary origination.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa dag kyang de bzhin pas thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa dag kyang de bzhin pas thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the same is true of duration and so on, there is no infinite regress.

original: 'di la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa chos rnams las chos gang yang rung ba zhig skye ba na de bdag nyid dang bco lnga po de dag skad cig ma gcig la skye ste /üîΩchos de ni gtso bo yin la de'i skye ba la sogs pa rtsa ba bdun ni de'i 'khor yin /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa chos rnams las chos gang yang rung ba zhig skye ba na de bdag nyid dang bco lnga po de dag skad cig ma gcig la skye ste / chos de ni gtso bo yin la de'i skye ba la sogs pa rtsa ba bdun ni de'i 'khor yin /
translated: In this regard, when any phenomenon arises, such as consciousness and so on, fifteen things arise in a single moment, including itself.üîΩThe phenomenon is primary and the seven roots, such as its origination, are its retinue.

original: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa bdun ni 'khor de dag gi 'khor yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa bdun ni 'khor de dag gi 'khor yin no //
translated: The seven, such as the origination of origination, are the retinue of that retinue.

original: de la rtsa ba'i skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos de dang / de'i 'khor drug dang / 'khor gyi 'khor bdun te /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos de dang / de'i 'khor drug dang / 'khor gyi 'khor bdun te /
translated: The primary arising generates itself and the six of its retinue and the seven of the retinue of the retinue.üîΩ

original: chos bcu bzhi po ci skad bstan pa dag skyed par byed do //
analyzed: chos bcu bzhi po ci skad bstan pa dag skyed par byed do //
translated: The primary origination generates fourteen dharmas: itself, the six of its retinue, the seven of the retinue of those, and the origination of origination.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de 'ba' zhig skyed par byed de /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de 'ba' zhig skyed par byed de /
translated: The origination of origination generates only the primary origination.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid dag gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas mtshan nyid kyang yin la thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid dag gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas mtshan nyid kyang yin la thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since characteristics and secondary characteristics generate each other, there is no infinite regress.

original: de bzhin du chos gang yang rung ba zhig gnas pa na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga gnas la 'jig pa na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga 'jig / ldan pa na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga ldan /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos gang yang rung ba zhig gnas pa na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga gnas la 'jig pa na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga 'jig / ldan pa na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga ldan /
translated: Similarly, when any dharma endures, it endures with itself and fifteen others. When it is destroyed, it is destroyed with itself and fifteen others. When it is possessed, it is possessed with itself and fifteen others.

original: rga ba na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga rga /
analyzed: rga ba na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga rga /
translated: When it ages, it ages with itself and fifteen others.

original: rnam par grol ba na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga grol /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga grol /
translated: When it is liberated, it is liberated with itself and fifteen others.

original: nges par 'byung ba na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga 'byung ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba na yang bdag nyid dang bco lnga 'byung ste /
translated: When they definitely emerge, they emerge with fifteen.

original: de dag la yang rtsa ba'i gnas pas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos de dang de'i 'khor drug dang / 'khor gyi 'khor bdun te chos bcu bzhi gnas par byed la /
analyzed: de dag la yang rtsa ba'i gnas pas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos de dang de'i 'khor drug dang / 'khor gyi 'khor bdun te chos bcu bzhi gnas par byed la /
translated: Among them, the primary endurance causes endurance of fourteen phenomena, excluding itself, and its retinue of six and the retinue of the retinue of seven.

original: gnas pa'i gnas pas ni rtsa ba'i gnas pa de 'ba' zhig gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i gnas pas ni rtsa ba'i gnas pa de 'ba' zhig gnas par byed do //
translated: The endurance of endurance causes the endurance of the primary endurance alone.

original: rtsa ba'i 'jig pas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag 'jig par byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i 'jig pas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag 'jig par byed la /
translated: The primary disintegration causes the disintegration of fourteen phenomena, excluding itself.

original: 'jig pa'i 'jig pas ni rtsa ba'i 'jig pa de 'ba' zhig 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i 'jig pas ni rtsa ba'i 'jig pa de 'ba' zhig 'jig par byed do //
translated: The disintegration of disintegration causes the disintegration of the primary disintegration alone.

original: rtsa ba'i ldan pas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi ldan @121b par byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ldan pas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi ldan @121b par byed la /
translated: The primary possession causes possession of fourteen phenomena, excluding itself.

original: ldan pa'i ldan pas ni rtsa ba'i ldan pa 'ba' zhig ldan par byed do //
analyzed: ldan pa'i ldan pas ni rtsa ba'i ldan pa 'ba' zhig ldan par byed do //
translated: The possession of possession causes the possession of the primary possession alone.

original: rtsa ba'i rga bas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag rga bar byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rga bas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag rga bar byed la /
translated: The primary aging causes the aging of fourteen phenomena, excluding itself.

original: rga ba'i rga bas ni rtsa ba'i rga ba de 'ba' zhig rga bar byed do //
analyzed: rga ba'i rga bas ni rtsa ba'i rga ba de 'ba' zhig rga bar byed do //
translated: The aging of aging causes only the basic aging to age.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par grol bas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag rnam par grol bar byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par grol bas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag rnam par grol bar byed la /
translated: The basic liberation causes the fourteen dharmas, excluding itself, to be liberated.

original: rnam par grol ba'i rnam par grol bas ni rtsa ba'i rnam par grol ba de 'ba' zhig rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i rnam par grol bas ni rtsa ba'i rnam par grol ba de 'ba' zhig rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: The liberation of liberation causes only the basic liberation to be liberated.

original: rtsa ba'i nges par 'byung bas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag nges par 'byung bar byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i nges par 'byung bas kyang bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos bcu bzhi po de dag nges par 'byung bar byed la /
translated: The basic renunciation causes the fourteen dharmas, excluding itself, to be renounced.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i nges par 'byung bas ni rtsa ba'i nges par 'byung ba de 'ba' zhig nges par 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i nges par 'byung bas ni rtsa ba'i nges par 'byung ba de 'ba' zhig nges par 'byung bar byed do //
translated: The renunciation of renunciation causes only the basic renunciation to be renounced.

original: de ltar na skye ba la sogs pa bdun po dag re re la chos bco lnga bco lnga skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang / ldan pa dang / rga ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag spyir bsdoms na skad cig ma gcig la chos brgya rtsa lnga lhan cig na yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba la sogs pa bdun po dag re re la chos bco lnga bco lnga skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang / ldan pa dang / rga ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag spyir bsdoms na skad cig ma gcig la chos brgya rtsa lnga lhan cig na yod par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, each of the seven, such as arising, has fifteen dharmas: arising, enduring, disintegrating, being endowed, aging, being liberated, and emerging. In general, when combined, it is asserted that one hundred and five dharmas exist simultaneously in one moment.

original: phyogs snga ma de'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma de'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs verses are:

original: skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba yin //
translated: The arising of arising is the root.

original: skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed //
translated: Arising alone generates.

original: rtsa ba'i skye bas skye ba yi //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye bas skye ba yi //
translated: The root arising

original: skye ba'ang skyed par byed pa yin //
analyzed: skye ba'ang skyed par byed pa yin //
translated: Also generates arising.

original: zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis pha rol po dag gis phyogs snga ma ci skad smras pa de bsdu ba mdzad nas tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis pha rol po dag gis phyogs snga ma ci skad smras pa de bsdu ba mdzad nas tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The master‚Äôs words are: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the master‚Äôs statement that the opponent‚Äôs position is summarized in these verses.

original: de'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed cing gzhan skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed cing gzhan skyed par mi byed do //
translated: The arising of arising generates the root arising alone and does not generate the others.

original: rtsa ba'i skye bas ni skye ba skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye bas ni skye ba skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The root arising generates the arising of arising.

original: skad cig ma gcig la skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed pas de ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed pas de ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: In one moment, the arising of arising generates the root arising alone, so that is the proximate characteristic.

original: rtsa ba'i skye bas ni skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa chos bcu bzhi po dag skyed pa'i byed pas de ni mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye bas ni skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa chos bcu bzhi po dag skyed pa'i byed pas de ni mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The root arising generates the fourteen phenomena such as the arising of arising and so on, so that is the characteristic.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid dag gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas de dag mtshan nyid kyang yin la thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid dag gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas de dag mtshan nyid kyang yin la thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus since the characteristic and the proximate characteristic generate each other, they are characteristics and it is not the case that an infinite regress ensues.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: de ni mang po yang yin /
analyzed: de ni mang po yang yin /
translated: It is many,

original: de ni sna tshogs kyang @122a * //
analyzed: de ni sna tshogs kyang @122a * //
translated: and it is various.

original: yin mod kyi de de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yin mod kyi de de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that.

original: gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skyes //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skyes //
translated: If your arising of arising

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed byed na //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed byed na //
translated: generates the basic arising,

original: khyod kyi rtsa bas ma bskyed des //
analyzed: khyod kyi rtsa bas ma bskyed des //
translated: then that which is not generated by your basic

original: de ni ci ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar skyed par byed //
translated: how could it generate that?

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what is said.üîΩIf your arising of arising generates the basic arising,

original: gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed na zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed na zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma'i bshad pa ste /
translated: this is the explanation of the first half of the verse.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung brnan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung brnan pa yin no //
translated: It is the assertion of the opponent.

original: khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye bas ma bskyed pa'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de ci ltar skyed par byed skyed par mi byed pa nyid de ma skyes pa'i phyir sngon bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og
analyzed: khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye bas ma bskyed pa'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de ci ltar skyed par byed skyed par mi byed pa nyid de ma skyes pa'i phyir sngon bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og
translated: How could that arising which is not generated by your basic arising generate that basic arising? It could not generate it, because it is not generated, just like before.

original: ma'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ma'i bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the second half of the verse.

original: phyogs snga ma smras pa'i gzhung sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smras pa'i gzhung sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: This is the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of the root text should be applied to the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example, respectively.üîΩFor example, a thing that has not arisen does not cause the generation of the root arising because it has not arisen.

original: dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni ma skyes pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i skye bas ma bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i skye ba skyedüîΩpar mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni ma skyes pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i skye bas ma bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the arising of arising, which is not generated by the root arising, does not cause the generation of the root arising because it has not arisen.

original: gal te rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa kho na'i skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa kho na'i skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: If you say that the arising of arising causes the generation of the root arising only if it is generated by the root arising,

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
translated: the author of the commentary explains the response to that.

original: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba yi //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba yi //
translated: If you say that the root

original: bskyed pa de yis rtsa bskyed na //üîΩdes ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba des //
analyzed: bskyed pa de yis rtsa bskyed na // des ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba des //
translated: If that which is generated generates the root,üîΩhow could that root, not generated by it,

original: de ni ci ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar skyed par byed //
translated: be generated by that?

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what is said.üîΩIf that generation of generation generated by the root generation generates that root generation,

original: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par byed na zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par byed na zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma'i bshad pa ste /
translated: this is the explanation of the first half of the verse.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung brnan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung brnan pa yin no //
translated: It is the affirmation of the opponent's position.

original: skye ba'i skye ba des ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba des skye ba'i skye ba de ji ltar skyed par byed skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba des ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba des skye ba'i skye ba de ji ltar skyed par byed skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: How could that root generation, not generated by that generation of generation, generate that generation of generation? It could not generate it,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir sngon bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa phyed 'og ma'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir sngon bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa phyed 'og ma'i bshad pa ste /
translated: because it is not generated, just like before. This is the explanation of the second half of the verse.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: It is the refutation of the opponent's position.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, since a previously unarisen entity does not arise, the arising of arising does not cause it to arise.

original: dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du skye ba'i skye @122b bas ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba
analyzed: dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du skye ba'i skye @122b bas ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba
translated: In the same way, since the fundamental arising not caused to arise by the arising of arising does not arise, the arising of arising

original: de skyed par mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de skyed par mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: does not cause it to arise.

original: gal te rtsa ba'i skye ba dang skye ba'i skye ba dag skye bzhin pa na rang gi bya ba byed pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te rtsa ba'i skye ba dang skye ba'i skye ba dag skye bzhin pa na rang gi bya ba byed pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: If you say that there is no error because the fundamental arising and the arising of arising perform their own functions while arising,

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /üîΩkhyod kyi de ni skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa / khyod kyi de ni skye bzhin pa //
translated: the Subcommentary explains the response to that:üîΩIf that arising of yours

original: ma skyes de yis gal te ni //
analyzed: ma skyes de yis gal te ni //
translated: is not arisen,

original: de ni skyed par byed nus na //
analyzed: de ni skyed par byed nus na //
translated: If it can generate that,

original: de skyed pa ni 'dod la rag / ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de skyed pa ni 'dod la rag / ces bya ba smras so //
translated: then you must assert that it generates that.

original: khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba de skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des gal te skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par byed nus na ni skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par 'dod la rag
analyzed: khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba de skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des gal te skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par byed nus na ni skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par 'dod la rag
translated: If that fundamental arising or arising of arising, which is in the process of arising and not yet arisen, can generate that arising of arising or fundamental arising, then you must assert that it generates that arising of arising or fundamental arising.

original: na zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa de'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa de'i bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Then‚Äù is the explanation of that verse.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung brnan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung brnan pa yin no //
translated: It is the statement of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus te /
translated: That fundamental arising or arising of arising, which is in the process of arising and not yet arisen, cannot generate that arising of arising or fundamental arising.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ram skye bzhin pa'i phyir sngon bzhin nam skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ram skye bzhin pa'i phyir sngon bzhin nam skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba ste /
translated: Because it has not arisen, like a thing that has not arisen, or because it is in the process of arising, like a thing that is held to be arising.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: This is the thesis, and it refutes the position of the opponent.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The example is the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the exemplification, respectively.üîΩFor example, a thing that has not arisen cannot cause the generation of the generation of arising or the basic arising because it has not arisen, and a thing that is held to be arising cannot cause the generation of the generation of arising or the basic arising because it is in the process of arising.

original: dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa dang / skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po ni skye bzhin pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ram
analyzed: dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa dang / skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po ni skye bzhin pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ram
translated: In the same way, the basic arising or the generation of arising that is in the process of arising cannot cause the generation of itself because it has not arisen or because it is in the process of arising.

original: skye bzhin pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus so //
translated: Because it is in the process of arising, the arising of arising or primary arising cannot generate it.

original: gal te lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus skye bzhin pa la yang skyed pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba ma skyes pa dag gam /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus skye bzhin pa la yang skyed pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba ma skyes pa dag gam /
translated: If you say that because the coemergent cause has the power to generate that which is in the process of arising, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is in the process of arising‚Äù is not established,

original: skye bzhin pa dag gis ma skyes pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa dag gis ma skyes pa'i phyir ram /
translated: or if you say that because coemergent states that have not arisen or that are in the process of arising do not generate that which has not arisen or that is in the process of arising,üîΩthe meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is in the process of arising‚Äù is uncertain,

original: skye bzhin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma bskyed pa'i phyir ram skye bzhin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma bskyed pa'i phyir ram skye bzhin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes
translated: then you are merely criticizing the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not generated‚Äù or ‚Äúbecause it is in the process of arising‚Äù of the MƒÅdhyamika.

original: skyon 'dogs pa yin te /üîΩde dag na re lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos mngon pa mdzod las /üîΩlhan @123a * //
analyzed: skyon 'dogs pa yin te / de dag na re lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos mngon pa mdzod las / lhan @123a * //
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa states,

original: cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: Mutual results are coemergent causes.

original: 'byung bzhin sems kyi rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
analyzed: 'byung bzhin sems kyi rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
translated: the mind and phenomena that follow the mind,üîΩand like characteristics and the basis of those characteristics.

original: zhes bshad de lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni phan tshun 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad de lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni phan tshun 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Mutually established results are coemergent causes.

original: dper na 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu dang / sems kyang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu dang / sems kyang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: For example, the four primary elements are coemergent causes of each other and the mind is a coemergent cause of phenomena that follow the mind.

original: de dag kyang sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Those phenomena that follow the mind are coemergent causes of the mind and the three characteristics of conditioned states arising, enduring and disintegrating are coemergent causes of the basis of those characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus dngos po skye bzhin pa la yang skyed pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir des na /üîΩci rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de ma skyes pa'i phyir sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po bzhin du skye ba'i skye ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus dngos po skye bzhin pa la yang skyed pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir des na / ci rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de ma skyes pa'i phyir sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po bzhin du skye ba'i skye ba'am /
translated: Since it is said that the basis of those characteristics is the coemergent cause of those characteristics, the coemergent cause has the power to generate an entity that is in the process of arising.üîΩTherefore, does the arising of arising or the basic arising generate that arising or basic arising that is in the process of arising, since it has not arisen, like a previously nonarisen entity?

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa yin nam /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa yin nam /
translated: Or is it that it cannot generate that arising or basic arising?

original: 'on te rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par nus pa ma nges pa dang / yang na ci rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de skye bzhin pa'i phyir skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin du skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par nus pa ma nges pa dang / yang na ci rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de skye bzhin pa'i phyir skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin du skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par mi nus pa yin nam /
translated: But if the fundamental production or the production of production is not able to generate the production of production or the fundamental production because it is not definite that the fundamental production or the production of production that is in the process of arising is a coemergent cause,üîΩor if the fundamental production or the production of production is not able to generate the production of production or the fundamental production because it is in the process of arising, like the thing that is asserted to be produced,

original: 'on te rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par nus pa ma nges pas de'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma skyes pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'on te rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te skye ba'i skye ba'am rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par nus pa ma nges pas de'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma skyes pa'i phyir
translated: or if the fundamental production or the production of production that is in the process of arising is a coemergent cause, but it is not definite that the production of production or the fundamental production is able to generate it, then your reason, ‚Äúbecause it is not produced,‚ÄùüîΩis indefinite with respect to the predicate.

original: ram / skye bzhin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ram / skye bzhin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: since the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of being in the process of arising‚Äù is indefinite, it is not suitable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, here the author of the commentary says:

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dag kyang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye ba dgag pa'i skabs su bkag pa'i phyir dang / byed pa'i rgyu yang bkag pa'i phyir sgrub pa des ma nges pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dag kyang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye ba dgag pa'i skabs su bkag pa'i phyir dang / byed pa'i rgyu yang bkag pa'i phyir sgrub pa des ma nges pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since coemergent causes are refuted in the context of the refutation of attachment and one who is attached arising simultaneously and since active causes are also refuted, it cannot be demonstrated that the proof is indefinite by that proof. Therefore the consequence of infinite regress cannot be averted.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag kyang sngar 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag kyang sngar 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of the analysis of attachment and one who is attached, coemergent causes are also refuted:üîΩAttachment and one who is attached

original: 'dod chags dang ni chags @123b pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni chags @123b pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: Do not arise simultaneously.üîΩIn that case, attachment and one who is attached

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
translated: Would not be mutually dependent.

original: zhes bya bas bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa'i rgyus skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin no zhe na //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa'i rgyus skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin no zhe na //
translated: Because this has already been refuted by the statement, ‚ÄúIf arising gives rise to itself, it would never not be arising,‚Äù and because the cause of generation generates that now arising which is itself not yet arisen.

original: yang gal te 'dir rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de byed pa'i rgyu yin na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yang gal te 'dir rtsa ba'i skye ba'am skye ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa de byed pa'i rgyu yin na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the root of generation or the generation of generation is the cause of generation, then it would be indefinite.

original: byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyang sngar bkag zin pas de'i phyir khyed kyi sgrub pa de kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pas mtshan nyid gcig gis gcig skyed par ma grub pa'i phyir de dag la mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod na thug
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyang sngar bkag zin pas de'i phyir khyed kyi sgrub pa de kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pas mtshan nyid gcig gis gcig skyed par ma grub pa'i phyir de dag la mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod na thug
translated: But since the cause of generation has already been refuted, therefore your proof cannot demonstrate that my reason is indefinite. Since it is not established that they are generated by the same characteristic, if they have another characteristic, the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon sngar bstan pa de khyed kyis bzlog pa med de so na gnas so //
analyzed: pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon sngar bstan pa de khyed kyis bzlog pa med de so na gnas so //
translated: You cannot avoid the error that I have previously demonstrated.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag gis thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag gis thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, others say that in order to avoid the error of infinite regress,

original: ci ltar mar mes rang dang gzhan //
analyzed: ci ltar mar mes rang dang gzhan //
translated: Just as a butterlamp

original: snang bar byed pa de bzhin du //üîΩskye ba'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa de bzhin du // skye ba'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: illuminates itself and others,üîΩso too arising

original: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yin //
translated: causes the generation of itself and others.

original: de'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus there is no infinite regress.

original: sde pa gzhan dag sgrub pa gzhan gyi thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur bar sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag sgrub pa gzhan gyi thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur bar sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is the proof of the other schools that there is no infinite regress of other proofs.

original: de dag na re ci ltar mar mes rang gi bdag nyid kyang snang bar byed la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dang dngos po gzhan dag kyang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du skye bas kyang rang gi bdag nyid kyang skyed par byed la bum
analyzed: de dag na re ci ltar mar mes rang gi bdag nyid kyang snang bar byed la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dang dngos po gzhan dag kyang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du skye bas kyang rang gi bdag nyid kyang skyed par byed la bum
translated: They say: Just as a butterlamp illuminates itself and also illuminates other things such as a pot and a cloth, so too arising causes the generation of itself and also causes the generation of other things such as a pot and a cloth.

original: pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dag kyang skyed par byed pas de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyang yin la thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dag kyang skyed par byed pas de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyang yin la thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore it is a characteristic of the produced and there is no infinite regress.

original: 'dir don go sla ba dang rnam par bshad zin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par bshad par mi bya ste tshig mangs su dogs pa'i phyir dang / don grags pa dang don rnam par bshad zin pas 'bad pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir don go sla ba dang rnam par bshad zin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par bshad par mi bya ste tshig mangs su dogs pa'i phyir dang / don grags pa dang don rnam par bshad zin pas 'bad pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, what is easy to understand and what has already been explained is not explained, because there is fear of verbosity, and because it is pointless to strive after what is well known and what has already been explained.

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma smra ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma de'i 'grel pa ma byas pa'i 'thad pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma smra ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma de'i 'grel pa ma byas pa'i 'thad pa smras pa yin no //
translated: This is the reason given by the commentator himself for not commenting on the earlier verses of the opponent.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba dag de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis tshig mangs kyang blos 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa @124a * //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba dag de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis tshig mangs kyang blos 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa @124a * //
translated: In response to the opponent's statement, the commentator himself says here, although there are many words, that he will explain the inference in his mind.

original: smras so // skye ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi yul dag la bya ba byed de de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras so // skye ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi yul dag la bya ba byed de de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Arising functions with regard to itself and other things, because it has that nature.

original: dper na mar me snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i tshig las dras te phyogs snga ma nye
analyzed: dper na mar me snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i tshig las dras te phyogs snga ma nye
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position

original: bar bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bar bzhag pa yin te /
translated: stated by the author of the commentary,

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and it is presented in the order in which the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are stated.

original: dper na mar me ni snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa de bzhin du skye ba yang skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag skyed par byed do zhe na'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me ni snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa de bzhin du skye ba yang skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag skyed par byed do zhe na'o //
translated: For example, since a lamp is the essence of illumination, it illuminates itself and others. In the same way, since arising is the essence of arising, it gives rise to itself and others.‚Äù

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: Now, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: don dam par skye ba ni skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba bzhin du ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma'i gtan tshigs de bsgrub par
analyzed: don dam par skye ba ni skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba bzhin du ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs snga ma'i gtan tshigs de bsgrub par
translated: The meaning of the passage from the commentary is as follows: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is the essence of that‚Äù is not established, like the probandum, because it is said that it is not established, and because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis, like the statement ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is sound.‚Äù

original: bya ba bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhes sun dbyung ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bya ba bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhes sun dbyung ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a statement of refutation by the author of the commentary, who says that the reason of the opponent is not established, like the probandum, and because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: yang bshad pa 'di la don dam par mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag gzung ba la bar du gcod pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir snang bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya grang na /
analyzed: yang bshad pa 'di la don dam par mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag gzung ba la bar du gcod pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir snang bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya grang na /
translated: Again, in this explanation, it should be said that ultimately a lamp is illuminating because it clears away the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of itself and others.

original: 'di la ji skad smos pa'i sgrub pa de mi srid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar brtag na de lta bu yin grang na /
analyzed: 'di la ji skad smos pa'i sgrub pa de mi srid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar brtag na de lta bu yin grang na /
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúthat proof mentioned is impossible‚Äù is as follows: if one analyzes in accordance with the assertions of the opponent, that is so.

original: brtag pa 'di la ci skad smos pa'i sgrub pa de mi srid par ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa 'di la ci skad smos pa'i sgrub pa de mi srid par ston to //
translated: However, in this analysis, the statement ‚Äúthat proof mentioned is impossible‚Äù is shown.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mar me dang ni gang dag na //
analyzed: mar me dang ni gang dag na //
translated: A lamp and that which is

original: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: Not in darkness when it is lit,

original: mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed //
analyzed: mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed //
translated: What does the lamp illuminate?

original: ci yang snang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: ci yang snang bar mi byed do //
translated: It does not illuminate anything at all.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba ni mar mes snang bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag gzung bar bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir snang bar byed pa yin no zhesüîΩbrjod @124b par bya grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba ni mar mes snang bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag gzung bar bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir snang bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod @124b par bya grang na /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe light illuminates‚Äù means that it illuminates the object that is grasped by itself and by others because it clears away the darkness that obstructs it.

original: mar me la yang mun pa med la phyogs gang na mar me de 'dug pa de na yang mun pa med pas mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed de ci yang snang bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mar me la yang mun pa med la phyogs gang na mar me de 'dug pa de na yang mun pa med pas mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed de ci yang snang bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But darkness does not exist in the light, nor does darkness exist in the place where the light is located. What then does the light illuminate? It does not illuminate anything at all.

original: de ltar na 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos mar me snang bar byed pa nyid ma yin pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med pa nyid bstan to zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos mar me snang bar byed pa nyid ma yin pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med pa nyid bstan to zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: Thus, here the property to be established is the fact that the light is not an illuminator, and the property that establishes that is the fact that darkness does not exist in the light itself or in others.

original: sgrub pa'i chos de bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos de bstan to //
translated: This is the property to be established and the property that establishes it.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, here the inference is: A butterlamp does not illuminate itself and others ultimately,üîΩbecause darkness does not exist, like the illumination of the sun, which is clear and possesses radiant light.

original: mun pa med pa'i phyir dper na nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: mun pa med pa'i phyir dper na nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba ni mun pa med pa'i phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me rang gi bdag nyid dang / phyogs gang na mar me de 'dug pa'i gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag kyang mun pa med pa'i phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba ni mun pa med pa'i phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me rang gi bdag nyid dang / phyogs gang na mar me de 'dug pa'i gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag kyang mun pa med pa'i phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, the illumination of the sun, which is clear and possesses radiant light, is not illuminated by a butterlamp because darkness does not exist. In the same way, because darkness does not exist, a butterlamp does not illuminate itself and the other entities in the place where the butterlamp is located.

original: 'dir nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa zhes 'od zer gyi khyad par gnyis smos pa ni nang par nam mkha' sprin med pa la nyi ma shar ba'i tshe na 'od zer gsal ba yin yang 'jebs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa zhes 'od zer gyi khyad par gnyis smos pa ni nang par nam mkha' sprin med pa la nyi ma shar ba'i tshe na 'od zer gsal ba yin yang 'jebs pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, the two special qualities of light rays are mentioned: ‚Äúthe sun is clear and bright,‚Äù because when the sun rises in a cloudless sky in the morning, the light rays are clear but not bright.

original: gung la 'od zer sprin gyis khebs pa'i tshe na 'jebs pa yin yang gsal ba ma yin pas de gnyi ga'i tshe /
analyzed: gung la 'od zer sprin gyis khebs pa'i tshe na 'jebs pa yin yang gsal ba ma yin pas de gnyi ga'i tshe /
translated: At noon, the light rays are bright but not clear, because they are obscured by clouds.

original: sa phyogs dma' ba dag snang ba gang yod pa des mar mes snang bar bya dgos pas de'i phyir 'od zer gsal ba dang 'jebs pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: sa phyogs dma' ba dag snang ba gang yod pa des mar mes snang bar bya dgos pas de'i phyir 'od zer gsal ba dang 'jebs pa gnyis smos so //
translated: Therefore, the two qualities of clear and bright light rays are mentioned, because the light of a lamp must illuminate whatever light there is in a low-lying area at those two times.

original: yang na / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
analyzed: yang na / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
translated: Moreover, where there is a lamp,

original: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: there is no darkness.

original: med ces bya ba ni snang bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni snang bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means ‚Äúnot,‚Äù because it illuminates.üîΩThis shows that the quality of a lamp is illumination.

original: 'dis ni mar me'i chos ni snang bar byed pa nyid yin par ston to zhes bya ba ni sngar ni mun pa med pa nyid sgrub pa'i chos yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mar me'i chos ni snang bar byed pa nyid yin par ston to zhes bya ba ni sngar ni mun pa med pa nyid sgrub pa'i chos yin par bstan to //
translated: Previously, the quality of establishing the absence of darkness was shown.

original: 'dis ni snang bar byed pa nyid sgrub pa'i chos yin par ston te khyad par ni de yod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni snang bar byed pa nyid sgrub pa'i chos yin par ston te khyad par ni de yod do //
translated: This shows that the property to be established is the illumination itself, and the distinction is that.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, here the inference is: a lamp should be understood not to illuminate itself and others ultimately,

original: snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na nyi ma bzhin no zhes bya ba @125a * //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na nyi ma bzhin no zhes bya ba @125a * //
translated: because it is illumination, like the sun.

original: dag kyang / chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na nyi ma ni snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me rang gi bdag nyid dang phyogs gang na mar me de 'dug pa'i gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag kyang snang bar byed pa yin pa'i
analyzed: dag kyang / chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na nyi ma ni snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me rang gi bdag nyid dang phyogs gang na mar me de 'dug pa'i gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag kyang snang bar byed pa yin pa'i
translated: The subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir mar mes snang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as the sun is not illuminated by the lamp because it is illumination, in the same way, the lamp is not illuminated by the lamp because it illuminates itself and the other entities in the place where the lamp is located.

original: de bzhin du mar me ni snang bar byed pa ma yin te gtan tshigs 'byung ba nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid dang byas pa nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs mun pa med
analyzed: de bzhin du mar me ni snang bar byed pa ma yin te gtan tshigs 'byung ba nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid dang byas pa nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs mun pa med
translated: So too, a butterlamp does not illuminate itself and others because of the reasons of being an element, being a benefit, being a product, being different due to the division of conditions, and so on, just like earth and so on.

original: pa'i phyir dang / snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gnyis ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gnyis ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The two reasons ‚Äúbecause darkness does not exist‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it illuminates‚Äù are merely illustrative, because they are stated in terms of the mode of the word characteristic.

original: de bzhin du mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: So too, a butterlamp does not illuminate itself and others because of the reasons of being an element, being a benefit, being a product, being different due to the division of conditions, and so on, just like earth and so on.

original: 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that the arising, etc., are like earth, etc.

original: 'di skad bstan te mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: This is the explanation: A lamp does not illuminate itself and others,

original: 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na sa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na sa bzhin no //
translated: because it is an element, like earth, for example.

original: mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A lamp does not illuminate itself and others,

original: phan gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no //
translated: because it is an object of illumination, like water, for example.

original: mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te ;
translated: A lamp does not illuminate itself and others,

original: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me bzhin no //
translated: because it is produced, like fire, for example.

original: mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A lamp does not illuminate itself and others,

original: rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rlung bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rlung bzhin no //
translated: because it is differentiated by the differentiation of conditions, like wind, for example.

original: de'i phyir dpe med pas sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe med pas sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no example, the proof is incomplete. This is the conclusion, and it is the result of the valid cognition.

original: pha rol po dag gis sngar skye ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi yul dag la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis sngar skye ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi yul dag la bya ba byed do //
translated: Previously, the opponent said that arising causes activity in both itself and others.üîΩSince it has that nature, it is like a lamp, which has the nature of illumination and illuminates both itself and others.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe ma grub pas phyogs snga @125b ma la sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me snang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe ma grub pas phyogs snga @125b ma la sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas
translated: Since the example is not established, the previous position is flawed because the proof is incomplete.

original: mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means to say that it is not tenable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin //
translated: It illuminates because it clears away darkness.

original: mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel bar byed de gang gi phyir des snang bar bya ba'i dngos po la mun pa med pa dang snang bar byed pas snang ba yin pa de'i phyir mun pa sel bas snang bar byed pa yin no zhes smras par 'gyur
analyzed: mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel bar byed de gang gi phyir des snang bar bya ba'i dngos po la mun pa med pa dang snang bar byed pas snang ba yin pa de'i phyir mun pa sel bas snang bar byed pa yin no zhes smras par 'gyur
translated: A lamp is arisen and it clears darkness because it is light, since it is not darkness with respect to the object illuminated and it illuminates. Therefore, it is light because it clears darkness.

original: ro // de'i phyir mun pa med pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de ma grub pas des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: ro // de'i phyir mun pa med pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de ma grub pas des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the reason ‚Äúbecause darkness does not exist‚Äù is not established, the meaning of the reason is not established.üîΩNor is there no example, because the object illuminated by the lamp is observed.

original: dpe med pa yang ma yin te mar mes snang bar bya ba'i don dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar dpe med par bstan pa dang / 'dir yang rang gi sde pa dag dpe yod par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe med pa yang ma yin te mar mes snang bar bya ba'i don dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar dpe med par bstan pa dang / 'dir yang rang gi sde pa dag dpe yod par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is the response to the demonstration that there is no example, and it is the proof that our own schools have an example.

original: de dag na re gang gi phyir khyed kyis /üîΩmar me dang ni gang dag na //
analyzed: de dag na re gang gi phyir khyed kyis / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
translated: Because you say:üîΩA lamp is arisen and it clears darkness

original: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: Because it is light, since it is not darkness with respect to the object illuminated and it illuminates.

original: ces bya bas rjes su dpag pa rnam gnyis bshad pa'i gtan tshigs des snang bar bya ba'i dngos po la mun pa med pa'i phyir dang / snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ces bya bas rjes su dpag pa rnam gnyis bshad pa'i gtan tshigs des snang bar bya ba'i dngos po la mun pa med pa'i phyir dang / snang bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the thing that is illuminated is not in darkness, and because it is illumination.

original: zhes bya ba de nyid kyis mar me snang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid kyis mar me snang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: This is the same as saying that the lamp is illumination,

original: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin //
translated: and therefore it is illumination because it dispels darkness.

original: zhes smras par 'gyur bas mar me skye bzhin pa rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med pa nyid mun pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras par 'gyur bas mar me skye bzhin pa rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med pa nyid mun pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the lamp that is in the process of arising does not illuminate itself or something else, because it does not dispel darkness.üîΩTherefore, your reason is not established.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis don dam par mar me ni mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te mun pa med pa'i phyir dper na nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba bzhin no zhes gang smrasüîΩpa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis don dam par mar me ni mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa ma yin te mun pa med pa'i phyir dper na nyi ma 'od zer gsal zhing 'jebs pa dang ldan pa'i snang ba bzhin no zhes gang smrasüîΩpa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: You said: Ultimately, a lamp does not illuminate itself or something else, because it is not in darkness, just like the illumination of the sun, which is endowed with clear, bright rays.

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pas kho bo cag gi dpe med pa yang ma yin te mar mes snang bar bya ba'i don rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med pa dang snang bar byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pas kho bo cag gi dpe med pa yang ma yin te mar mes snang bar bya ba'i don rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med pa dang snang bar byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi
translated: You say, ‚ÄúYour reason is not established, and our example is not nonexistent, because we observe that a lamp illuminates objects to be illuminated, and that darkness is absent from both itself and others.

original: dpe grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dpe grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore our example is established.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ci ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
analyzed: ci ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
translated: How does a lamp that is arising

original: mun pa sel bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel bar byed pa yin //
translated: remove darkness?

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is said.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa la snyegs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa la snyegs te /
translated: ‚ÄúHow‚Äù refers to impossibility.

original: ji ltar sel bar byed de sel bar mi byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba chos bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar sel bar byed de sel bar mi byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya bas ni bsgrub par bya ba chos bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIt does not remove darkness‚Äù is that the predicate of the probandum is stated.

original: mar me skye bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye bzhin pa'i chos skye bzhin @126a * //
analyzed: mar me skye bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye bzhin pa'i chos skye bzhin @126a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBy a lamp that is arising‚Äù indicates that the property of the subject is arising.

original: pa nyid bstan zhes bya bas ni sgrub pa'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: pa nyid bstan zhes bya bas ni sgrub pa'i chos bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe property to be established is taught‚Äù refers to the property to be established.

original: de'i phyir de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthis is the presentation of the property to be established and the proof‚Äù is stated.

original: snga ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //üîΩgang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa //üîΩmun pa dang ni phrad pa med //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no // gang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa // mun pa dang ni phrad pa med //
translated: The former two are in the same order.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe example of a property that is similar‚Äù is stated.

original: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar gzhag pa yin te zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar gzhag pa yin te zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe example of a property that is similar‚Äù refers to the example of a property that is similar.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that?üîΩFor example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúHow can sound be permanent? Sound is like a pot, which is impermanent.‚Äù

original: dper na sgra byas pa ji ltar brtag ste bum pa mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te dper na 'ga' zhig gis sgra rtag go zhes smras pa na gzhan dag gis sgra byas pa ji ltar rtag ste bum pa byas
analyzed: dper na sgra byas pa ji ltar brtag ste bum pa mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te dper na 'ga' zhig gis sgra rtag go zhes smras pa na gzhan dag gis sgra byas pa ji ltar rtag ste bum pa byas
translated: For example, when someone says, ‚ÄúSound is permanent,‚Äù others may respond, ‚ÄúHow can sound be permanent? Sound is like a pot, which is impermanent.‚Äù

original: pa mi rtag pa bzhin du sgra byas pa yang mi rtag pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gang gi tshe mar me skye bzhin pa dang mun pa phrad pa med pa de'i tshe na mun pas mar me sgrib par mi byed pa nyid
analyzed: pa mi rtag pa bzhin du sgra byas pa yang mi rtag pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gang gi tshe mar me skye bzhin pa dang mun pa phrad pa med pa de'i tshe na mun pas mar me sgrib par mi byed pa nyid
translated: Just as sound is impermanent because it is produced, in the same way, here, when the arising of the lamp and the contact of darkness do not exist, at that time, darkness does not obscure the lamp.

original: gang gi tshe mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med pa de'i tshe mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe yin par sgrub bo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med pa de'i tshe mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe yin par sgrub bo //
translated: When the arising of the lamp and the contact of darkness do not exist, at that time, the lamp does not remove darkness. Therefore, this is established as the example.

original: de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: A lamp does not ultimately remove darkness,
