original: skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir dper na mun pas mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir dper na mun pas mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te //
translated: because it is arising, like darkness for a lamp. The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na mun pa mar me dang phrad pa med pa ni skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir mar me sgrib par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me mun pa dang phrad pa med pa yang skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byedüîΩpa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na mun pa mar me dang phrad pa med pa ni skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir mar me sgrib par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me mun pa dang phrad pa med pa yang skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, since the arising of a butterlamp is not in contact with darkness, it does not illuminate darkness.üîΩIf you say that it is not ascertained because of consciousness and non-consciousness,

original: gal te shes pa dang shes pa ma yin pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin par skyon 'dogs pa
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang shes pa ma yin pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin par skyon 'dogs pa
translated: the opponent faults the Madhyamaka reason, saying that it is not ascertained because of the arising of consciousness.

original: yin te / de dag na re ye shes dang ma rig pa dag skye bzhin pa yin yang ye shes kyis ma rig pa sel bar byed pas des na ci re zhig skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir mun pas mar me sgrib par mi byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yin te / de dag na re ye shes dang ma rig pa dag skye bzhin pa yin yang ye shes kyis ma rig pa sel bar byed pas des na ci re zhig skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir mun pas mar me sgrib par mi byed pa bzhin du /
translated: They say that although consciousness and ignorance are in the process of arising, consciousness eliminates ignorance. Therefore, is it the case that, like a butterlamp does not illuminate darkness because it is in the process of arising,

original: mar mes mun pa sel bar mi byed pa yin nam 'on te skye bzhin pa yin yang ye shes kyis ma rig pa sel bar byed pa bzhin du mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs @126b de mi rung ngo
analyzed: mar mes mun pa sel bar mi byed pa yin nam 'on te skye bzhin pa yin yang ye shes kyis ma rig pa sel bar byed pa bzhin du mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs @126b de mi rung ngo
translated: Does the butterlamp not clear darkness? Or does it clear darkness even while it is arising? It is not certain that the butterlamp clears darkness, just as it is certain that wisdom clears ignorance. Therefore, the Madhyamaka argument is not correct.üîΩ

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Does the butterlamp not clear darkness? Or does it clear darkness even while arising? Just as the butterlamp clears darkness, so too does wisdom clear ignorance. Since it is not certain that the butterlamp clears darkness, the Madhyamaka reason is not correct.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du bkag pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du bkag pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is included in the probandum, it is not the case that it is not ascertained by the negation in the same way.

original: ji ltar don dam par mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa bkag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa bkag pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the ultimate clearing of darkness by the butterlamp is negated,

original: ye shes kyis ma rig pa sel ba yang bkag pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ma rig pa sel ba yang bkag pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: so too the clearing of ignorance by wisdom is negated. Therefore it is not the case that it is not ascertained because there is no counterexample.

original: yang na skye bzhin pa ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: yang na skye bzhin pa ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /
translated: Or, that which is arising is not fully established.

original: mar me ni snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me ni snang bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The butterlamp is not that which illuminates.

original: mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir bu ma skyes pas bya ba mi nus pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mngon par ma grub pa gtan tshigs yin par ston te /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir bu ma skyes pas bya ba mi nus pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mngon par ma grub pa gtan tshigs yin par ston te /
translated: This shows that nonmanifestation is the reason.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na bu ma skyes pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir bya ba mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bu ma skyes pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir bya ba mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as a son who is not born cannot perform an action because he is not manifest,

original: mar me skye bzhin pa yang mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me skye bzhin pa yang mngon par ma grub pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: so too, since a lamp that is in the process of arising is not manifest, it does not dispel darkness.

original: yang na / ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
analyzed: yang na / ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
translated: Or, just as a lamp that is in the process of arising

original: mun pa sel bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel bar byed pa yin //
translated: dispels darkness,üîΩso too, a lamp that is arising illuminates.

original: zhes bya bas ni dpe la phrad pa med pa brjod pa'i phyir mar me'i chos phrad pa med pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni dpe mar me la mun pa dang phrad pa med pa'i chos yod par brjod pa'i phyir mar mes mun pa sel barüîΩmi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa med pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dpe la phrad pa med pa brjod pa'i phyir mar me'i chos phrad pa med pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni dpe mar me la mun pa dang phrad pa med pa'i chos yod par brjod pa'i phyir mar mes mun pa sel bar mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa med pa yin par ston to //
translated: This is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.

original: snga mas ni mun pa la mar me dang phrad pa med pa'i chos yod pa'i brjod pa'i phyir mun pas mar me mi sgrib pa'i sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa med pa yin par bstan te khyad par ni de yod do //üîΩgang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa /üîΩmun pa dang ni phrad pa med //
analyzed: snga mas ni mun pa la mar me dang phrad pa med pa'i chos yod pa'i brjod pa'i phyir mun pas mar me mi sgrib pa'i sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa med pa yin par bstan te khyad par ni de yod do // gang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa / mun pa dang ni phrad pa med //
translated: This is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.

original: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe bstan to //
translated: This is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.üîΩThis is the statement of the example, which is the non-contact of the flame.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me skye bzhin pa ni mun pa sel par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me skye bzhin pa ni mun pa sel par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: A lamp that is in the process of arising does not remove darkness ultimately,üîΩbecause it does not contact it, like the darkness of the interval between worlds.

original: phrad pa med pa'i phyir dper na 'jig rten gyi bar gyi mun gnag snang ba med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: phrad pa med pa'i phyir dper na 'jig rten gyi bar gyi mun gnag snang ba med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na 'jig rten gyi bar gyi mun gnag snang ba med pa ni mar me dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir @127a * //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten gyi bar gyi mun gnag snang ba med pa ni mar me dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir @127a * //
translated: For example, the darkness of the interval between worlds does not obscure a lamp because it does not contact it.

original: mar me sgrib par mi byed pa de bzhin du mar me skye bzhin pa yang mun pa dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me sgrib par mi byed pa de bzhin du mar me skye bzhin pa yang mun pa dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as a lamp does not obscure a lamp, in the same way, a lamp that is in the process of arising does not remove darkness because it does not contact darkness.

original: yang na don dam par mar me ni mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par mar me ni mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, a lamp does not remove darkness ultimately,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not contact its opposite.

original: dper na mun pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na mun pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: For example, it is like darkness.

original: dper na mun pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mun pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, darkness does not remove darkness because it does not contact the side that is the antidote.

original: mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, a lamp does not remove darkness because it does not contact the side that is the opposite.üîΩIf you say that it is not definite because light removes darkness without contact, like the rite of destroying an enemy,

original: gal te mngon spyod kyi las bzhin du phrad pa med par yang snang bas mun pa sel ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs phrad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma ngesüîΩpa nyid yin par skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te mngon spyod kyi las bzhin du phrad pa med par yang snang bas mun pa sel ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs phrad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma ngesüîΩpa nyid yin par skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: the opponent faults the Madhyamaka reason, saying that the reason ‚Äúbecause of not contacting‚Äù is not definite.

original: de dag na re mngon spyod kyi las dang dgra bo dag phrad pa med par yang mngon spyod kyi las kyis dgra bo gsod par byed pas /
analyzed: de dag na re mngon spyod kyi las dang dgra bo dag phrad pa med par yang mngon spyod kyi las kyis dgra bo gsod par byed pas /
translated: They say: Since the action of killing is performed by the action of killing even without contact with the enemy,üîΩthen is it that since there is no contact, like darkness does not obscure a lamp, a lamp does not remove darkness?

original: des na ci re zhig phrad pa med pa'i phyir mun pas mar me sgrib par mi byed pa bzhin du mar mes mun pa sel bar mi byed pa yin nam 'on te phrad pa med kyang mngon spyod kyi las kyis dgra bo gsod par byed pa bzhin du
analyzed: des na ci re zhig phrad pa med pa'i phyir mun pas mar me sgrib par mi byed pa bzhin du mar mes mun pa sel bar mi byed pa yin nam 'on te phrad pa med kyang mngon spyod kyi las kyis dgra bo gsod par byed pa bzhin du
translated: Or is it that like the action of killing kills the enemy even without contact,üîΩa lamp removes darkness?

original: / mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ni mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / mar mes mun pa sel bar byed pa ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ni mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is not ascertained, the Madhyamaka reason is not suitable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la yang las la snang ba med pa'i phyir dang dgra bo'i phyir las byas pas rig sngags kyi lha dag gis phrad pa kho nas mi 'dod pa byed pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la yang las la snang ba med pa'i phyir dang dgra bo'i phyir las byas pas rig sngags kyi lha dag gis phrad pa kho nas mi 'dod pa byed pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the action of killing does not see the object of the action and since the action of killing is performed for the sake of the enemy, it is not the case that it is not ascertained that the mantras of the gods do not desire to kill through contact alone.

original: mar mes ma phrad par snang bar mi byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mngon spyod kyi las kyis ma phrad par yang dgra bo snang bar byed pa yod na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba zhig na mngon spyod kyi las la snang ba
analyzed: mar mes ma phrad par snang bar mi byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mngon spyod kyi las kyis ma phrad par yang dgra bo snang bar byed pa yod na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba zhig na mngon spyod kyi las la snang ba
translated: If there were an instance of an object being illuminated by an act of illumination without contact, then it would be indeterminate.

original: med pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: med pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But since there is no illumination in the case of an act of killing, it is not indeterminate, because it is similar to the object to be established.

original: gzhan yang mngon spyod kyi las kyis rig sngags kyi lha dag dang dgra bo phrad nas dgra bo gsod pas ma phrad par gsod pa ma yin pa'i @127b phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon spyod kyi las kyis rig sngags kyi lha dag dang dgra bo phrad nas dgra bo gsod pas ma phrad par gsod pa ma yin pa'i @127b phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not indeterminate because the act of killing does not kill the enemy without contact, since the deity of the knowledge mantra kills the enemy after coming into contact with it.

original: ci ste yang rang gi phyogs la chags pas mig khebs par gyur pa nyid kyis 'di skad ces mar mes phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa ni mthong gi mun pas phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa ni ma mthong ngo zhes zer na zhes bya
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi phyogs la chags pas mig khebs par gyur pa nyid kyis 'di skad ces mar mes phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa ni mthong gi mun pas phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa ni ma mthong ngo zhes zer na zhes bya
translated: If, out of attachment to one‚Äôs own position, one were to say, ‚ÄúWe see that a lamp illuminates without contact, but we do not see that darkness obscures without contact,‚Äù

original: ba ni / ci ste pha rol po dag yang dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: ba ni / ci ste pha rol po dag yang dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: But if the opponent says that in order to establish the example,

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary himself replies:

original: dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir de ni mi gnod do //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir de ni mi gnod do //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not undermine the establishment of the example.‚Äù

original: de nyid brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid brtag par bya ste /
translated: That itself should be examined:

original: ci mthong ba de ci ltar mthong ba bzhin yin nam 'on te gzhan zhig yin mar mas phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa mthong ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ci mthong ba de ci ltar mthong ba bzhin yin nam 'on te gzhan zhig yin mar mas phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa mthong ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Is what is seen as it is seen, or is it otherwise? Seeing that which is not in contact with the eye does not exist in that way.

original: ci ste mar mes phrad pa med par yang mun pa sel bar 'dod na ni 'di yang 'dod par gyis shig / mar mes phrad pa med par yang //
analyzed: ci ste mar mes phrad pa med par yang mun pa sel bar 'dod na ni 'di yang 'dod par gyis shig / mar mes phrad pa med par yang //
translated: But if you assert that the lamp clears darkness without contact, then accept this as well:

original: gal te mun pa sel byed na //
analyzed: gal te mun pa sel byed na //
translated: If the lamp clears darknessüîΩWithout contact,

original: 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun //
translated: Then the darkness that exists throughout the world

original: 'di na 'dug pa de gsal 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di na 'dug pa de gsal 'gyur //
translated: Would be cleared by this lamp here.

original: de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir mar mes phrad pa med par mun pa sel bar byed do zhes bya ba de yang 'dod par ma byed cig ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir mar mes phrad pa med par mun pa sel bar byed do zhes bya ba de yang 'dod par ma byed cig ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that is not accepted, therefore do not assert that the lamp clears darkness without contact.

original: dpe bsgrubs pa'i phyir de ni mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni kho bos mar me la snang bar byed pa nyid med de dper na mun pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de khyod kyis mun pas phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa ni ma mthong
analyzed: dpe bsgrubs pa'i phyir de ni mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni kho bos mar me la snang bar byed pa nyid med de dper na mun pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de khyod kyis mun pas phrad pa med par snang bar byed pa ni ma mthong
translated: The response ‚ÄúThat is not a fault because it establishes an example‚Äù is as follows: You say, ‚ÄúA butter lamp does not illuminate itself because of being darkness, like, for example, darkness.‚Äù

original: ngo zhes smras pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir kho bo la mi gnod do //üîΩyang gzhan yang khyod 'dod pa ltar mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo zhes smras pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir kho bo la mi gnod do // yang gzhan yang khyod 'dod pa ltar mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since you state that example, ‚ÄúDarkness does not see itself and does not see another,‚Äù it does not invalidate our position.üîΩMoreover, if a butter lamp illuminates itself and others

original: mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //üîΩgal te snang bar byed gyur na //üîΩmun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos // gal te snang bar byed gyur na // mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: Because it dispels darkness,üîΩthen darkness

original: sgrib par 'gyur ba the tshom med //
analyzed: sgrib par 'gyur ba the tshom med //
translated: Undoubtedly would obscure itself and others.üîΩBut that is unacceptable, because darkness does not obscure itself and others.

original: de ni mi 'dod de rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'di na mar me ni mun pa'i gnyen por gnas pa yin pas des na gal te mar mes rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag snang bar
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'di na mar me ni mun pa'i gnyen por gnas pa yin pas des na gal te mar mes rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag snang bar
translated: Here a butter lamp is the antidote to darkness, and therefore if a butter lamp illuminates itself and others, then darkness undoubtedly would obscure itself and others.

original: byed par gyur na mun pas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par thal bar 'gyur ba 'di la the tshom med pa zhig na mun pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par byed par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: byed par gyur na mun pas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par thal bar 'gyur ba 'di la the tshom med pa zhig na mun pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par byed par mi 'dod do //
translated: If it did, then without a doubt it would follow that darkness would also obscure itself and other things, but darkness is not asserted to obscure itself and other things.

original: gal te sgrib par byed na ni gzhan bzhin du mun pa nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur zhing dngos po rnams rtag tu snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te sgrib par byed na ni gzhan bzhin du mun pa nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur zhing dngos po rnams rtag tu snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If it did obscure, then like the other, darkness itself would not be apprehended, and things would always be illuminated. But since that is not the case, this is unacceptable.üîΩTherefore this is a statement of an example of a similar quality.

original: @128a * // de'i phyir de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni mun pa rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed par 'dod pa de ni 'dir mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yod pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa
analyzed: @128a * // de'i phyir de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni mun pa rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed par 'dod pa de ni 'dir mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yod pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa
translated: This is a statement of an example of a similar quality, since darkness is asserted not to obscure itself and other things, and a lamp does not remove the darkness that exists in itself and others.

original: ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no ;
analyzed: ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no ;
translated: This is a statement of an example of a similar quality.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par mar me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: A lamp ultimately does not remove the darkness that exists in itself and in others,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dper na mun pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dper na mun pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: because it has an opposite, just as, for example, darkness does. The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mun pa ni gnyen po dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag sgrib par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yodüîΩpa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na mun pa ni gnyen po dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag sgrib par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yod pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, darkness, because it has an antidote, does not obscure itself and others, and likewise a lamp, because it has an opposite, does not remove the darkness that exists in itself and in others.

original: yang na don dam par mar me ni mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par mar me ni mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, a lamp ultimately does not remove darkness,üîΩbecause it has an opposite, just as, for example, darkness does.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has an opposing factor.üîΩFor example, like a shadow.

original: dper na grib ma bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na grib ma bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property that proves, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na grib ma ni gnyen po dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na grib ma ni gnyen po dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mar me yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mun pa sel bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, a shadow does not dispel darkness because it has an opposing factor. In the same way, a lamp does not dispel darkness because it has an opposing factor.

original: de'i phyir de ltar mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa gsal bas dpe med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa gsal bas dpe med do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, since a lamp does not illuminate itself and others, there is no example.

original: des na pha rol pos mar me bzhin du skye ba yang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag skyed par byed pas thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de de bzhin du gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba
analyzed: des na pha rol pos mar me bzhin du skye ba yang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag skyed par byed pas thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de de bzhin du gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the result of valid cognition.

original: yang gzhan yang skye bas ji ltar rang gi bdag nyid skyed par 'dod do //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang skye bas ji ltar rang gi bdag nyid skyed par 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, how could arising generate itself?üîΩ‚ÄúDoes arising generate itself as something arisen or unarisen?‚Äù

original: ci skyes sam 'on te ma skyes pas skyed par byed ces bya bas ni gal te skye byas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na skye ba de rang nyid skyes pas skyed dam 'on te ma skyes pas skyed ces gal te gnyis su brtag pa ston to
analyzed: ci skyes sam 'on te ma skyes pas skyed par byed ces bya bas ni gal te skye byas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na skye ba de rang nyid skyes pas skyed dam 'on te ma skyes pas skyed ces gal te gnyis su brtag pa ston to
translated: This shows that the question is twofold.

original: // des ci @128b 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: // des ci @128b 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the problem?‚Äù is a question.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa phyi ma bstan pa'i phyir gal te ma skyes pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa phyi ma bstan pa'i phyir gal te ma skyes pas so zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is unarisen‚Äù is the second question.

original: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
translated: How could this arising, not having arisen,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar skyed //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar skyed //
translated: give rise to itself?

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir skye ba ma skyes pas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir skye ba ma skyes pas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: In order to demonstrate its nonexistence, he says, ‚ÄúArising that has not arisen does not give rise to itself,‚Äù

original: med pa'i phyir sngon bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir sngon bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it does not exist, just like before.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni med pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na sngon ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni med pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, a nonarisen thing does not give rise to itself because it does not exist.

original: skye ba ma skyes pa yang med pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye ba ma skyes pa yang med pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, arising that has not arisen does not give rise to itself because it does not exist.

original: brtag pa snga ma shos bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩci skyes pas so she na /üîΩci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma shos bstan pa'i phyir / ci skyes pas so she na / ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: In order to demonstrate the former analysis, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúIf you think that arising gives rise to itself,üîΩhow could arising give rise to itself?

original: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod /
analyzed: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod /
translated: If it has arisen, what is there to give rise to?‚Äù

original: skyes pa las skye ba'i bya ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skyes pa las skye ba'i bya ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because the action of giving rise to what has arisen would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na skye bas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed pa nyid mi srid pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na skye bas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed pa nyid mi srid pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Thus, since it is not possible for arising to give rise to itself when it is analyzed in this way, the consequence of an infinite regress is unavoidable. This is the summary of the chapter and the result of the valid cognition.

original: skye bas rang gi bdag nyid ma skyes pas gal te skye ba gzhan la ltos na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon ldog pa med do //
analyzed: skye bas rang gi bdag nyid ma skyes pas gal te skye ba gzhan la ltos na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon ldog pa med do //
translated: Since arising does not give rise to itself, if it were to depend on another arising, the fault of an infinite regress would be unavoidable.

original: des ni re zhig skye bas bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni re zhig skye bas bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that arising does not give rise to itself.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re de ltar skye bas rang gi bdag nyid kyang mi skyed pa skye ba gzhan la ltos pas yang thug pa med par thal par 'gyur ba ldog pa med pas /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re de ltar skye bas rang gi bdag nyid kyang mi skyed pa skye ba gzhan la ltos pas yang thug pa med par thal par 'gyur ba ldog pa med pas /
translated: In this context, if the opponent says that arising does not give rise to itself, but since it depends on another arising, the consequence of an infinite regress is unavoidable,

original: 'o na skye ba ni rang gis kyang mi skyed la gzhan gyis kyang mi skyed pa 'dus ma byas su gyur pas 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis
analyzed: 'o na skye ba ni rang gis kyang mi skyed la gzhan gyis kyang mi skyed pa 'dus ma byas su gyur pas 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis
translated: In response to this former position, the author of the commentary here says:

original: / skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin na yang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin na yang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If arising and so on were unconditioned, then it would be as you say,üîΩthat they are not conditioned because they are unconditioned.

original: de dag 'dus byas min zhes bya ba de de bzhin du gnas pa nyid yin pas skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba
analyzed: de dag 'dus byas min zhes bya ba de de bzhin du gnas pa nyid yin pas skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba
translated: But since they exist just as they are, the error arises that the meaning of the reason is not established, because they possess arising and so on, which are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: smras so // yang gzhan yang skye bar smra ba @129a * //
analyzed: smras so // yang gzhan yang skye bar smra ba @129a * //
translated: Moreover, if arising were to give rise to itself,

original: dag la ci skye bas skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am skye bzhin pa ci zhig skyed par byed ces dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de la /üîΩskye bas bskyed par bya ba gzhan de skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: dag la ci skye bas skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am skye bzhin pa ci zhig skyed par byed ces dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de la / skye bas bskyed par bya ba gzhan de skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am /
translated: One should ask: What is generated by that which is arising, that which has arisen, or that now arising?üîΩIn response to the assertion that arising generates another,

original: skye bzhin pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
translated: one should ask: Does arising generate that which is to be generated, which is another, that which has arisen, that which has not arisen, or that now arising?

original: rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: It is shown that none of these possibilities is tenable.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du dgongs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du dgongs nas bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, thinking that all possibilities are untenable, it is said:

original: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
translated: That which has arisen, not arisen, or is now arising

original: ci lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
analyzed: ci lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
translated: Is not generated in any way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩsong dang ma song bgom pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / song dang ma song bgom pa yis //
translated: How is that?

original: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //
translated: It is explained by ‚Äúgone, not gone, and that being gone over.‚Äù

original: ji ltar der rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar der rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Just as inference was extensively explained there, it should be stated here as well.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba brtag pa'i skabs der //üîΩre zhig song la 'gro med de //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba brtag pa'i skabs der // re zhig song la 'gro med de //
translated: Just as in the context of the analysis of going,üîΩOne does not go where one has gone.

original: ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
analyzed: ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
translated: One does not go where one has not gone.

original: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
analyzed: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from where one has gone and where one has not gone,

original: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One cannot say ‚Äúgoing where one is going.‚Äù

original: zhes bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang /üîΩre zhig skyes pa mi skyed de //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang / re zhig skyes pa mi skyed de //
translated: Just as this has been explained,üîΩOne does not cause the generation of that which has arisen.

original: ma skyes pa yang skyed mi byed //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang skyed mi byed //
translated: One does not cause the generation of that which has not arisen.

original: skyes dang ma skyes ma gtogs par //
analyzed: skyes dang ma skyes ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from that which has arisen and that which has not arisen,

original: skye bzhin shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One cannot say ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising.‚Äù

original: zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //üîΩskye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ba yin no // skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed de /
translated: This is what should be said.

original: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not a valid reason that ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising is not generated,‚Äù he says, ultimately, that which is in the process of arising is not generated because its nature is not ascertained, like that which is in the process of ceasing.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'gag bzhin pa ni ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin cing med pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin cing med pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'gag bzhin pa ni ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin cing med pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin cing med pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, that now arising is not ascertained as an entity and does not exist, and therefore arising does not cause it to arise.

original: yang na don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: yang na don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Or, in terms of ultimate reality, that now arising is not caused to arise.üîΩFor example, that now ceasing is not caused to arise because it is directed to the transition to another time.

original: dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na 'gag bzhin pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang skad cig ma'i rgyun @129b gyis dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogsüîΩpa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'gag bzhin pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang skad cig ma'i rgyun @129b gyis dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, that now arising is not generated by arising because it is directed to the transition to another time through the continuum of moments.

original: tshad ma snga mas ni don dam par skye bzhin pa med pas skye bas skyed par mi byed pa bstan la /
analyzed: tshad ma snga mas ni don dam par skye bzhin pa med pas skye bas skyed par mi byed pa bstan la /
translated: The former valid cognition teaches that arising does not generate that now arising because it does not exist ultimately.

original: 'dis ni kun rdzob tu skye bzhin pa skad cig ma yin pas skye bas skyed par mi byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rdzob tu skye bzhin pa skad cig ma yin pas skye bas skyed par mi byed pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches that arising does not generate that now arising conventionally because it is momentary.

original: khyad par ni de yod do //
analyzed: khyad par ni de yod do //
translated: The difference is that.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re kun rdzob tu skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad ni ma skyes pa yin pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa yang ma yin la dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa yang
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re kun rdzob tu skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad ni ma skyes pa yin pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa yang ma yin la dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa yang
translated: Here, if the opponent says: That now arising is conventionally called that now arising because it is not generated in the least, it is not that its nature is not ascertained and it is directed to the transition to another time.

original: ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that is not so.

original: khyod kyi sgrub pa snga ma dag kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: khyod kyi sgrub pa snga ma dag kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to the former opponent‚Äôs position, ‚ÄúYour previous proofs do not harm us,‚Äù the author of the commentary here says:

original: ci ste skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de cung zad ni skyes cung zad ni ma skyes pa'o zhes bya bar rtog na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so /
analyzed: ci ste skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de cung zad ni skyes cung zad ni ma skyes pa'o zhes bya bar rtog na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so /
translated: If you think that which is in the process of arising is partly arisen and partly not arisen,üîΩIn response to that, in order to demonstrate the former hypothesis, he says:

original: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir de lta na yang de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skyed par mi byed de //
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir de lta na yang de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skyed par mi byed de //
translated: Even so, that which is partly arisen is not generated.

original: de'i skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because its arising would be pointless.

original: gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skyes zin pa yin pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skyes zin pa yin pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed de /
translated: That which is partly arisen is not generated by arising because that which is partly arisen has already arisen.

original: de'i skye ba don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro gzhan yang de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skye ba des bskyed pa ma yin la skyes pa de skye bzhin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i skye ba don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro gzhan yang de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skye ba des bskyed pa ma yin la skyes pa de skye bzhin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which has arisen a little is not generated by that arising, and that which has arisen is not in the process of arising.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de skyes na skye bzhin pa ma yin zhing skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de skyes na skye bzhin pa ma yin zhing skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is said that if it has arisen, it is not in the process of arising and that which is in the process of arising does not generate it.

original: gal te cung zad skyes pa de skye ba med pa kho nar skyes na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du skye ba med pa kho nar skye bar 'gyur bar nges so //
analyzed: gal te cung zad skyes pa de skye ba med pa kho nar skyes na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du skye ba med pa kho nar skye bar 'gyur bar nges so //
translated: If that which has arisen a little were to arise without arising, then it is certain that the remainder would also arise without arising.

original: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni skye ba med pa kho nar skyes la cung zad ni skye bas skyed par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni skye ba med pa kho nar skyes la cung zad ni skye bas skyed par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else, it must be explained what the difference is between that which has arisen without arising and that which is generated by arising.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de yang skye ba kho nas skyed na ni de lta na ma skyes ba skye bas skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de yang skye ba kho nas skyed na ni de lta na ma skyes ba skye bas skyed par byed kyi /
translated: But if that which has arisen a little is generated by arising, then in that case that which has not arisen is generated by arising.

original: skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: That now arising does not generate that now arising.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de yang skye bas skyed par byed na ni de la skye ba gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de yang skye bas skyed par byed na ni de la skye ba gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if that which is generated to some degree by that now arising is generated by that now arising, then it would have a distinction made by two arisings, but it does not.

original: skyes zin pa de la ni yang bskyed pa'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir de'i gang yang cung zad skyes pa de ni skye bas @130a * //üîΩskyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skyes zin pa de la ni yang bskyed pa'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir de'i gang yang cung zad skyes pa de ni skye bas @130a * // skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Because that which has already arisen does not commence any activity whatsoever, since it is generated again. Therefore, that which is generated to some degree by that now arising is not generated by that now arising.

original: brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir de'i gang cung zad ma skyes pa de yang skyed par mi byed de skye bas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir de'i gang cung zad ma skyes pa de yang skyed par mi byed de skye bas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate the latter analysis, he says, That which is not generated to some degree by that now arising is not generated by that now arising, because it is empty of arising, like the future.

original: de ltar de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de skye bas skyed par mi byed pas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de skye bas skyed par mi byed pas /
translated: Thus, that which is generated to some degree by that now arising is not generated by that now arising.

original: des de'i lhag ma gang cung zad ma skyes pa de skye bas skyed par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des de'i lhag ma gang cung zad ma skyes pa de skye bas skyed par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would follow that it generates that which is not yet arisen, that is, its remainder.üîΩSince that which is in the process of arising is generated, the statement ‚ÄúIt generates that which is in the process of arising‚Äù would be undermined.

original: de lta na skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur pas de'i gang cung zad ma skyes pa de yang skyed par mi byed pa'i tshang ma nyid 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: de lta na skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur pas de'i gang cung zad ma skyes pa de yang skyed par mi byed pa'i tshang ma nyid 'dis bstan te /
translated: This refutes the assertion that it generates that which is not yet arisen.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na ma 'ongs pa ni skye bas stong pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ma 'ongs pa ni skye bas stong pa'i phyir skye bas skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because the future is empty of arising, arising does not generate it.

original: de'i gang cung zad ma skyes pa de yang skye bas stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i gang cung zad ma skyes pa de yang skye bas stong pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, because that which is not yet arisen is empty of arising,

original: skye bas skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye bas skyed par mi byed do //
translated: arising does not generate it.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad skyes pa dang cung zad ma skyes pa ma yin gyi skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad skyes pa dang cung zad ma skyes pa ma yin gyi skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa yin pas /
translated: Here, the opponent might say, that which is called ‚Äúthat now arising‚Äù is not something that is partly arisen and partly non-arisen, but rather it is that which is directed toward arising.üîΩThus, the former proof does not invalidate our position.

original: khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma des kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma des kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary raises the following objection:

original: gal te skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: If that now arising is that which is directed toward arising,

original: brgal zhing brtag pa ni de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa ni de gang zhig yin /
translated: then the question is, what is that?

original: skyes pa zhig gam 'on te ma skyes pa zhig yin zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa zhig gam 'on te ma skyes pa zhig yin zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
translated: Is it that which has arisen or is it that which has not arisen?

original: lan kyang skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed de de'i skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan kyang skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed de de'i skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The response is that that which has arisen does not generate itself because its arising would be pointless.

original: ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do skye bas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do skye bas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It does not cause the generation of that which has not yet arisen, because it is empty of arising, like the future.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /üîΩci mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ram 'on te rjes su dpag pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol po dag dbu ma'i gtan tshigs kyi don ngo bo nyid nges
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin / ci mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ram 'on te rjes su dpag pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol po dag dbu ma'i gtan tshigs kyi don ngo bo nyid nges
translated: What is the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the nature is not ascertained‚Äù?üîΩIs it because the nature is not ascertained by direct perception, or is it because the nature is not ascertained by inference?

original: pas ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni ma nges pa nyid yin @130b la /
analyzed: pas ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni ma nges pa nyid yin @130b la /
translated: The opponent says that the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason ‚Äúbecause the nature is not ascertained‚Äù is that the nature is not ascertained by direct perception.üîΩIf that is established, then it is uncertain.

original: rjes su dpag pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes gal te gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes gal te gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
translated: If you prove that it is because the intrinsic reality is not ascertained by inference, then the meaning is unestablished.

original: de la brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni ma nges pa nyid de mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i dngos po la yang skye bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni ma nges pa nyid de mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i dngos po la yang skye bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you think that there are two alternatives, then in the first case, it is not established because it arises in regard to things whose intrinsic reality is not ascertained by direct perception.

original: dbang po dang yid dang rang rig pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i dngos po la yang skye bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang yid dang rang rig pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i dngos po la yang skye bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it arises in regard to things whose intrinsic reality is not ascertained by the direct perception of the sense faculties, the mind, reflexive awareness, and yogins.

original: brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni don ma gru  pa nyid te /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma shos bstan pa'i phyir brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni don ma gru  pa nyid te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second alternative, he says, in the second case, the meaning is unestablished.

original: skye ba la brten nas skye zhing skye bas skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba la brten nas skye zhing skye bas skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because arising is inferred in dependence on arising, and because arising is inferred by arising.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba dag ni skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba dag ni skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The conditions for the arising of eye consciousness‚Äîthe eye, form, light, space, and attention‚Äîare called arising.

original: de la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing skye ba de'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa yod par rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing skye ba de'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa yod par rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because eye consciousness arises in dependence on them, and because eye consciousness that is arising is inferred through the existence of that arising.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba
translated: For those who say that all things are essentially natureless, since things that are perceived by direct perception and inference do not exist, the counter position does not exist, and therefore it is not indeterminate.

original: la sogs pa smras te dbu ma pa dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa'i dngos po'i yod pa nyid med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos po'i
analyzed: la sogs pa smras te dbu ma pa dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa'i dngos po'i yod pa nyid med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos po'i
translated: For those who speak of the nature of all things, the ultimate reality of the nonexistence of intrinsic reality, the existence of things that are perceived by direct perception and inference does not exist.

original: yod pa nyid gzhan zhig yod na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur grang na de med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid gzhan zhig yod na ni des na ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur grang na de med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If there were another existence of things that is the opposite of that, then it would be indefinite. But since that does not exist, it is not indefinite.

original: don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te gal te ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te gal te ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Nor is the meaning unestablished. If it is asked how,

original: gang tshe skye ba yod pas ni //
analyzed: gang tshe skye ba yod pas ni //
translated: when there is arising,

original: skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe /
analyzed: skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe /
translated: this arising exists without arising.

original: khyed na re skye ba la brten nas skye zhing skye bas skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes zer bas de nyid 'dir brtag par bya ste ci ste yod pa'am yod med cig yin grang na /
analyzed: khyed na re skye ba la brten nas skye zhing skye bas skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes zer bas de nyid 'dir brtag par bya ste ci ste yod pa'am yod med cig yin grang na /
translated: You say that based on arising, arising arises, and that arising is inferred. That should be examined here. If it is asked whether it exists or does not exist,

original: de dag dgag pa yang rgyas par bstan zin pas /
analyzed: de dag dgag pa yang rgyas par bstan zin pas /
translated: the refutation of those has been extensively taught.

original: ji ltar skye la brten @131a * //
analyzed: ji ltar skye la brten @131a * //
translated: Just as one should sayüîΩ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising

original: nas ni // skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: nas ni // skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya //
translated: in dependence on arising.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin bskyed do zhes brjod par bya bas ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin bskyed do zhes brjod par bya bas ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin par ston te /
translated: At that time, just as one should say ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising is generated in dependence on arising,‚Äù this shows that the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.üîΩPreviously it was said:üîΩWhen a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: sngar / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
analyzed: sngar / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ci ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya /
analyzed: ci ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya /
translated: how could it be called a productive cause?

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were, it would be illogical.

original: zhes bya bas rkyen rnams kyi dngos po skyed par mi byed pa bstan zin pas khyod kyi skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag go zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rkyen rnams kyi dngos po skyed par mi byed pa bstan zin pas khyod kyi skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag go zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it has already been shown that conditions do not produce things, it is not tenable to say ‚Äúarising is inferred in dependence on arising.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is no inference, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the nature is not ascertained‚Äù is not unestablished. This is the summary of the chapter.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: dper na mi mkhas pa la la zhig mtshon thabs mkhas pas ma gsod cing skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa kun du spyod par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mi mkhas pa la la zhig mtshon thabs mkhas pas ma gsod cing skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa kun du spyod par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as an unskilled person kills his mother with a weapon and engages in the conduct of an ignoble person,üîΩso too you, through being skilled in sophistry, refute the mode of dependent origination taught by the supreme sage and through that engage in the conduct of an ignoble person.

original: khyod kyang rtog ge la mkhas pas drang srong mchog gis gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi skyed ma sun 'byin cing 'phags pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa rjes su sgrub pas sngar khas blangs pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro
analyzed: khyod kyang rtog ge la mkhas pas drang srong mchog gis gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi skyed ma sun 'byin cing 'phags pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa rjes su sgrub pas sngar khas blangs pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro
translated: This is the damage to your original assertion.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rkyen tshogs pa la brten nas 'bras bu skye bzhin pa yod pas skye bas skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rkyen tshogs pa la brten nas 'bras bu skye bzhin pa yod pas skye bas skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement that proves that because the arising of an existent effect that is in the process of arising in dependence on the assembly of its conditions exists, arising gives rise to that which is in the process of arising.

original: lung las 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye'o zhes gsungs pa khyed dbu ma pas kyang khas blangs la /
analyzed: lung las 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye'o zhes gsungs pa khyed dbu ma pas kyang khas blangs la /
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way accept that the scriptures say, ‚ÄúThis existing, that comes to be; because of the arising of this, that arises.‚Äù

original: da 'dir de med par ston pa ni khas blangs pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da 'dir de med par ston pa ni khas blangs pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, to teach that it does not exist is to contradict your own assertions.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary explains:

original: gdul ba rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa lta ba ngan pa dge ba'i phyogs rtsa nas 'byin pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi lta ba ngan pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gdul ba rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa lta ba ngan pa dge ba'i phyogs rtsa nas 'byin pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi lta ba ngan pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir 'di skad ces /
translated: In order to wash away the stains of bad views of those to be tamed who deny causes and effects, who possess the root of the side of nonvirtue, it is said:

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩ'di yod pas 'di 'byung la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de kun rdzob tu gsungs kyi don dam par ma gsungs par khas len pas khas blangs pa'i
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de kun rdzob tu gsungs kyi don dam par ma gsungs par khas len pas khas blangs pa'i
translated: ‚ÄúIt is like this.üîΩBecause this exists, that arises. Because this is produced, that is produced. For example, due to the condition of ignorance, there are compositional factors.‚Äù

original: gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since it is accepted that this was taught in terms of the conventional and not in terms of the ultimate, it is said that there is no contradiction with what is accepted.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang bstan @131b zin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang bstan @131b zin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic of that, it is also taught here.

original: gong du ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gong du ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What was taught above?

original: dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyis //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyis //
translated: Things that lack intrinsic reality

original: yod pa gang phyir yod min na //
analyzed: yod pa gang phyir yod min na //
translated: Do not exist in any way.üîΩTherefore, it is not tenable

original: 'di yod pas ni 'di 'byung zhes //üîΩbya ba de ni 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: 'di yod pas ni 'di 'byung zhes // bya ba de ni 'thad ma yin //
translated: To say, ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that arises.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba der de bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der de bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This was taught there.

original: sngar bdag po'i rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su de bstan zin to //
analyzed: sngar bdag po'i rkyen brtag pa'i skabs su de bstan zin to //
translated: This was taught above in the chapter on the dominant condition.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag gis brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni brdar btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag gis brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni brdar btags pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the dependent origination imputed by the opponent is a conventional imputation.

original: dbu ma pas brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni don dam pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang bshad pa /
analyzed: dbu ma pas brtags pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni don dam pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang bshad pa /
translated: In order to teach that the dependent origination imputed by the MƒÅdhyamika is ultimate, it is said here:

original: rten cing 'byung ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'byung ba gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
translated: Is peace by nature.

original: dngos po rten cing 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po rten cing 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ste /
translated: Whatever things are dependently arisen are ultimately peace by nature.

original: skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The meaning is that they are nonarisen.

original: rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ste skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ste skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúdependent origination‚Äù is that whatever is a dependent origination is itself peace, that is, non-arisen.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: To demonstrate the source of this, the BhagavƒÅn said in the S≈´tra of the Questions of the NƒÅga King Anavatapta:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //
translated: Whatever arises from conditions does not arise.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med //
translated: It does not have the essence of arising.

original: gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa de stong gsungs //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa de stong gsungs //
translated: Whatever depends on conditions is said to be empty.

original: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //
translated: Those who know emptiness are diligent.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: And in other s≈´tras of the same genre:

original: gang dag brten nas skye ba ni //
analyzed: gang dag brten nas skye ba ni //
translated: Whatever arises dependently

original: de dag dngos nyid gang yang med //
analyzed: de dag dngos nyid gang yang med //
translated: does not arise in essence.

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: Whatever does not arise essentially

original: de dag gar yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag gar yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: does not arise in any way.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: And similarly, the noble Descent into Lanka Sutra says:

original: blo gros chen po ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bstan to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bstan to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúMahamati, intending the non-arising by way of intrinsic reality, I taught that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality.‚ÄùüîΩThus, because the opponents themselves are biased, their refutations are like throwing a handful of dust

original: de'i phyir de ltar pha rol po dag zhe 'gras pa'i blo nyid kyis sun 'byin pa nye bar 'jog pas sgrub pa ni dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa la dri ma can du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar pha rol po dag zhe 'gras pa'i blo nyid kyis sun 'byin pa nye bar 'jog pas sgrub pa ni dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa la dri ma can du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: at the stainless orb of the moon in order to sully it.

original: thal ba spar gang 'thor ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re mi mkhas pa la la zhig mtshon thabs mkhas pas ma gsod cing skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa kun du spyod par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: thal ba spar gang 'thor ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re mi mkhas pa la la zhig mtshon thabs mkhas pas ma gsod cing skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa kun du spyod par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: As was said earlier, some unwise people, skilled in the art of killing, kill their mothers and engage in the conduct of non-virtuous beings.

original: @132a * // khyod kyang rtog ge la mkhas pas drang srong mchog gis gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi skyed ma sun 'byin cing 'phags pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa rjes su sgrub pas sngar khas blangs pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro
analyzed: @132a * // khyod kyang rtog ge la mkhas pas drang srong mchog gis gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi skyed ma sun 'byin cing 'phags pa ma yin pa'i spyad pa rjes su sgrub pas sngar khas blangs pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro
translated: You are skilled in logic, but you refute the mode of dependent origination taught by the supreme sage, the mother of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and you practice the conduct of non-ƒÅryas. Therefore you will be harmed by your former commitments.

original: zhes zer ba'i tshig dor gyi lan yin no //
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i tshig dor gyi lan yin no //
translated: This is the response to the words of the opponent.

original: de phyir skye bzhin nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de phyir skye bzhin nyid dang ni //
translated: Therefore that now arising

original: skye ba yang ni zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni zhi ba nyid //
translated: And arising are peaceful.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir yang dag par brtags na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba med de /
