analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir yang dag par brtags na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba med de /
translated: Thus, when properly analyzed, arising does not exist in dependent origination.

original: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa de'i phyir skye bzhin pa nyid dang skye ba yang zhi ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa de'i phyir skye bzhin pa nyid dang skye ba yang zhi ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because it is like an illusion, therefore that now arising and arising are peaceful. This is the teaching on the mode of ultimate dependent origination.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi zhing skye ba med pa de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la skye bzhin
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi zhing skye ba med pa de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la skye bzhin
translated: As such, because both that which is called dependent and that which is called arising are both by nature peace and non-arising, therefore, those who propound dependent arising do not assert that things arise from themselves, from another, from both, or from no cause.üîΩ

original: pa dang skye ba gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid kyis zhi zhing skye ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa dang skye ba gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid kyis zhi zhing skye ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: As such, because both that which is called ‚Äúdependent‚Äù and that which is called ‚Äúarising‚Äù are both by nature peace and non-arising, therefore for those who propound dependent origination, both that which is in the process of arising and arising itself are by nature peace and non-arising.üîΩThis is the conclusion.

original: de la pha rol pos skye ba la brten nas don dam par skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes gang smras pa de yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩpha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid ma nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la pha rol pos skye ba la brten nas don dam par skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes gang smras pa de yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩpha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid ma nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag pas ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúBased on arising, arising in the ultimate sense should be inferred.‚Äù This is not correct.üîΩThe opponent says, ‚ÄúThe reason of the Followers of the Middle Way is not ascertained. The reason is not established because it is not ascertained by inference.‚Äù

original: skye ba la brten nas don dam par skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la brten nas don dam par skye bzhin pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: But that is a fallacious refutation.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa rgyu dang rkyen de dang de dag la brten nas bum pa skye ba dang snam bu skye ba de dag mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa rgyu dang rkyen de dang de dag la brten nas bum pa skye ba dang snam bu skye ba de dag mthong ste /
translated: Others say: A vase arises in dependence on such and such causes and conditions and a cloth arises in dependence on such and such causes and conditions.

original: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pas /
analyzed: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pas /
translated: Since there is no valid cognition other than seeing,üîΩit is illogical to say:

original: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
translated: That which is arisen, that not yet arisen, and that now arising

original: ji lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
translated: are not produced in any way.

original: ces gang smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag skye bas dngos po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye bzhin pa dag skyed pa 'jig rten na mngon sum du mthong bas khyed kyis de dag mi 'thad par
analyzed: ces gang smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag skye bas dngos po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye bzhin pa dag skyed pa 'jig rten na mngon sum du mthong bas khyed kyis de dag mi 'thad par
translated: This is because the opponent says: Since it is directly perceived in the world that things arise in dependence on causes and conditions, it is illogical for you

original: bsgrubs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: to prove that they are untenable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa tshogs kyi rjes su mthun pa dag mthong ba la su zhig 'ga' @132b bar byed do /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa tshogs kyi rjes su mthun pa dag mthong ba la su zhig 'ga' @132b bar byed do /
translated: Who would deny the existence of those who are compatible with the path of accumulation, such as those who possess ethical discipline?

original: de dag ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are conventional, but they are not ultimate.

original: de bas na de dag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spang bar 'dod pas bstan bcos brtsams pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spang bar 'dod pas bstan bcos brtsams pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since this treatise was composed in order to abandon attachment to those and so on, there is no fault.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang dbang po'i sdom pa la sogs pa tshogs kyi lam gyi rjes su mthun pa dag 'jig rten na mngon sum du mthong ba la kho bo cag kyang skur ba mi 'debs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang dbang po'i sdom pa la sogs pa tshogs kyi lam gyi rjes su mthun pa dag 'jig rten na mngon sum du mthong ba la kho bo cag kyang skur ba mi 'debs te /
translated: We do not deny the existence of those who are compatible with the path of accumulation, such as those who possess the vows of ethical discipline and the vows of the sense faculties, who are seen in the world.

original: de dag tha snyad pa yin pa la khyed cag don dam par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis bstan bcos brtsams pa mdzad pas nyes pa med do /
analyzed: de dag tha snyad pa yin pa la khyed cag don dam par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis bstan bcos brtsams pa mdzad pas nyes pa med do /
translated: Since they are conventional, the master composed this treatise in order to abandon your attachment to them as ultimate, so there is no fault.

original: // / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
translated: 39.üîΩ

original: ci ste bum pa skye'o zhes bya ba dang / snam bu skye'o zhes bya ba de dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ma yin bar ci ltar nges par gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa skye'o zhes bya ba dang / snam bu skye'o zhes bya ba de dag tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ma yin bar ci ltar nges par gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: Now, if one asks, ‚ÄúHow can one ascertain that the statement ‚ÄòA pot arises‚Äô and the statement ‚ÄòA cloth arises‚Äô are conventional expressions and not ultimate?

original: de nyon cig /'di la skyes na bum pa dang snam bu yin gyi ma skyes na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyon cig /'di la skyes na bum pa dang snam bu yin gyi ma skyes na ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äù Listen to this: If something arises, it is a pot or a cloth, but if it does not arise, it is not.

original: skyes pa la ni yang skye ba med pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu skye'o zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skyes pa la ni yang skye ba med pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu skye'o zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Since that which has arisen does not arise again, it is untenable to say, ‚ÄòA pot or a cloth arises.‚Äô

original: ci ste ma skyes kyang bum pa blo la bzhag nas ming sgro btags te /
analyzed: ci ste ma skyes kyang bum pa blo la bzhag nas ming sgro btags te /
translated: But if, although it does not arise, one posits a pot in the mind and imputes the name ‚Äòpot‚Äô and says, ‚ÄòA pot arises,‚Äô that is just a convention, because the arising of a pot that is posited in the mind does not exist.

original: bum pa skye'o zhe'o zhes brjod na ni de tha snyad tsam du zad de blo la bzhag pa'i bum pa la ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye ba de la brten nas de la skye bzhin pa skyed pa mi 'thad
analyzed: bum pa skye'o zhe'o zhes brjod na ni de tha snyad tsam du zad de blo la bzhag pa'i bum pa la ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye ba de la brten nas de la skye bzhin pa skyed pa mi 'thad
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBecause that which is in the process of arising gives rise to that which is in the process of arising in dependence on arising‚Äù is untenable.

original: par bstan pa de nyid brnan pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa ston to //
analyzed: par bstan pa de nyid brnan pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa ston to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that point, he teaches the beginning of the next verse.üîΩSince arising does not exist for that which is arisen and does not exist for that

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa la yang med la ma skyes pa la yang med pa'i phyir skye bar brjod pa ni tha snyad tsam du zad de don dam par med pas skye ba de la brten nas skye bzhin pa bskyed de zhes bya ba med
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa la yang med la ma skyes pa la yang med pa'i phyir skye bar brjod pa ni tha snyad tsam du zad de don dam par med pas skye ba de la brten nas skye bzhin pa bskyed de zhes bya ba med
translated: which is not arisen, the statement ‚Äúarising‚Äù is mere conventional expression.

original: par bstan te //
analyzed: par bstan te //
translated: Since it does not exist ultimately, it is demonstrated that it is not the case thatüîΩthat which is in the process of arising is generated in dependence on arising.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas think that since form, etc., and pots, etc., arise only

original: bye brag tu smra ba gang dag gzugs la sogs pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa dag dus 'pho ba'i phyir yod pa kho na las skye bar rtog na zhes bya bas ni bye brag tu smra ba thams cad yod par smra ba dag dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams ni yod pa kho na las ma 'ongs pa'i dus
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba gang dag gzugs la sogs pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa dag dus 'pho ba'i phyir yod pa kho na las skye bar rtog na zhes bya bas ni bye brag tu smra ba thams cad yod par smra ba dag dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams ni yod pa kho na las ma 'ongs pa'i dus
translated: from that which exists, because they pass through time.

original: nas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho zhing da ltar gyi dus nas kyang 'das pa'i dus su 'pho ba'i phyir de dag yod pa kho na las skye bas skye ba de la brten nas rtsa ba'i skye bas skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar rtogüîΩpas / 'dir de dag na re dngos po ni med pa las skye ba ma yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bum pa gzugs dang ro dang @133a * //
analyzed: nas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho zhing da ltar gyi dus nas kyang 'das pa'i dus su 'pho ba'i phyir de dag yod pa kho na las skye bas skye ba de la brten nas rtsa ba'i skye bas skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar rtog pas / 'dir de dag na re dngos po ni med pa las skye ba ma yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bum pa gzugs dang ro dang @133a * //
translated: Since they exist, they arise from that, and in dependence on that arising, the root birth gives rise to that which is being born.

original: dri dang reg pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa de da ltar byung ba'i dus su bum pa'i ngo bo nyid 'pho zhing skye la /
analyzed: dri dang reg pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa de da ltar byung ba'i dus su bum pa'i ngo bo nyid 'pho zhing skye la /
translated: They say: Things do not arise from nonthings, but in the future the vase exists as the entity of form, taste, smell, and tactility. At the time of its presence, the entity of the vase is transferred and arises.

original: da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su yang de bzhin du ci rigs par 'pho zhing skye bas skye ba de la brten nas rtsa ba'i skye pas skye bzhin pa de skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su yang de bzhin du ci rigs par 'pho zhing skye bas skye ba de la brten nas rtsa ba'i skye pas skye bzhin pa de skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: And from the present to the past, it is transferred and arises in the past in the same way, as is appropriate. In dependence on that arising, the root birth gives rise to that which is being born.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary says: That is also illogical.

original: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
translated: If an unarisen thing

original: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na /
translated: existed somewhere,

original: gal te bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig rkyen rnams sam de dag 'dus pa'am gzhan la yod par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba la sogs la smras so //
analyzed: gal te bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig rkyen rnams sam de dag 'dus pa'am gzhan la yod par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba la sogs la smras so //
translated: If an unarisen thing such as a vase or cloth existed in conditions, in their assembly, or elsewhere,

original: de ni ci phyir der skye 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ci phyir der skye 'gyur //
translated: why would it arise there?üîΩWhy would that existent arise at that time? The point is that it would be pointless for an existent to arise.

original: yod pa de ci'i phyir dus der skye bar 'gyur te yod pa skye ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gal te bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar dngos po skye ba'i sngon rol
analyzed: yod pa de ci'i phyir dus der skye bar 'gyur te yod pa skye ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gal te bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar dngos po skye ba'i sngon rol
translated: If, as the Vaibhasikas assert, a thing existed prior to its arising,

original: ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig rkyen rnams so so'am /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig rkyen rnams so so'am /
translated: If an unarisen thing existed in the future, either individually or

original: de dag 'dus pa'am de las gzhan pa'i phyogs shed na yod par gyur na /
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa'am de las gzhan pa'i phyogs shed na yod par gyur na /
translated: collectively, or in some other place,üîΩthen why would it pass from the future to the present, and from the present

original: yod pa de ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus der 'pho zhing skye ba dang / da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su 'pho zhing skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa de ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus der 'pho zhing skye ba dang / da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su 'pho zhing skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: to the past?üîΩThe point is that if it existed, it would be pointless for it to arise, and so

original: yod pa skye ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir yod pa dus 'pho zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa skye ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir yod pa dus 'pho zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: that which exists does not pass from one time to another and arise.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / yod na skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yod na skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, it would not arise.

original: zhes bya ba smras te zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion.üîΩThe point is that an existent thing does not pass from one time to another

original: dngos po yod pa dus 'pho zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dus 'pho zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and arise.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni skye ba'i sngon rol na dngos po ma skyes pa yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa ni yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas skye ba med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skye ba bsal ba'i phyir yod par smra baüîΩrnams kyi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa'i skyon bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma 'dis ni yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa de ni rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni skye ba'i sngon rol na dngos po ma skyes pa yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa ni yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas skye ba med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skye ba bsal ba'i phyir yod par smra ba rnams kyi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa'i skyon bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma 'dis ni yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa de ni rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung
translated: Thus, this verse demonstrates that the thesis of those who say that an unarisen thing exists prior to its arising is untenable because it is undermined by their own inferences.

original: bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This verse demonstrates that the thesis of those who say that a thing exists is untenable because it is undermined by their own inferences.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause their thesis is inferred to be the prior existence of a thing, and that which exists is not arisen, since it is undermined by arising.

original: de dag gi dam bcas pa ni dngos @133b po snga na yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa yin pas des na gang yod pa de ni skye ba med pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pas skye ba bsal ba'i phyir yod pa skye'o zhes smra ba de
analyzed: de dag gi dam bcas pa ni dngos @133b po snga na yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa yin pas des na gang yod pa de ni skye ba med pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pas skye ba bsal ba'i phyir yod pa skye'o zhes smra ba de
translated: Therefore, those who say that an existent thing arises

original: dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: would contradict their own inferences.

original: yod par smra ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag dngos po rnams yod pa kho na las skye bar smra ba dag go //
analyzed: yod par smra ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag dngos po rnams yod pa kho na las skye bar smra ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe proponents of existence‚Äù are those who maintain that things are produced only from existence.

original: dus 'pho bar smra ba rnams la yang yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba med pa nyid kyis da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba bsal ba'i phyir skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong
analyzed: dus 'pho bar smra ba rnams la yang yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba med pa nyid kyis da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba bsal ba'i phyir skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong
translated: Since it is inferred that they exist, the error is still present, because they are refuted as being transferred into the present, since they do not transfer into the present.

original: ma 'dis dus 'pho bar smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa de yang rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dis dus 'pho bar smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa de yang rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This verse above shows that the thesis of the proponents of the transference of time is also untenable because it is erroneous in contradicting their own inferences.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de dag gi dam bcas pa yang dngos po snga na yod pa nyid rjes su dpog pa yin pas des na gang yod pa de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba med pa nyid yin pas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba
analyzed: de dag gi dam bcas pa yang dngos po snga na yod pa nyid rjes su dpog pa yin pas des na gang yod pa de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba med pa nyid yin pas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho ba
translated: Since their thesis is the inference of the prior existence of things, then whatever exists does not transfer from the future to the present.

original: bsal ba'i phyir dus 'pho bar smra ba de dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir dus 'pho bar smra ba de dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute transfer to the present, their inference is undermined.

original: dus 'pho bar smra ba zhes bya ba de ni gang dag dngos po rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho zhing da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su 'pho bar smra ba dag go //
analyzed: dus 'pho bar smra ba zhes bya ba de ni gang dag dngos po rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus su 'pho zhing da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su 'pho bar smra ba dag go //
translated: Those who propound the transfer of time are those who propound that things transfer from the future to the present and from the present to the past.

original: 'dis ni dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang gnas skabs dang gzhan pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dag gi lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yod par smra ba rnams dang dus 'pho bar smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa mi 'thad
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang gnas skabs dang gzhan pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dag gi lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yod par smra ba rnams dang dus 'pho bar smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa mi 'thad
translated: This refutes the assertions of those who propound existence and those who propound the transfer of time.

original: par bstan pa'i skabs 'dis ni dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba dang / mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba dang gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba dang gzhan pa gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba zhes bya ba dag gi lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: par bstan pa'i skabs 'dis ni dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba dang / mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba dang gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba dang gzhan pa gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba zhes bya ba dag gi lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This section responds to the proponents of transformation of state, transformation of characteristics, transformation of other and transformation of another.

original: de la dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa dharma tra ta ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa dharma tra ta ste /
translated: The proponent of transformation of state is the venerable master DharmatrƒÅta, a VaibhƒÅ·π£ika master.üîΩHe says: For example, the nature of gold is merely transformed into the state of an object such as a bracelet or necklace, but the nature of gold does not transform.

original: de na re dper na gser gyi ngo bo nyid ni gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi dngos por gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi gser gyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid
analyzed: de na re dper na gser gyi ngo bo nyid ni gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi dngos por gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi gser gyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid
translated: Similarly, the nature of all phenomena is transformed into another state but the nature of phenomena does not transform.

original: kyang ring po dang thung ngu la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //üîΩde la mdo @134a * //
analyzed: kyang ring po dang thung ngu la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro // de la mdo @134a * //
translated: But the shape of things, such as long and short, is subject to change, but the nature of things is not subject to change.

original: sde pa dag na re de ni grangs can gyi phyog  su sa gzhag par bya'o zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sde pa dag na re de ni grangs can gyi phyog  su sa gzhag par bya'o zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that this should be placed in the position of the Samkhyas, but this is not a proper response.

original: 'di ltar btsun pa dharma tra ta na re mdo sde pa dag kyang med par smra ba'i phyogs su gzhag par bya'o zhes zer ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa dharma tra ta na re mdo sde pa dag kyang med par smra ba'i phyogs su gzhag par bya'o zhes zer ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the Bhadanta Dharmatrata says that the Sautrantikas should be placed in the position of the nihilists.

original: 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: Here, the Madhyamikas should respond to this in another way.

original: don dam par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Past and future do not exist as things in the ultimate sense,

original: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin no //
translated: because they are substantial, like the present.

original: des na dharma tra tas dngos po rdzas nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag da ltar bzhin du rdzas nyid yin na de gnyis kyang da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i dam
analyzed: des na dharma tra tas dngos po rdzas nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag da ltar bzhin du rdzas nyid yin na de gnyis kyang da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i dam
translated: Therefore DharmatrƒÅta replies that since things are inferred to be substantial entities, if the past and future were substantial entities like the present, then those two would be the present and the past and future would be refuted.

original: bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa yin no //
translated: Since the thesis has the fault of refuting the intrinsic reality of the subject, it is unacceptable.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa gho sha ka ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa gho sha ka ste /
translated: The proponents of the transformation of characteristics are the venerable master Gho·π£aka, a VaibhƒÅ·π£ika master.

original: de na re dper na mi gcig la chung ma gsum yod pa gcig la lhag par chags kyang gnyis la 'dogs chags dang bral ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de na re dper na mi gcig la chung ma gsum yod pa gcig la lhag par chags kyang gnyis la 'dogs chags dang bral ba ma yin pas /
translated: He says that for example, a man who has three wives is attached to one but is not free of attachment to the other two.

original: lhag par chags pa dang ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar thad kyi mi'i dngos po nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos rnams dus gsum du 'jug pa na yang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi
analyzed: lhag par chags pa dang ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar thad kyi mi'i dngos po nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos rnams dus gsum du 'jug pa na yang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi
translated: Just as the characteristics of a man who is attached and not attached change, but the entity of the man does not change, so too, when phenomena engage the three times, the future possesses the characteristics of the future.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa na da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba ma yin pas ldan pa dang ma bral ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi chos kyi dngos po nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa na da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba ma yin pas ldan pa dang ma bral ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi chos kyi dngos po nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: But the present and past do not lack those characteristics, so the characteristics of possession and non-lack change, but the entity of the phenomenon does not change.

original: de la mdo sde pa dag na re de lta na dus gsum 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde pa dag na re de lta na dus gsum 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say: In that case, the three times would merge.

original: 'di ltar btsun pa gho sha ka na re dus gsum char gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin na ni 'dres par yang 'gyur ba zhig na ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dus na ma 'ongs pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gtso che ba yin
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa gho sha ka na re dus gsum char gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin na ni 'dres par yang 'gyur ba zhig na ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dus na ma 'ongs pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gtso che ba yin
translated: In this way, Bhadanta Gho·π£aka says that if the three times exist as the nature of the manifest, they would be mixed. However, in the time characterized by the future, the future is primary as the nature of the manifest.

original: la da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis nus pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam du zad pas nus pa tsam gyis ni gsal ba dang 'dres par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis nus pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam du zad pas nus pa tsam gyis ni gsal ba dang 'dres par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The present and the past are merely the nature of potentiality, and mere potentiality does not mix with the manifest.

original: 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: Here, a MƒÅdhyamika would respond to that in another way.

original: don dam par ma 'ongs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ma 'ongs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The future is not the nature of the characteristic ultimately.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i @134b mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i @134b mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the nature of the characteristic of the future.

original: dper na da ltar gyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of the characteristic of the present.

original: des na gho sha kas dngos po mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la da ltar bzhin du mtshan nyid yod na de gnyis kyang da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa
analyzed: des na gho sha kas dngos po mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la da ltar bzhin du mtshan nyid yod na de gnyis kyang da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa
translated: Therefore, Vasubandhu replies that it is illogical to state that the past and future exist in the present because if the past and future had characteristics like the present, then they would be present.

original: bsal ba'i phyir de'i dam bcas pa las yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir de'i dam bcas pa las yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the fault of the subject‚Äôs essential nature being refuted would arise from his thesis, it is illogical.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa ba su mi tra ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa ba su mi tra ste /
translated: The master Vasumitra, a VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, says that it is a transformation into another state.

original: de na re dper na gcig mal gyi shod thabs gcig bzhag pa la gcig ces bya zhing de'i sting du bcu dang brgya dang stong mal la sogs pa'i shod thabs kyi gnas skabs gzhan dag bzhag na stong la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi
analyzed: de na re dper na gcig mal gyi shod thabs gcig bzhag pa la gcig ces bya zhing de'i sting du bcu dang brgya dang stong mal la sogs pa'i shod thabs kyi gnas skabs gzhan dag bzhag na stong la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi
translated: For example, if one bed base is placed, it is called one. If another state of ten, one hundred, one thousand beds and so on are placed on it, it is just a transformation into another state of one thousand and so on.

original: gcig mal gyi shod nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gcig mal gyi shod nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a single bed is called another when it is used by another, but it is not different in substance,

original: chos rnams dus gsum du 'jug pa na yang ma 'ongs pa nas da ltar dang 'das pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du gyur ba na gnas skabs gzhan du brjod par zad kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos rnams dus gsum du 'jug pa na yang ma 'ongs pa nas da ltar dang 'das pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du gyur ba na gnas skabs gzhan du brjod par zad kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: so too, when phenomena engage the three times, they are said to be in another state when they are in the future, present or past, but the entity of the phenomenon does not change.

original: de la mdo sde pa dag na re de lta na gnas skabs tha dad pa tsam du zad kyi rdzas la tha dad pa med pas dus gsum 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde pa dag na re de lta na gnas skabs tha dad pa tsam du zad kyi rdzas la tha dad pa med pas dus gsum 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say: In that case, they would be merely different states but not different substances, so the three times would merge.üîΩThis is not a response because the venerable Vasumitra says:

original: 'di ltar btsun pa ba su mi tra na re dus gsum gyi rdzas gnas skabs cig na yod na ni 'dres par yang 'gyur ba zhig na gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bas 'dres par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa ba su mi tra na re dus gsum gyi rdzas gnas skabs cig na yod na ni 'dres par yang 'gyur ba zhig na gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bas 'dres par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the substance of the three times existed in one state, they would merge, but they do not merge because they are in different states.

original: 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /üîΩdon dam par ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste / don dam par ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Here, the Madhyamikas respond to that in another way.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
translated: Ultimately, the future is not the entity of a substantial thing because it is the entity of a substantial future thing, just like the entity of a substantial present thing.

original: des na ba su mi tras dngos po rdzas nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag da ltar bzhin du rdzas nyid yin na de gnyis kyang da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i
analyzed: des na ba su mi tras dngos po rdzas nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag da ltar bzhin du rdzas nyid yin na de gnyis kyang da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i
translated: Thus, Vasumitra responds that if the past and future were substantial things, like the present, through inferring that things are substantial, then those two would also be present and the past and future would be eliminated.

original: dam bcas pa la yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa bzhin no //
translated: His response is that the fault of eliminating the intrinsic entity of the subject also exists in his thesis.

original: gzhan pa gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa buddha de bste /
analyzed: gzhan pa gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon btsun pa buddha de bste /
translated: The master of Vaibhasika, the venerable Buddhadada, is a proponent of transformation into another.

original: @135a * // de na re dper na bud med gcig la snga phyi gzhan la ltos nas ma la ltos nas ni bu mo zhes kyang bya la bu la ltos nas ni ma zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: @135a * // de na re dper na bud med gcig la snga phyi gzhan la ltos nas ma la ltos nas ni bu mo zhes kyang bya la bu la ltos nas ni ma zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: For example, a single woman is called a daughter in reliance on her mother and a mother in reliance on her daughter.

original: de la ni snga phyi gzhan pa la ltos nas ni gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de la ni snga phyi gzhan pa la ltos nas ni gzhan du 'gyur bar zad kyi /
translated: In reliance on another earlier or later, she is called another.

original: bud med de nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos rnams dus gsum du 'jug pa na yang ma 'ongs pa gzhan la ltos nas da ltar dang 'das pa dag gzhan du brjod par zad kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur
analyzed: bud med de nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos rnams dus gsum du 'jug pa na yang ma 'ongs pa gzhan la ltos nas da ltar dang 'das pa dag gzhan du brjod par zad kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur
translated: But she herself does not change. So too, when phenomena engage the three times, in reliance on another future, the present and past are said to be other.

original: ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: But the entity of the phenomenon does not change.

original: de la mdo sde pa dag na re de lta na snga phyi las gzhan du brjod pa tsam du zad kyi dngos po la gzhan pa nyid med pas dus gsum 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde pa dag na re de lta na snga phyi las gzhan du brjod pa tsam du zad kyi dngos po la gzhan pa nyid med pas dus gsum 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes zer bas ni de'i lan thebs pa ma yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say: In that case, it is merely said that the present and past are other than the future, but since they are not actually other, the three times would merge.

original: 'di ltar btsun pa buddha de ba na re dus gsum gyi rdzas ma dang bu lta bu dag gnas skabs gcig na yod na ni 'dres par yang 'gyur ba zhig na snga phyi la ltos pas gzhan du 'gyur bas 'dres par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa buddha de ba na re dus gsum gyi rdzas ma dang bu lta bu dag gnas skabs gcig na yod na ni 'dres par yang 'gyur ba zhig na snga phyi la ltos pas gzhan du 'gyur bas 'dres par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir
translated: In this way, the venerable BuddhapƒÅlita says that if the mother and son of the three times existed at the same time, they would be mixed. But since they are dependent on earlier and later, they are different and therefore are not mixed.

original: ro // 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: ro // 'dir dbu ma pas ni de la rnam pa gzhan gyis lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: Here the Follower of the Middle Way will respond to that with the following.

original: don dam par ma 'ongs pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ma 'ongs pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the future is not the entityness of things,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is the entityness of a future thing, just like the entityness of a present thing.

original: des na buddha de bas dngos po rnams dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin na de gnyis kyang de ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: des na buddha de bas dngos po rnams dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpag pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin na de gnyis kyang de ltar nyid yin par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, since BuddhapƒÅlita‚Äôs inference that things are the entityness of things would make the past and future the entityness of things, just like the present, it would follow that those two are also present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i dam bcas pa la yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i phyir de'i dam bcas pa la yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This is the reply.

original: de dag ni mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi ched du phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te zhar la bshad pas chog go //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi ched du phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te zhar la bshad pas chog go //
translated: This is merely an indication for those who are diligent; it is sufficient to explain this incidentally.üîΩIf the SƒÅ·πÉkhya say, ‚ÄúThere is no fault because we clarify the existence of things,‚Äù

original: gal te grangs can dag dngos po yod pa nyid gsal bar byed pas skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa rkyen rnams
analyzed: gal te grangs can dag dngos po yod pa nyid gsal bar byed pas skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa rkyen rnams
translated: here the SƒÅ·πÉkhya say, ‚ÄúIn our system, the future thing exists in the nature of potential.

original: kyis da ltar gyi dus su gsal bar byed pas khyed kyi bsgrub pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: kyis da ltar gyi dus su gsal bar byed pas khyed kyi bsgrub pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: The conditions clarify it in the present. Therefore the fault of your proof does not exist in our system.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, here the author of the commentary himself says,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not logical.‚Äù

original: gsal ba @135b bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gsal ba @135b bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because the existence of the manifest has already been refuted.üîΩHow can the non-arisen be known to exist?

original: ma skyes pa yod par ci ltar shes par byar nus zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas grangs can dang bye brag tu smra ba dag la phar dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yod par ci ltar shes par byar nus zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas grangs can dang bye brag tu smra ba dag la phar dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the question that the Madhyamikas ask the Samkhyas and Vaibhasikas.

original: de'i lan du grangs can dang bye brag tu smra ba dag na re ma skyes pa ni yod par kho nar shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: de'i lan du grangs can dang bye brag tu smra ba dag na re ma skyes pa ni yod par kho nar shes par byar nus te /
translated: In response, the Samkhyas and Vaibhasikas say: The non-arisen can be known to exist,

original: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is included in time, like a present thing.üîΩThey say that the non-arisen is included in time, like a present thing.üîΩThe non-arisen is the subject.üîΩThe probandum is the property to be proven.üîΩThe proof is the property that proves.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The example is the illustration.

original: dper na da ltar gyi dngos po ni dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa ma skyes pa yang dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi dngos po ni dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa ma skyes pa yang dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, just as it is possible to know that a present thing exists because it is subsumed by time, so it is possible to know that the future, which has not yet arisen, exists because it is subsumed by time.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis don dam par da ltar gyi dngos po yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis don dam par da ltar gyi dngos po yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says that since a present thing is not established as existing inherently in the ultimate, there is no example, and so the point being made is not established.

original: kho bo cag la don dam par ma 'ongs pa ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pa bzhin du /
analyzed: kho bo cag la don dam par ma 'ongs pa ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pa bzhin du /
translated: For us, just as the future is not established as existing inherently in the ultimate,

original: da ltar gyi dngos po yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pas nges na khyed kyi dpe da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba de med pa'i phyir khyed kyi 'dod pa'i don ma skyes pa yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus
analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pas nges na khyed kyi dpe da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba de med pa'i phyir khyed kyi 'dod pa'i don ma skyes pa yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus
translated: Therefore, you cannot establish that ‚Äúan unarisen thing exists.‚ÄùüîΩThis also indicates that the error in the proof that form and so on do not exist prior to their existence and that they do not exist after their disintegration is that the example is not established.

original: te zhes bya ba de mi 'grub po 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa dag snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid bsgrub pa la yang skyon gyis lan btab par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re gzugs la
analyzed: te zhes bya ba de mi 'grub po 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa dag snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid bsgrub pa la yang skyon gyis lan btab par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re gzugs la
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúForm and so on do exist prior to their existence because

original: sogs pa snga na med pa ni yod pa kho nar shes pa byar nus te /
analyzed: sogs pa snga na med pa ni yod pa kho nar shes pa byar nus te /
translated: they can be known to exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa zhig nas med pa yang //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa zhig nas med pa yang //
translated: For example, like a present thing,‚Äù and ‚ÄúForm and so on do exist after their disintegration because

original: yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus te //
analyzed: yod pa kho nar shes par byar nus te //
translated: they can be known to exist.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag la yang snga ma bzhin du dpe med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i skyon gyis lan btab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag la yang snga ma bzhin du dpe med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i skyon gyis lan btab par rig par bya'o //
translated: But the error of the opponent‚Äôs argument is that, as before, there is no example, and so the intended meaning is not established.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te khyed dbu ma pas da ltar gyi dngos po yang med par bshad na tha snyad kyi bden pa la @136a * //
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te khyed dbu ma pas da ltar gyi dngos po yang med par bshad na tha snyad kyi bden pa la @136a * //
translated: Here, if the opponent says that the example ‚Äújust like present things‚Äù is established, and if you Followers of the Middle Way say that present things do not exist, then you will be undermining the truth of the conventional.

original: gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary, BhƒÅviveka, responds to this hypothetical opponent‚Äôs position by saying:

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe truth of the conventional will not be undermined.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dag sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa dag btags pa'i yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dag sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa dag btags pa'i yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because you accept that things such as form that exist now exist like illusions and so on, and because you accept that conventionally form and so on exist as designations.üîΩFor example, although the body of an illusory woman does not have the nature of a woman, those who do not understand illusion say, ‚ÄúShe exists.‚Äù

original: dper na sgyu ma'i bud med kyi lus la bud med kyi ngo bo nyid med kyang sgyu ma mi shes pa dag 'di yod do zhes zer ba de bzhin du da ltar gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dag kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i bud med kyi lus la bud med kyi ngo bo nyid med kyang sgyu ma mi shes pa dag 'di yod do zhes zer ba de bzhin du da ltar gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dag kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa
translated: Likewise, things such as form that exist now do not ultimately have an essence.

original: yin mod kyi kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa dag rdzas su ni med kyi sa la sogs pa rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag 'dus pa tsam las btags pa'i yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnas par yang mi 'gyur
analyzed: yin mod kyi kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa dag rdzas su ni med kyi sa la sogs pa rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag 'dus pa tsam las btags pa'i yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnas par yang mi 'gyur
translated: But because we accept that they exist conventionally, merely nominally, and because we accept that form and so on exist nominally, conventionally, as imputed in dependence on their own collections of parts, such as the primary elements, we do not remain in conventional truth.

original: la don dam par khyed kyi dpe yod par yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: la don dam par khyed kyi dpe yod par yang mi 'grub po //
translated: But ultimately, your example is not established as existent.üîΩThis is sufficient for a digression, so let us return to the topic at hand.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gis skabs nyid bsdu bar bya ste de ltar re zhig / skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gis skabs nyid bsdu bar bya ste de ltar re zhig / skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
translated: Thus, the following has been explained:üîΩThat which is arisen, that not arisen, and that now arising

original: ci lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
analyzed: ci lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
translated: Are not caused to arise in any way.

original: ces bya ba de bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no /
analyzed: ces bya ba de bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

original: yang bshad pa /üîΩgal te skye ba de yis ni //
analyzed: yang bshad pa / gal te skye ba de yis ni //
translated: Again it is said:üîΩIf arising causes

original: skye bzhin pa ni skyed byed na /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni skyed byed na /
translated: The arising of that now arising,

original: gal te khyed 'dod pa ltar skye ba des skyed bzhin pa skyed par byed na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po 'dod pa ltar skye ba zhes bya ba des skye bzhin pa de skyed par byed pa yin na 'o na ni des na skye ba
analyzed: gal te khyed 'dod pa ltar skye ba des skyed bzhin pa skyed par byed na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po 'dod pa ltar skye ba zhes bya ba des skye bzhin pa de skyed par byed pa yin na 'o na ni des na skye ba
translated: But if that is so, then that which is called arisingüîΩwould not be arising, because it causes the generation of that which is called arising.

original: zhes bya ba de skyed par byed pa yin pas skye ba ma yin par 'gyur bas skye ba zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: zhes bya ba de skyed par byed pa yin pas skye ba ma yin par 'gyur bas skye ba zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro
translated: Therefore, since that which is called arising, the characteristic of the conditioned, does not exist, the reason of the opponent, ‚Äúbecause they possess the characteristics of the conditioned,‚Äù is not established.

original: zhes bya ba de ma grub pas phung po la sogs pa dag la ngo bo nyid yod par bsgrub par bya ba mi 'grub po zhes bya bar ston te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ma grub pas phung po la sogs pa dag la ngo bo nyid yod par bsgrub par bya ba mi 'grub po zhes bya bar ston te //
translated: This demonstrates that the thesis that the aggregates and so on exist inherently is not established.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'o na des na //üîΩskye ba de ni skyed byed pa yin te //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'o na des na // skye ba de ni skyed byed pa yin te //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúBut if that is so, then that which is called arising

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: causes the generation of that which is called arising.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa ni skye ba ma yin te skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa ni skye ba ma yin te skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the measure of that, he says: That which generates does not generate because it is generating.

original: dper na pha bu'i skye ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes @136b bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na pha bu'i skye ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes @136b bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the father who is not the son.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na pha ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bu'i skye ba ma yin pa de bzhin du skyed par byed pa yang skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na pha ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bu'i skye ba ma yin pa de bzhin du skyed par byed pa yang skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi skye ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, the father is not the son because he is the generator. In the same way, that which generates does not generate the generation of the produced because it is generating.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that case,üîΩwhat is generation? It is the generation of that which is generated.

original: skye ba yang ni gang zhig yin skye ba la skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni de ltar na pha rol po dag skye ba zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de gang zhig yin
analyzed: skye ba yang ni gang zhig yin skye ba la skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni de ltar na pha rol po dag skye ba zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de gang zhig yin
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúgeneration does not have the nature of generation‚Äù is as follows: In that case, what is the generation that the opponent asserts as the characteristic of the produced?

original: te / skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: te / skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that arising does not have the nature of arising.

original: de ltar na yang rgol ba skye ba skyed par byed do zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rgol ba skye ba skyed par byed do zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Thus, the fault of the reversal of the nature of the subject exists in the thesis of the opponent who says, ‚ÄúArising generates that which is in the process of arising.‚Äù This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: de ltar skye ba med na rgol ba pha rol po dag na re skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa de la chos can skye ba zhes bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa las bzlog pa'i skyon chos can skye
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med na rgol ba pha rol po dag na re skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa de la chos can skye ba zhes bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa las bzlog pa'i skyon chos can skye
translated: Thus, if arising does not exist, the fault of the reversal of the nature of the subject exists in the thesis of the opponent who says, ‚ÄúArising generates another,‚Äù because the nature of the subject called ‚Äúarising‚Äù is asserted to exist.

original: ba zhes bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i skyon yod pas pha rol po'i sgrub par ma grub po //
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i skyon yod pas pha rol po'i sgrub par ma grub po //
translated: The fault is that the nature of the subject called ‚Äúarising‚Äù does not exist. Therefore the opponent‚Äôs proof is not established.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re de ltar skye ba de skyed bzhin pa gzhan skyed par byed pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re de ltar skye ba de skyed bzhin pa gzhan skyed par byed pa yang yin la /
translated: Here, if the opponent says, ‚ÄúIn that case, arising generates that which is in the process of arising, and that which is in the process of arising generates another,‚Äù then arising would generate that which is in the process of arising, and that which is in the process of arising would generate another.

original: skye ba de nyid kyang skye ba gzhan gyis skyed par byed pas skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: skye ba de nyid kyang skye ba gzhan gyis skyed par byed pas skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Since that arising itself is generated by another arising, arising does not lack an intrinsic reality.üîΩIn response to that, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de gzhan gyis skyed par byed do zhes kyang brjod par mi nus pas de skad brjod na 'dir nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gzhan gyis skyed par byed do zhes kyang brjod par mi nus pas de skad brjod na 'dir nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: One cannot say that it is generated by another, so this is relevant here.

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye ba de skyed par byed na de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te / gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye ba de skyed par byed na de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: generated it, there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf another arising generated that arising, in that case an infinite regress would ensue.

original: de yang gzhan gyis bskyed cing de yang gzhan gyis bskyed de mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis bskyed cing de yang gzhan gyis bskyed de mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do /
translated: Since that would be generated by another and that would be generated by another, there would be no end.

original: yang na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir skye ba la skyed pa med pa nyid du 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir skye ba la skyed pa med pa nyid du 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, in order to completely avoid the error of infinite regress, you must assert that arising does not cause the generation of itself.

original: yang na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon me 'dod na ni skye ba de la skyed par byed pa gzhan med pa nyid du 'dod par bya dgos te de lta na yang skye ba'i ngo bo nyid @137a * //
analyzed: yang na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon me 'dod na ni skye ba de la skyed par byed pa gzhan med pa nyid du 'dod par bya dgos te de lta na yang skye ba'i ngo bo nyid @137a * //
translated: Or else, if you do not assert that the error of infinite regress is generated, you must assert that arising does not cause the generation of itself.

original: yod par mi 'grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod par mi 'grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: In this way also, the intrinsic reality of arising is not established.

original: gal te de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces gal te skye ba de skye ba gzhan gyis skyed par 'gyur na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces gal te skye ba de skye ba gzhan gyis skyed par 'gyur na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: If you say that this is so, then if the opponent says, if arising were to cause the generation of itself by another arising, the error of infinite regress would ensue, and that is unacceptable,

original: skye ba de la skyed par byed pa gzhan med pa kho nar skyes so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: skye ba de la skyed par byed pa gzhan med pa kho nar skyes so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: then the statement ‚Äúthat arising causes the generation of itself without another cause of generation‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: commentary itself says:

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
translated: If that which is not arisen were arisen,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //
translated: then everything would arise in that way.

original: de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir skye bar rtog par ma byed cig ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir skye bar rtog par ma byed cig ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that is unacceptable, therefore do not conceive that it arises.üîΩIf that which is arising were to arise without another that is arisenüîΩgiving rise to it, then all outer and inner phenomena such as pots and cloth

original: ci ltar skye ba de skyed par byed pa gzhan med par skyes na ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du skyed pa gzhan med par skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba de skyed par byed pa gzhan med par skyes na ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du skyed pa gzhan med par skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir
translated: would arise in that way, without another giving rise to them. But since thatüîΩis unacceptable, therefore do not conceive that arising gives rise to anotherüîΩthat is arising.üîΩMoreover, in this regard, is the arising of those that are arising due to

original: skye bas skye bzhin pa gzhan skyed par byed do zhes bya bar rtog par ma byed cig / yang gzhan yang 'di la skye ba can rnams kyi skye ba ni yod pa'am /
analyzed: skye bas skye bzhin pa gzhan skyed par byed do zhes bya bar rtog par ma byed cig / yang gzhan yang 'di la skye ba can rnams kyi skye ba ni yod pa'am /
translated: the arising of another, or is it not?

original: med pa'am / yod med cig skye bar 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di la bum pa dang snam bu dang myu gu la sogs pa dngos po gang dag la skye ba yod pa de dag ni skye ba can zhes bya
analyzed: med pa'am / yod med cig skye bar 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di la bum pa dang snam bu dang myu gu la sogs pa dngos po gang dag la skye ba yod pa de dag ni skye ba can zhes bya
translated: then this is the philosophical position of the opponent. Whatever things such as a vase, cloth, sprout, etc. have arising are called ‚Äúpossessing arising.‚Äù

original: ste / skye ba can de rnams kyi skye ba zhig yod par brtag na dngos po yod pa'am med pa'am /
analyzed: ste / skye ba can de rnams kyi skye ba zhig yod par brtag na dngos po yod pa'am med pa'am /
translated: If you imagine that the arising of those possessing arising exists, then it is asked, does arising give rise to that which is existent, non-existent, or both existent and non-existent?

original: yod med cig skye bar 'gyur grang na rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: yod med cig skye bar 'gyur grang na rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: It is shown that all of these are untenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de la //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de la //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:üîΩFirst, it is not tenable

original: re zhig yod dang med pa yang //üîΩskye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig yod dang med pa yang // skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That existent or non-existent

original: yod med nyid kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: yod med nyid kyang ma yin te //
translated: Arising gives rise to that which is existent, non-existent, or both existent and non-existent.

original: gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This has been taught above.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: He says this.

original: gong du bstan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dran par bya ba'i phyir skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dran par bya ba'i phyir skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par /
translated: In order to remind us that this has been taught above, in the chapter on nonarising,

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: Also, with respect to the meaning of non-existence and existence,

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: conditions are not suitable.üîΩAnd, When a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: zhes bya ba dang / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
translated: non-existent, or both existent and non-existent,

original: zhes bya ba dag bstan pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir yang 'bad par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag bstan pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir yang 'bad par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since this is taught, therefore it is said, ‚Äúthere is no need to strive.‚Äù

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
translated: With respect to an entity that is in the process of ceasing,

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: arising is not tenable.üîΩBecause it is in the process of ceasing, like one who is in the process of dying.

original: 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'chi bzhin pa nyid bzhin no @137b zhes bya bas ni dngos po thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas de la skye ba mi 'thad par ston te //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'chi bzhin pa nyid bzhin no @137b zhes bya bas ni dngos po thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas de la skye ba mi 'thad par ston te //
translated: Since all entities are related to impermanence, arising is not tenable with respect to them.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, they are the subject, the predicate of the thesis, the property of the subject, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'chi bzhin pa nyid ni 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye bar mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyang 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dper na 'chi bzhin pa nyid ni 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye bar mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyang 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Likewise, it is untenable that that which is in the process of ceasing is born, because that which is in the process of ceasing is that which is in the process of ceasing.üîΩIf you say that there is no error because that which is not in the process of ceasing is born,

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa skye bas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur bas skye ba yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa skye bas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur bas skye ba yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes zer na'o //
translated: if you say that there is no error because birth exists since that which is in the process of arising does not cease,

original: de yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then in order to demonstrate that this also is untenable,üîΩhe says,

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not in the process of ceasing

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: is untenable as a thing.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is that it is like a sky flower because it does not possess the characteristics of a thing.

original: des ni gal te dngos po skye bzhin pa nyid na 'gag par mi 'gyur na de dngos po nyid yin par mi 'thad par ston te /
analyzed: des ni gal te dngos po skye bzhin pa nyid na 'gag par mi 'gyur na de dngos po nyid yin par mi 'thad par ston te /
translated: This shows that if a thing that is in the process of arising did not cease, it would not be tenable that it is a thing.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, these are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dngos por mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin ma yin pa yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dngos por mi 'thad pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin ma yin pa yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: For example, a sky flower is not tenable as a thing because it does not possess the characteristics of a thing, that is, cessation. In the same way, that which is not in the process of ceasing is not tenable as a thing because it does not possess the characteristics of a thing, that is, cessation.üîΩIf you say that it is not ascertained because of endurance,

original: gal te gnas pa nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhesüîΩskyon 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhesüîΩskyon 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: the opponents level the criticism that the Madhyamaka reason, ‚Äúbecause it does not possess the characteristics of a thing, that is, cessation,‚Äù is not ascertained and therefore is not suitable.

original: de dag na re gnas pa ni 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i dngos po nyid yin par 'thad pas des na ci ri zhig 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du 'gag bzhin ma yin pa de dngos por mi 'thad par 'gyur ram
analyzed: de dag na re gnas pa ni 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i dngos po nyid yin par 'thad pas des na ci ri zhig 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du 'gag bzhin ma yin pa de dngos por mi 'thad par 'gyur ram
translated: They say: Since it is tenable that endurance is a thing that does not possess cessation, then just as space does not endure because it does not possess endurance, it is not tenable that it is a thing.üîΩOr, just as endurance does not possess cessation, it is not tenable that that which is not in the process of cessation is a thing.

original: // 'on te 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin du 'gag bzhin ma yin pa dngos por 'thad par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas de gtan tshigs nyid du mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: // 'on te 'gag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin du 'gag bzhin ma yin pa dngos por 'thad par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas de gtan tshigs nyid du mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is not definite, it is not suitable as a reason.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du @138a * //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du @138a * //
translated: In response to that, the Subcommentary states:

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here the author of the commentary himself says:

original: de yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pas skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pas skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since it is related to impermanence, it is not established as not in the process of cessation.
