original: gnas pa de yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
analyzed: gnas pa de yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
translated: Since that endurance is related to impermanence, it is not established as not ceasing. Therefore, since there is no discordant side, there is no fault of inconclusiveness.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The extensive explanation is the same as before.

original: gnas pa nyid rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgya pa las /üîΩgnas med dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgya pa las / gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva‚Äôs source for the statement that endurance is related to permanence is the Four Hundred Stanzas on the Middle Way:

original: mi rtag pas na ga la gnas //
analyzed: mi rtag pas na ga la gnas //
translated: How can there be an enduring thing without endurance?üîΩHow can there be endurance if it is impermanent?

original: gal te dngos po gnas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po gnas gyur na //
translated: If a thing endures,

original: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in the end it would not age.

original: gal te khor zug mi rtag yod //
analyzed: gal te khor zug mi rtag yod //
translated: If there were permanent impermanence,

original: khor zug gnas par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na rtag par gyur pa las //üîΩphyis ni mi rtag par yang 'gyur //
analyzed: khor zug gnas par mi 'gyur ro // yang na rtag par gyur pa las // phyis ni mi rtag par yang 'gyur //
translated: it would not endure permanently.

original: gal te dngos po mi rtag dang // lhan cig gnas pa yod gyur na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po mi rtag dang // lhan cig gnas pa yod gyur na //
translated: If a thing were to endure together with impermanence,

original: mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
translated: impermanence would be reversed.

original: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //
translated: Or else endurance would be false.

original: zhes gsungs pa dag 'dir rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dag 'dir rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Here, the above is applied extensively, just as before.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum las skye ba mi 'thad par bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum las skye ba mi 'thad par bsgrubs zin to //
translated: The three characteristics of the produced have been established as untenable.

original: da ni gnas pa mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i phyir je dang por phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gnas pa mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i phyir je dang por phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to establish endurance as untenable, first the opponent‚Äôs position is presented:

original: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, here it is said:

original: skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Arising exists,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: because if it exists, the property of emergence exists.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the property of the thesis, the property of the proof, and the example, respectively.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni da yod na 'byung ba'i chos med do /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni da yod na 'byung ba'i chos med do /
translated: If something does not exist, it does not have the property of emergence.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu med pa la de'i gos 'byung ba med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu med pa la de'i gos 'byung ba med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the nonexistence of the cloth of a tortoise. This is the example of the dissimilar class.

original: skye ba yod pa la ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa la ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Since there is the arising of the phenomenon of endurance in the presence of arising, this is the application of the reason.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i 'thad pas skye ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i 'thad pas skye ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the reason is stated, the mere presence of arising is established. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: 'di na rus sbal gyi spu med pa la de'i gos 'byung ba med pa lta bu dag ni yod pa ma yin gyi skye ba yod pa la gnas @138b pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pa de ni yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir skye ba
analyzed: 'di na rus sbal gyi spu med pa la de'i gos 'byung ba med pa lta bu dag ni yod pa ma yin gyi skye ba yod pa la gnas @138b pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pa de ni yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir skye ba
translated: For example, the nonexistence of the cloth of a tortoise is not present, but the presence of the arising of the phenomenon of endurance in the presence of arising is present. Therefore, since the arising of the phenomenon of endurance is present, arising exists.

original: yod na gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi 'thad pa des na skye ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yod na gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi 'thad pa des na skye ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: If it exists, then the reason for the existence of the characteristic of enduring is the existence of arising. Therefore, arising alone exists.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa skye ba med pa kho nas de rab tu grub pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang tha snyad du grags pa'i skye ba khas blangs nas don dam par gnas pa brtag par bya'o
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa skye ba med pa kho nas de rab tu grub pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang tha snyad du grags pa'i skye ba khas blangs nas don dam par gnas pa brtag par bya'o
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains here: ‚ÄúIt is indeed established by the mere nonexistence of arising. However, having accepted arising that is renowned conventionally, the nonexistence of enduring should be investigated ultimately.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says this and so on.

original: sngar skye ba med par bstan pa kho nas don dam par gnas pa med pa de yang rab tu grub pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sngar skye ba med par bstan pa kho nas don dam par gnas pa med pa de yang rab tu grub pa yin mod kyi /
translated: It is indeed established that the nonexistence of enduring ultimately is established by the mere teaching of the nonexistence of arising previously.

original: 'o na kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid thams cad rim gyis dgag pa'i dbang du byas te tha snyad du grags pa'i skye ba khas blangs nas don dam par gnas pa med par brtag par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'o na kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid thams cad rim gyis dgag pa'i dbang du byas te tha snyad du grags pa'i skye ba khas blangs nas don dam par gnas pa med par brtag par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: However, having accepted arising that is renowned conventionally, the nonexistence of enduring should be investigated ultimately, in terms of the refutation of all the characteristics of conditioned phenomena in sequence.

original: de'i phyir 'di la don dam par dngos po de gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la don dam par dngos po de gnas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, in this regard, if that entity abides ultimately,

original: mi gnas pa 'am /
analyzed: mi gnas pa 'am /
translated: or does not abide,

original: gnas bzhin pa zhig gnas grang na zhes bya bas brtag pa rnam pa gsum nye bar bzung nas rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: gnas bzhin pa zhig gnas grang na zhes bya bas brtag pa rnam pa gsum nye bar bzung nas rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: or abides while abiding, then having taken up the three modes of analysis, it is shown that all modes are untenable.

original: de la brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the first mode of analysis, he says:

original: dngos po gnas pa mi gnas te //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa mi gnas te //
translated: An entity that abides does not abide.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa'i dus gnyis gcig tu tshogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir dper na shi ba dang skyes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa'i dus gnyis gcig tu tshogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir dper na shi ba dang skyes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is impossible for the two, the present and the past, to be combined into one, like, for example, death and birth.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na shi ba dang skyes pa'i dus gnyis ni gcig tu tshogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir shi ba'i dus na skyes pa'i dus na med pa de bzhin du dngos po gnas zin pa dang da ltar gnas pa'i dus gnyis kyang gcig tu tshogs pa mi srid pa'i
analyzed: dper na shi ba dang skyes pa'i dus gnyis ni gcig tu tshogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir shi ba'i dus na skyes pa'i dus na med pa de bzhin du dngos po gnas zin pa dang da ltar gnas pa'i dus gnyis kyang gcig tu tshogs pa mi srid pa'i
translated: Just as at the time of death there is no birth, so too it is impossible for the two times of the thing that has already endured and its present endurance to be simultaneous.

original: phyir dngos po gnas zin pa de gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyir dngos po gnas zin pa de gnas par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, that which has already endured does not cause endurance.

original: yang na gnas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas par mi byed do zhes pa ni 'thad pa gzhan gyis brnan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gnas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas par mi byed do zhes pa ni 'thad pa gzhan gyis brnan pa ste /
translated: Or, it is untenable that it causes endurance because endurance would be pointless.

original: gnas zin pa la yang gnas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnas pa dang gnas pa po gnyis su yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas pa gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: gnas zin pa la yang gnas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnas pa dang gnas pa po gnyis su yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas pa gnas par mi byed do //
translated: This is another argument. Since endurance would be pointless with respect to that which has already endured, and since it follows that there would be two endurances, that which has already endured does not cause endurance.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To present the second analysis, he says:

original: dngos po ma gnas gnas pa min //
analyzed: dngos po ma gnas gnas pa min //
translated: That which has not endured does not endure.

original: ma gnas pa'i phyir dper na 'gag pa bzhin @139a * //üîΩno zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma gnas pa'i phyir dper na 'gag pa bzhin @139a * //üîΩno zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it has not endured, it is like that which has ceased.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na 'gag pa la ni gnas pa'i bya ba med pas ma gnas pa'i phyir gnas par mi byed pa de bzhin du dngos po ma gnas pa la yang gnas pa'i bya ba med pas ma gnas pa'i phyir gnas par mi byed ngo //
analyzed: dper na 'gag pa la ni gnas pa'i bya ba med pas ma gnas pa'i phyir gnas par mi byed pa de bzhin du dngos po ma gnas pa la yang gnas pa'i bya ba med pas ma gnas pa'i phyir gnas par mi byed ngo //
translated: For example, since there is no action of enduring in that which has ceased, it does not endure because it does not endure. In the same way, since there is no action of enduring in a nonenduring thing, it does not endure because it does not endure.

original: brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir gnas bzhin pa yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir gnas bzhin pa yang mi gnas te /
translated: In order to teach the third analysis, he says: That which is enduring does not endure.

original: gnas pa dang ma gnas pa ma gtogs par de srid pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang ma gnas pa ma gtogs par de srid pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because it is possible that it is neither enduring nor not enduring.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar /
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar /
translated: ‚ÄúIn detail, it is like the previous explanation‚Äù means that previously it was said:

original: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
translated: The arisen, the non-arisen, and that which is in the process of arising

original: ci ltar bur yang skyed mi byed //
analyzed: ci ltar bur yang skyed mi byed //
translated: Do not cause the generation of anything at all.

original: song dang ma song bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: song dang ma song bsgom pa yis //
translated: Through the meditation on that which has gone and that which has not gone,

original: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //
translated: They are explained.

original: zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya ba dang / der skye bzhin pa dgag pa'i tshad ma don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya ba dang / der skye bzhin pa dgag pa'i tshad ma don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed de /
translated: The valid knowledge that refutes arising in that way does not cause the ultimate arising of that which is in the process of arising,

original: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no //
translated: because its nature is not ascertained, as is the case, for example, with that which is in the process of ceasing.üîΩOr, the ultimate does not cause the arising of that which is in the process of arising, because it is directed to the transition to another time, as is the case, for example, with that which is in the process of ceasing.

original: yang na don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed de dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang don dam par gnas bzhin pa
analyzed: yang na don dam par skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed de dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang don dam par gnas bzhin pa
translated: Just as it is stated in such passages, so it should be stated here as well:

original: gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: gnas par mi byed de /
translated: The ultimate does not cause the endurance of that which is in the process of enduring,

original: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no //
translated: because its nature is not ascertained, as is the case, for example, with that which is in the process of ceasing.

original: yang na don dam par gnas bzhin pa gnas par mi byed de dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na don dam par gnas bzhin pa gnas par mi byed de dus gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir dper na 'gag bzhin pa bzhin no //
translated: Or else, that which is presently enduring does not cause endurance, because it is directed toward the passing away that occurs at another time, just like that which is presently disintegrating.

original: ci ste gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba de cung zad ni ma gnas pa'o zhes bya bar rtog na de lta na yang de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de ni gnas par mi byed do de'i gnas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba de cung zad ni ma gnas pa'o zhes bya bar rtog na de lta na yang de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de ni gnas par mi byed do de'i gnas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you think that that which is presently enduring is enduring a little, then in that case also, that which is enduring a little does not cause endurance, because its endurance would be pointless.

original: de'i gang cung zad ma gnas pa de yang gnas par mi byed de gnas pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'dos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gang cung zad ma gnas pa de yang gnas par mi byed de gnas pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'dos pa bzhin no //
translated: And that which is not enduring a little does not cause endurance, because it is empty of endurance, just like what is not hot is not fire.

original: gal te gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you think that that which is presently enduring is directed toward endurance,

original: brgal zhing brtag pa ni de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa ni de gang zhig yin /
translated: the objection and analysis is this: What is it?

original: gnas pa zhig gam 'o na te ma gnas pa zhig yin zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa zhig gam 'o na te ma gnas pa zhig yin zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
translated: Is it that which is enduring or is it that which is not enduring?

original: lan kyang gnas pa ni gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: lan kyang gnas pa ni gnas par mi byed de /
translated: The reply is that that which is enduring does not cause endurance.

original: de'i gnas pa @139b don med pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas pa @139b don med pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its endurance would be pointless.

original: ma gnas pa yang gnas par mi khyed de gnas pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid yin no zhes rgyas par brjod par bya ba yin no //üîΩyang gzhan yang 'di la gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi cung zad ni gnas cung zad ni ma gnas pa'am /
analyzed: ma gnas pa yang gnas par mi khyed de gnas pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid yin no zhes rgyas par brjod par bya ba yin no // yang gzhan yang 'di la gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi cung zad ni gnas cung zad ni ma gnas pa'am /
translated: And that which is not enduring is not enduring because it is empty of endurance, like the future.

original: yang na de las gzhan pa gnas pa'am ma gnas pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: yang na de las gzhan pa gnas pa'am ma gnas pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, here that which is enduring is that which is enduring a little, or that which is enduring a lot, or that which is enduring in some other way.

original: de la gal te gnas pa dang ma gnas pa de gnas pas gnas par byed na re zhig de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de ni gnas pa de las gnas par byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la gal te gnas pa dang ma gnas pa de gnas pas gnas par byed na re zhig de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de ni gnas pa de las gnas par byas pa ma yin la /
translated: If that which is enduring and not enduring endures through enduring, then that which is enduring a little is not made to endure through that enduring,

original: gnas pa de gnas bzhin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa de gnas bzhin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and that enduring is not enduring.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de gnas na gnas bzhin pa ma yin zhing gnas bzhin pa gnas par mi byed do zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de gnas na gnas bzhin pa ma yin zhing gnas bzhin pa gnas par mi byed do zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that if it endures, it does not endure while enduring, and that which is enduring does not cause endurance.

original: gal te cung zad gnas pa de gnas pa med pa kho nar gnas na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du gnas pa med pa kho nar gnas par 'gyur bar nges so //
analyzed: gal te cung zad gnas pa de gnas pa med pa kho nar gnas na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du gnas pa med pa kho nar gnas par 'gyur bar nges so //
translated: If that which endures even a little bit endures without endurance, then that which remains would also definitely endure without endurance.

original: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni gnas pa med pa kho nar gnas la cung zad ni gnas pas gnas par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni gnas pa med pa kho nar gnas la cung zad ni gnas pas gnas par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else, you must state what the difference is between that which endures without endurance and that which endures through endurance.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de yang gnas pa kho nas gnas par byas nas ni de lta na ma gnas pa gnas pas gnas par byed kyi gnas bzhin pa gnas par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de yang gnas pa kho nas gnas par byas nas ni de lta na ma gnas pa gnas pas gnas par byed kyi gnas bzhin pa gnas par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But if that which endures even a little bit endures through endurance, then that which does not endure endures through endurance, but that which is enduring does not endure.

original: yang gzhan yang de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de ni gnas pas gnas par mi byed de gnas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de ni gnas pas gnas par mi byed de gnas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that which endures even a little bit does not endure through endurance because it has already endured.

original: des na de'i lhag ma ma gnas pa gang yin pa gnas pas gnas par byed de zhes bya bar 'gyur te /üîΩde ltar gnas bzhin pa gnas par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur to //
analyzed: des na de'i lhag ma ma gnas pa gang yin pa gnas pas gnas par byed de zhes bya bar 'gyur te / de ltar gnas bzhin pa gnas par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur to //
translated: Thus, that which is enduring causes endurance.üîΩBut if that which is enduring causes endurance, then that which is enduring would be twofold: that which is enduring and that which causes endurance.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de yang yang gnas pas gnas par byed na ni de la gnas pa nyid kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /üîΩgnas zin pa de la ni yang gnas par bya ba'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir gnas bzhin pa de ni gnas par mi byed do //üîΩbrtag pa gsum po de dag gis ni skye ba khas blangs na yang gnas pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad gnas pa de yang yang gnas pas gnas par byed na ni de la gnas pa nyid kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te / gnas zin pa de la ni yang gnas par bya ba'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir gnas bzhin pa de ni gnas par mi byed do // brtag pa gsum po de dag gis ni skye ba khas blangs na yang gnas pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: But if that which is enduring causes endurance, then that which is enduring would be twofold: that which is enduring and that which causes endurance.üîΩBut if that which is enduring original: da ni skye ba khas ma blangs na yang gnas pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba khas ma blangs na yang gnas pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if that which is enduring causes endurance, then that which is enduring would be twofold: that which is

original: gang gi tshe don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i tshul gyis dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba bsal @140a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i tshul gyis dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba bsal @140a * //
translated: When, by the method of teaching that ultimately no entity at all exists, the arising of all entities is refuted,

original: ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ba de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: ma skyes gang yin gnas par byed //
analyzed: ma skyes gang yin gnas par byed //
translated: how could it make anything that is non-arisen endure?

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what he said.

original: skye ba khas blangs sam ma blangs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: skye ba khas blangs sam ma blangs kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not one accepts arising,üîΩno entity at all makes anything endure.

original: dngos po 'ga' yang gnas par mi byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang gnas par mi byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the thought. This is the conclusion.

original: des na de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: des na de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause if it exists, the phenomenon that arises exists,‚Äù is either unestablished or contradictory. This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: pha rol po skye ba yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: pha rol po skye ba yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the reason that proves the existence of arising is established ultimately, then the meaning is unestablished.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If it is established conventionally, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
translated: For a thing that is ceasing

original: gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding is not tenable.

original: mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang mi mthun pa de la ni de yod na 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang mi mthun pa de la ni de yod na 'byung ba med de /
translated: Since they are incompatible, when one is present, the other is absent,üîΩlike light and darkness.

original: dper na snang ba gsal ba dang mun pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni dngos po thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas de la gnas pa mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: dper na snang ba gsal ba dang mun pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni dngos po thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas de la gnas pa mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Since all things are related to impermanence, it is shown that abiding is untenable.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The example, the property of the position, the property of the thesis, and the property of the reason are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, since light and darkness are incompatible, when light is present, darkness is absent.

original: dper na snang ba bsal ba dang mun pa ni mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir snang ba de yod na mun pa 'byung ba med pa de bzhin du dngos po 'gag bzhin pa nyid dang gnas pa yang mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa
analyzed: dper na snang ba bsal ba dang mun pa ni mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir snang ba de yod na mun pa 'byung ba med pa de bzhin du dngos po 'gag bzhin pa nyid dang gnas pa yang mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa
translated: Likewise, since a thing that is ceasing and abiding are incompatible, when a thing is ceasing, abiding is not tenable.

original: de yod na gnas pa 'byung ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de yod na gnas pa 'byung ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If it exists, then abiding would not occur.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa gnas pas nyes ba med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur bas gnas pa yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa gnas pas nyes ba med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur bas gnas pa yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes zer na'o //
translated: If you say that there is no error because that which is not now ceasing exists,

original: de yang mi 'thad par bston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad par bston pa'i phyir /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains the untenability of that:

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not now ceasing

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: is untenable as a thing.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The intended meaning is that because all conditioned states are related to impermanence.

original: des ni gal te dngos po gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur na de dngos po nyid yin par mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: des ni gal te dngos po gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur na de dngos po nyid yin par mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: This shows that if a thing does not cease in the state of abiding, then it is untenable that it is a thing.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir yang na de ni dngos po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir yang na de ni dngos po nyid ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says, Or else it is not a thing.

original: 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no @140b zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no @140b zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not now ceasing, like a sky flower.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And they are applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa de yang 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa de yang 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: For example, just as a sky flower is not a thing because it is not now ceasing, so that which is not now ceasing is not a thing because it is not now ceasing.

original: ci ste skye ba'i 'og tu gnas pa'i bya ba mthu che ba'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa yang ma yin dngos po yang ma yin pa dang rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba'i 'og tu gnas pa'i bya ba mthu che ba'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa yang ma yin dngos po yang ma yin pa dang rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that because the activity of enduring is more powerful than arising, it is not now ceasing and it is not a thing, and it is not permanent,

original: gnas pa'i 'og tu rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'og tu rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because after enduring, aging and impermanence occur,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas /
analyzed: pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas /
translated: The opponent is proving that the statement by the Madhyamaka

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: that which is not in the process of ceasing

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //üîΩzhes bshad pa de mi rigs par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do // zhes bshad pa de mi rigs par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: is not tenable as a thing.üîΩis not correct.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩgal te gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag gi gnas pa'i skad cig ma la mi rtag pa nyid med par gyur na phyis kyang de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag gi gnas pa'i skad cig ma la mi rtag pa nyid med par gyur na phyis kyang de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: de med par 'byung ba'i phyir dper na me ni chu med kyang 'byung ba'i tshul can yin pas nam yang chu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de med par 'byung ba'i phyir dper na me ni chu med kyang 'byung ba'i tshul can yin pas nam yang chu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If impermanence did not exist in the moment of endurance of these things such as form, it would not be possessed later because it would arise without it. For example, since fire has the mode of being that arises without water, it never becomes the thing water.

original: gal te mthong ba'i phyir dgag tu mi rung ngo /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i phyir dgag tu mi rung ngo /
translated: If you say that it is not suitable to refute it because it is seen,

original: zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten na mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir dgag tu mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten na mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir dgag tu mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say‚Äù indicates that the opponents say, ‚ÄúSince destruction is seen in the world by direct perception, it cannot be refuted.‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de'i phyir de nyid brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this should be investigated:

original: ci 'jig pa mthong ba de de dang 'brel pa nyid la'am /
analyzed: ci 'jig pa mthong ba de de dang 'brel pa nyid la'am /
translated: Is the seeing of destruction related to that?

original: 'on te de med pa la mthong /
analyzed: 'on te de med pa la mthong /
translated: Or is it seen as nonexistent?

original: de la brtag pa snga ma la ni gnas pa mi 'grub po /
analyzed: de la brtag pa snga ma la ni gnas pa mi 'grub po /
translated: In the former case, endurance is not established.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa la ni dngos po 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa nyid mi 'grub pas gnyi ga la yang 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa la ni dngos po 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa nyid mi 'grub pas gnyi ga la yang 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In the latter case, the noncessation of an entity is not established. Therefore, in both cases, the desired meaning is undermined.

original: gang dag mkhas su re ba nyid kyis dper na snga na sangs rgyas nyid med pa yang phyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang dag mkhas su re ba nyid kyis dper na snga na sangs rgyas nyid med pa yang phyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Those who hope to be wise say, ‚ÄúFor example, although buddhahood did not exist before, later it becomes buddhahood.

original: snga na 'jig pa med pa yang phyis 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po gang dag bdag gis 'di skad smras na sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang sgra'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa nyid du gzhan gyis dpog par 'gyur ro snyam
analyzed: snga na 'jig pa med pa yang phyis 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po gang dag bdag gis 'di skad smras na sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang sgra'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa nyid du gzhan gyis dpog par 'gyur ro snyam
translated: then, thinking ‚ÄúIf I say this, others will infer that I am learned in the Buddha‚Äôs words and the treatises on grammar,‚Äù

original: pas / dper na @141a * //
analyzed: pas / dper na @141a * //
translated: you say, for example,üîΩ‚ÄúAlthough buddhahood did not exist in the mind at the stage of an ordinary being, it is prophesied that it will later become buddhahood and it will be established as buddhahood.‚Äù

original: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyi skad cig ma la snga na sangs rgyas nyid med pa yang phyis sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan nas sangs rgyas su 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po gnas pa'i dus na snga na 'jig pa med pa
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyi skad cig ma la snga na sangs rgyas nyid med pa yang phyis sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan nas sangs rgyas su 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po gnas pa'i dus na snga na 'jig pa med pa
translated: Similarly, you say, ‚ÄúAlthough disintegration did not exist previously at the time the thing endures,

original: yang phyis 'jig pa'i rkyen dang phrad nas 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: yang phyis 'jig pa'i rkyen dang phrad nas 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: it later becomes disintegration when it meets the conditions of disintegration.‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: sgrub pa de ni tha snyad du yang mi gnod do //
analyzed: sgrub pa de ni tha snyad du yang mi gnod do //
translated: That proof is not undermined even conventionally.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma gang la sangs rgyas nyid med pa de ni phyis kyang sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma gang la sangs rgyas nyid med pa de ni phyis kyang sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not accepted that that which lacks buddhahood at any moment of consciousness will later become buddhahood.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig ma la sangs rgyas nyid kyi sgrar brjod par bya zhing de la ni sangs rgyas nyid med na mi 'byung ba med pas de ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig ma la sangs rgyas nyid kyi sgrar brjod par bya zhing de la ni sangs rgyas nyid med na mi 'byung ba med pas de ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, the moment of consciousness that is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience should be called buddhahood. If buddhahood does not exist, it is not tenable to say that it exists later.

original: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sangs rgyas nyid med pa de ni phyis kyang sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sangs rgyas nyid med pa de ni phyis kyang sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: That which lacks buddhahood at any moment of consciousness of the state of being an ordinary being will not become buddhahood later.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i ye shes de ni sangs rgyas nyid yod na 'byung ba yin pas so so'i skye bo'i dus na sgrib pa spangs pa'i ye shes ni yod la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i ye shes de ni sangs rgyas nyid yod na 'byung ba yin pas so so'i skye bo'i dus na sgrib pa spangs pa'i ye shes ni yod la /
translated: If buddhahood exists, the gnosis that abandons the obstructions of a buddha exists. Therefore at the time of being an ordinary being, the gnosis that abandons the obstructions exists.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du ni ma grub pa zhig phyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir snga na sangs rgyas nyid med pa dang phyis sangs rgyas nyid du gyur pa gnyis gnas skabs tha dad pas dper mi rung ngo //üîΩde bzhin du rga ba nyid la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa snga na med pa phyis 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi snga nas 'jig pa dang ldan pas 'gag bzhin pa yin pa de bzhin du rga ba la yang snga
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du ni ma grub pa zhig phyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir snga na sangs rgyas nyid med pa dang phyis sangs rgyas nyid du gyur pa gnyis gnas skabs tha dad pas dper mi rung ngo // de bzhin du rga ba nyid la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa snga na med pa phyis 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi snga nas 'jig pa dang ldan pas 'gag bzhin pa yin pa de bzhin du rga ba la yang snga
translated: Because that which is not already established as buddhahood will not later become established as buddhahood, it is not suitable as an example, since the two states of buddhahood not existing earlier and buddhahood occurring later are different occasions.üîΩAging itself should be applied in the same way.üîΩIt is not that destruction does not exist earlier and later becomes destruction, but rather that since it possesses destruction earlier, it is ceasing.

original: na med pa las phyis rga ba nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: na med pa las phyis rga ba nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, aging does not become aging later from not existing earlier.

original: snga nas rga ba dang ldan pas rga bzhin pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga nas rga ba dang ldan pas rga bzhin pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since it possesses aging earlier, it is aging.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rga shi med pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid mi 'thad pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rga shi med pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid mi 'thad pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: Since it is untenable that an existent thing devoid of aging and death exists, the master said:

original: dngos po thams cad dus kun du //üîΩrga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dus kun du // rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //
translated: All things at all times

original: gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //
analyzed: gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //
translated: Are subject to aging and death.

original: gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //
translated: What thing is there that abidesüîΩWithout aging and death?

original: zhes bya bas ni dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas gnas pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas gnas pa med par bstan to //
translated: This verse teaches that because all things are related to impermanence, they are subject to aging and death, and so they do not endure.

original: gang la skye ba yod na gnas pa 'byung bar mthong ba'i skye ba ma grub pas de'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid @141b nyams pa med pa'am /
analyzed: gang la skye ba yod na gnas pa 'byung bar mthong ba'i skye ba ma grub pas de'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid @141b nyams pa med pa'am /
translated: Since arising is not established, the arising of endurance is not seen. Therefore, the meaning is not established, and the meaning is not undermined.

original: don 'gal ba nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩsngar pha rol po dag na re skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te / sngar pha rol po dag na re skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is the summary.üîΩPreviously, the opponent said, ‚ÄúArising exists because if it exists, the phenomenon of emergence exists.‚Äù

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the reason is established in terms of ultimate reality, then the meaning is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If you establish it conventionally, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: yang gzhan yang /üîΩ'di la khyed gnas pa la gnas pa yod par 'dod pa de la yang gnas pa de gnas pa gzhan gyis sam /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / 'di la khyed gnas pa la gnas pa yod par 'dod pa de la yang gnas pa de gnas pa gzhan gyis sam /
translated: Moreover,

original: de nyid kyis gnas par 'dod grang na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis gnas par 'dod grang na /
translated: in this regard, you who assert that endurance exists for that which is enduring, do you assert that endurance endures due to another endurance or does it endure due to itself?

original: de gnyi ga yang mi rigs pas de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgnas pa gnas pa gzhan dang ni //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang mi rigs pas de'i phyir bshad pa / gnas pa gnas pa gzhan dang ni //
translated: Both of those are illogical. Therefore it is said:üîΩEndurance does not endure

original: de nyid kyis kyang gnas mi rigs //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang gnas mi rigs //
translated: Due to another endurance or due to itself.

original: ci lta zhe na /üîΩci ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
analyzed: ci lta zhe na / ci ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
translated: Why is that?üîΩJust as arising does not arise

original: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin bzhin //
translated: Due to itself or another.

original: ci ltar skye ba rang nyid kyis skyed par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba rang nyid kyis skyed par mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it illogical for arising to give rise to itself?

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
translated: How could this non-arisen arising

original: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar skyed //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar skyed //
translated: Give rise to itself?

original: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: But if arising gives rise to itself when it has arisen,

original: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //üîΩces smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod // ces smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What arisen thing is there that is given rise to?

original: ci ltar skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed par mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it illogical for arising to give rise to another?

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising causes it to arise,

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there will be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
translated: If it arises without another arising,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur // zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: all things would arise in that way.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang /
translated: In the same way, here also,

original: gnas pa 'di ni mi gnas pas //
analyzed: gnas pa 'di ni mi gnas pas //
translated: this endurance does not endure by itself.

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar gnas //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar gnas //
translated: How could it endure by itself?

original: ci ste gnas pas gnas byed na //
analyzed: ci ste gnas pas gnas byed na //
translated: If it endures by another endurance,

original: gnas na ci zhig gnas su yod //
analyzed: gnas na ci zhig gnas su yod //
translated: what is enduring that endures?

original: ces bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas skye ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas gnas pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis gnas pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas skye ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas gnas pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis gnas pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The treatise states:

original: gal te gnas pa gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te gnas pa gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another endurance causes it to endure,

original: de gnas thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de gnas thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there will be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste gnas pa med gnas ni //
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa med gnas ni //
translated: If it endures without another endurance,

original: thams cad de bzhin gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin gnas par 'gyur //
translated: all things would endure in that way.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'dir yang skye ba gzhan gyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni ci ltar rtsa ba'i skye ba rang dang gzhan gyis
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'dir yang skye ba gzhan gyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni ci ltar rtsa ba'i skye ba rang dang gzhan gyis
translated: Since the refutation of production by another is applicable here, the refutation of endurance by another should also be stated.üîΩJust as root production does not produce itself or another,

original: skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i gnas pa yang rang dang gzhan gyis gnas par mi byed par bstan to //
analyzed: skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i gnas pa yang rang dang gzhan gyis gnas par mi byed par bstan to //
translated: so root endurance does not endure itself or another.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnas pa med pas skye ba ni yod pa kho na @142a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnas pa med pas skye ba ni yod pa kho na @142a * //
translated: Therefore, since endurance does not exist in this way, production does exist,üîΩbecause if it exists, the phenomenon of arising exists.üîΩSince the meaning of this reason is not established, it is difficult to respond.

original: yin te / de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan gdab dka'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: yin te / de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan gdab dka'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: de ltar gnas pa med pas sngar pha rol po dag na re skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa med pas sngar pha rol po dag na re skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, since endurance does not exist, the opponent previously said that production does exist,üîΩand that since it exists, the phenomenon of arising exists.

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that exists, the phenomenon of enduring exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni de yod na 'byung ba'i chos med de dper na rus sbal gyi spu med pa la de'i gos 'byung ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni de yod na 'byung ba'i chos med de dper na rus sbal gyi spu med pa la de'i gos 'byung ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, that which does not exist has no phenomenon of enduring that exists if that exists, just as, for example, the cloth of a rabbit‚Äôs fur does not exist if that does not exist.

original: skye ba yod pa la ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smros pa'i 'thad pas skye ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa la ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i chos yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smros pa'i 'thad pas skye ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub par bstan to //
translated: Since the characteristic of enduring exists for that which has arising, therefore, the meaning of the reason stated by the opponent is unestablished.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum las gnas pa yang mi 'thad par bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum las gnas pa yang mi 'thad par bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has already been established that enduring is untenable as a characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: da ni 'gag pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i phyir je dang por phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'gag pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i phyir je dang por phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to establish that cessation is untenable, first the opponent‚Äôs position is presented.

original: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: don dam par dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The arising and enduring of things ultimately exist.

original: de dag dang lhan cig spyod pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig spyod pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the phenomena that accompany them exist.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni de dag dang lhan cig spyod pa'i chos med do //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni de dag dang lhan cig spyod pa'i chos med do //
translated: For whatever does not exist here, the phenomena that accompany it do not exist.

original: dper na rta'i rva la 'gag pa med pa bzhin no //üîΩskye ba dang gnas pa dag la ni lhan cig spyod pa'i chos 'gag pa yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par skye ba dang gnas pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na rta'i rva la 'gag pa med pa bzhin no // skye ba dang gnas pa dag la ni lhan cig spyod pa'i chos 'gag pa yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par skye ba dang gnas pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like the nonexistence of a horse‚Äôs horn.üîΩSince the phenomena that accompany arising and enduring exist, therefore, by the power of the reason stated, arising and enduring exist in reality.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: 'di na rta'i rva la sogs pa med pa gang dag la lhan cig spyod pa'i chos 'gag pa med pa de dag ni don dam par med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na rta'i rva la sogs pa med pa gang dag la lhan cig spyod pa'i chos 'gag pa med pa de dag ni don dam par med pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, those non-existent things such as the horn of a horse, which have no cessation of co-occurring phenomena, are ultimately non-existent.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa gang dag la lhan cig spyod pa'i chos 'gag pa yod pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa gang dag la lhan cig spyod pa'i chos 'gag pa yod pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But those things such as arising and enduring, which have cessation of co-occurring phenomena, are only ultimately existent.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: dngos po'i 'gag pa yang 'gags pa'am ma 'gags pa'am bzhin pa zhig 'gag par 'gyur grang na de rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya ba la @142b sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'gag pa yang 'gags pa'am ma 'gags pa'am bzhin pa zhig 'gag par 'gyur grang na de rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya ba la @142b sogs pa smras te /
translated: The cessation of things would be the cessation of what has ceased, what has not ceased, or what is in the process of ceasing. But since that is untenable in any way, therefore it is said ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: 'gag pa de brtag pa rnam pa gsum char du mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: 'gag pa de brtag pa rnam pa gsum char du mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: It shows that the cessation of that is untenable in all three ways of conceiving it.

original: de la brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To present the first conception, it is said:

original: 'gags pa 'gag par mi byed de //
analyzed: 'gags pa 'gag par mi byed de //
translated: What has ceased does not cause cessation.

original: shi ba yang 'chi bar 'gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: shi ba yang 'chi bar 'gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because it is not tenable that what is already dead dies.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To present the second alternative, he says:

original: ma 'gags pa yang 'gag mi byed //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yang 'gag mi byed //
translated: That which is not ceased does not cause cessation.

original: 'gag pas stong pa ni 'gag par mi byed de 'gag pa med pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gag pas stong pa ni 'gag par mi byed de 'gag pa med pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That which is empty of cessation does not cause cessation, because it is non-ceased, like endurance.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na gnas pa 'gag pas stong pa ni 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed pa de bzhin du mi 'gags pa 'gag pas stong pa yang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na gnas pa 'gag pas stong pa ni 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed pa de bzhin du mi 'gags pa 'gag pas stong pa yang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: For example, just as endurance, which is empty of cessation, does not cause cessation because it is non-ceased, that which is not ceased, which is empty of cessation, does not cause cessation because it is non-ceased.

original: brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To present the third alternative, he says:

original: 'gag bzhin pa yang de bzhin min //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa yang de bzhin min //
translated: That which is in the process of cessation is not like that.

original: 'gag par mi byed de 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa ma gtogs par 'gag bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'gag par mi byed de 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa ma gtogs par 'gag bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because that which is in the process of ceasing does not exist apart from that which has ceased and that which has not yet ceased, and because both errors would ensue.üîΩOr, in the context of ultimate reality, that which is in the process of ceasing does not cause cessation because it is directed toward the time of transition, like that which is asserted to arise or like the present.

original: yang na don dam par 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag par mi byed de dus su 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir skye bar 'dod pa bzhin nam da ltar bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: yang na don dam par 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag par mi byed de dus su 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir skye bar 'dod pa bzhin nam da ltar bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum,

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the probative sign, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na skye bar 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: dper na skye bar 'dod pa'am /
translated: For example, that which is asserted to arise orüîΩthe present do not cause cessation because they are directed toward the time of transition.

original: da ltar ni dus su 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin pa yang dus su 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed do ;
analyzed: da ltar ni dus su 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gag bzhin pa yang dus su 'pho ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag par mi byed do ;
translated: Similarly, that which is in the process of ceasing does not cause cessation because it is directed toward the time of transition.

original: / yang na ci ste 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba de cung zad ni 'gags cung zad ni ma 'gags pa'o zhes bya bar rtog na de lta na yang de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: / yang na ci ste 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba de cung zad ni 'gags cung zad ni ma 'gags pa'o zhes bya bar rtog na de lta na yang de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: Or, if you think that what is now ceasing is partly ceased and partly not ceased, then even in that case, that which is now ceasing does not cause the cessation of that part which is already ceased.

original: de'i 'gag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'gag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its cessation would be pointless.

original: de'i gang cung zad ma 'gags pa de yang 'gag par mi byed de 'gag pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gang cung zad ma 'gags pa de yang 'gag par mi byed de 'gag pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no //
translated: And that which is now ceasing does not cause the cessation of that part which is not yet ceased, because it is empty of cessation, like the future.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you think that what is now ceasing is that which is tending toward cessation,

original: brgal zhing brtag pa ni de gang zhig yin /üîΩ'gags pa zhig gam /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa ni de gang zhig yin / 'gags pa zhig gam /
translated: the objection and analysis is this: What is that?üîΩIs it that which has ceased or is it that which has not yet ceased?

original: 'on te ma 'gags pa zhig yin zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma 'gags pa zhig yin zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
translated: That is the objection.

original: lan kyang @143a * //
analyzed: lan kyang @143a * //
translated: The response is this:

original: 'gags pa ni 'gag par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'gags pa ni 'gag par mi byed de /
translated: That which has ceased does not cause cessation,

original: de'i 'gag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'gag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cessation would be pointless.

original: ma 'gags pa yang 'gag par mi byed de 'gag pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yang 'gag par mi byed de 'gag pas stong pa'i phyir dper na ma 'ongs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
translated: That which is not yet ceased does not cause cessation because it is empty of cessation, like the future.

original: gzhan yang 'di la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad ni 'gags cung zad ni ma 'gags pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad ni 'gags cung zad ni ma 'gags pa'am /
translated: Moreover, that which is in the process of ceasing would be either partly ceased or not yet ceased,

original: yang na de las gzhan pa 'gags pa'am ma 'gags pa zhig yin grang na /üîΩde la gal te 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa de 'gag pas 'gog par byed na /
analyzed: yang na de las gzhan pa 'gags pa'am ma 'gags pa zhig yin grang na / de la gal te 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa de 'gag pas 'gog par byed na /
translated: or it would be other than that.üîΩIf that which is in the process of ceasing causes cessation through cessation,

original: re zhig de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gag pa des bkag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gag pa des bkag pa ma yin la /
translated: then that which is partly ceased would not be caused to cease by that cessation.

original: 'gags pa de 'gag bzhin pa yang ma yin te /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'gags pa de 'gag bzhin pa yang ma yin te / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That which is in the process of ceasing is not that which has ceased,

original: de 'gags na 'gag bzhin pa ma yin zhing 'gag bzhin pa 'gog par byed do zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gags na 'gag bzhin pa ma yin zhing 'gag bzhin pa 'gog par byed do zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that that which has ceased is not in the process of ceasing and that which is in the process of ceasing causes cessation.

original: gal te cung zad 'gags pa de 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gag par 'gyur bar nges so //
analyzed: gal te cung zad 'gags pa de 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gag par 'gyur bar nges so //
translated: But if that which has ceased a little bit has ceased only without ceasing, then it is certain that the remainder would also cease only without ceasing.

original: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags la cung zad ni 'gag pas 'gag par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags la cung zad ni 'gag pas 'gag par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else, you must state what the difference is between that which has ceased a little bit only without ceasing and that which is ceasing by ceasing.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de yang 'gag pa kho nas bkag na ni de lta na ma 'gags pa 'gag pas 'gag par byed kyi /
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de yang 'gag pa kho nas bkag na ni de lta na ma 'gags pa 'gag pas 'gag par byed kyi /
translated: But if that which has ceased a little bit has ceased only through ceasing, then in that case that which has not ceased would cease through ceasing.

original: 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But that which is in the process of ceasing does not cease through ceasing.

original: yang gzhan yang de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gags pas 'gag par mi byed de 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gags pas 'gag par mi byed de 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that which has ceased a little bit does not cause that which has ceased to cease through ceasing, because it has already ceased.

original: des na de'i lhag ma ma 'gags pa gang yin pa de 'gag pas 'gag par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de'i lhag ma ma 'gags pa gang yin pa de 'gag pas 'gag par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, that which has not ceased, the remainder of that, would cause that which has ceased to cease through ceasing.

original: de lta na 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the statement ‚ÄúThat now ceasing causes cessation‚Äù would be undermined.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de yang /
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad 'gags pa de yang /
translated: But if that which has ceased a little

original: yang 'gag pas 'gag par byed na ni de la 'gag pa gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'gag pas 'gag par byed na ni de la 'gag pa gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
translated: causes cessation, then it would have a distinction made by two cessations, but it does not.

original: 'gags zin pa de la ni yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa de yang 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gags zin pa de la ni yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa de yang 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: Because in that which has already ceased, no activity whatsoever is undertaken in order to cause cessation again. Therefore that now ceasing also does not cause cessation.

original: brtag pa gsum po de dag gis ni skye ba khas blangs na yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: brtag pa gsum po de dag gis ni skye ba khas blangs na yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: Through these three analyses, it is shown that if arising is accepted, cessation is untenable.

original: da ni skye ba khas ma blangs na yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i @143b phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba khas ma blangs na yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i @143b phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that cessation is untenable even if arising is not accepted,üîΩit is said:

original: yang na dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because the arising of all things is refuted,

original: ma skyes gang zhig 'gag par byed /
analyzed: ma skyes gang zhig 'gag par byed /
translated: What unarisen thing causes cessation?

original: ma skyes pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid de ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la ni 'gag pa mi srid de ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That which has not arisen cannot possibly cease, because it has not arisen, like the son of a barren woman.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni ma skyes pa'i phyir 'gag pa mi srid pa de bzhin du ma skyes pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir 'gag pa mi srid do //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni ma skyes pa'i phyir 'gag pa mi srid pa de bzhin du ma skyes pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir 'gag pa mi srid do //
translated: For example, just as the son of a barren woman does not cease because he has not arisen, so that which has not arisen does not cease because it has not arisen.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba khas blangs sam khas ma blangs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba khas blangs sam khas ma blangs kyang rung ste /
translated: Thus, whether or not one accepts arising,

original: 'gag pa ji ltar yang mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa ji ltar yang mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: cessation is not established in any way. This is the conclusion.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'gag pa ni gnas pa'am ma gnas pa la brtag grang na de ni gnyi ga la yang mi rung ste zhes bya bas ni brtag pa de gnyi ga la yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'gag pa ni gnas pa'am ma gnas pa la brtag grang na de ni gnyi ga la yang mi rung ste zhes bya bas ni brtag pa de gnyi ga la yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Moreover, here cessation should be investigated with respect to that which endures or that which does not endure, but it is not tenable in either case. This shows that cessation is untenable in both of those two investigations.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩre zhig dngos po gnas pa la //
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir // re zhig dngos po gnas pa la //
translated: First, in order to demonstrate the former analysis, he says:

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgnas pa'i bya ba skyes pa la gnas pa dang mi mthun pa'i 'gag par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // gnas pa'i bya ba skyes pa la gnas pa dang mi mthun pa'i 'gag par mi 'thad de /
translated: First, cessation is not tenableüîΩFor a thing that endures.

original: gnas pa'i phyir de ni grags pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩbrtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir gal te ma gnas pa la 'gag pa yod pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir de ni grags pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so // brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir gal te ma gnas pa la 'gag pa yod pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: It is not tenable that cessation, which is incompatible with endurance, arises in that which is in the process of enduring, because it endures. This is well known.

original: dngos po ma gnas pa la yang //
analyzed: dngos po ma gnas pa la yang //
translated: In order to demonstrate the second analysis, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say there is no error because cessation exists for that which does not endure,‚Äù

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Cessation is not tenableüîΩFor a thing that does not endure.

original: ma gnas pa'i phyir dper na 'gags pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma gnas pa'i phyir dper na 'gags pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The point is that because it does not endure, it is like that which has ceased.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the thesis, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'gags pa ni ma gnas pa'i phyir 'gag par mi 'thad pa de bzhin du ma gnas pa yang ma gnas pa'i phyir 'gag par mi 'thad do //üîΩyang gzhan yang 'di la gnas skabs 'di gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas pa 'gag gam gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa 'gag ces bya ba ni dngos po gnas skabs gang gis gnas pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis 'gag gam /
analyzed: dper na 'gags pa ni ma gnas pa'i phyir 'gag par mi 'thad pa de bzhin du ma gnas pa yang ma gnas pa'i phyir 'gag par mi 'thad do // yang gzhan yang 'di la gnas skabs 'di gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas pa 'gag gam gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa 'gag ces bya ba ni dngos po gnas skabs gang gis gnas pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis 'gag gam /
translated: For example, just as it is untenable that what has ceased ceases because of not enduring, so it is untenable that what has not ceased ceases because of not enduring.üîΩMoreover, here one should ask: Does that which endures cease by means of that very state of endurance, or does that which endures cease by means of another state?

original: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa 'gag grang na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa 'gag grang na /
translated: Does that which endures cease by means of that very state of endurance, or does that which endures cease by means of another state?

original: brtag pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Both of these analyses are untenable.
