original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: What is the point of this? This is a question.

original: brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the former analysis, he says:

original: gnas skabs de yis gnas pa ni //
analyzed: gnas skabs de yis gnas pa ni //
translated: That which endures by means of that state

original: de yis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: Does not cease by means of that state.

original: gnas skabs @144a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs @144a * //
translated: That which endures by means of that stateüîΩDoes not cease by means of that state.

original: gang gis sngar nye bar mtshon pa'i gnas skabs des ni 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis sngar nye bar mtshon pa'i gnas skabs des ni 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which was previously characterized by a state does not cease by means of that state.

original: sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na 'o ma 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na 'o ma 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, milk does not cease by the state of milk itself because its prior state is not relinquished.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na 'o ma 'o ma'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas pa ni sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir gnas skabs de nyid kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po gzhan gnas skabs gang gis sngar nye bar mtshon
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'o ma 'o ma'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas pa ni sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir gnas skabs de nyid kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po gzhan gnas skabs gang gis sngar nye bar mtshon
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are applied in order.üîΩFor example, milk does not cease by the state of milk itself because its prior state is not relinquished.

original: pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas pa yang sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir gnas skabs des 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas pa yang sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir gnas skabs des 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, a thing that abides by any state does not cease by that state itself because its prior state is not relinquished.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To present the second analysis, the root text says:

original: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang //
translated: And also, ‚ÄúThat which endures by another‚Äôs state

original: gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Would not be ceased by another.‚Äù

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya bar blta'i /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya bar blta'i /
translated: Here, one should understand that ‚Äúit would not be ceased by another.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na gzhan ma yin pas 'gog go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan ma yin pas 'gog go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise, it would mean that ‚Äúit is ceased by that which is not another.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the explanation of the words ‚Äúit would not be ceased by another.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: It is not to be construed as ‚Äúit would not be ceased by anotherness.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba nyid bshad pa ste /üîΩgzhan nyid kyis ni 'gag mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bar mi sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid bshad pa ste / gzhan nyid kyis ni 'gag mi 'gyur // zhes bya bar mi sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩThat is the statement of the thesis.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de ni 'dir dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de ni 'dir dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: That which endures by another‚Äôs state would not be ceased by another. This is the statement of the thesis here.

original: phyogs yin no //
analyzed: phyogs yin no //
translated: It is the position.

original: gzhan nyid kyis chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The reason is difference, and the thesis is that the state of being different is the reason.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'o ma ni zho'i gnas skabs kyis 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'o ma ni zho'i gnas skabs kyis 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The inference here is as follows: Ultimately, milk does not cease through the state of yogurt,

original: de las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na de la gzhan pa'i phru ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na de la gzhan pa'i phru ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: because it is different from it, like a pot, etc., which are different from it. The subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na 'o ma las gzhan pa'i phru ba la sogs pa ni 'o ma las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'o ma phru ba'i @144b gnas skabs kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan pa'i zho yang 'o ma las gzhan nyid
analyzed: dper na 'o ma las gzhan pa'i phru ba la sogs pa ni 'o ma las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'o ma phru ba'i @144b gnas skabs kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan pa'i zho yang 'o ma las gzhan nyid
translated: For example, a pot, which is different from milk, does not cease due to the state of being milk because it is different from milk.

original: yin pa'i phyir 'o ma zho'i gnas skabs kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩphyir rgol ba dag na re 'gag pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir 'o ma zho'i gnas skabs kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro // phyir rgol ba dag na re 'gag pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Similarly, yogurt, which is different from milk, does not cease due to the state of being milk because it is different from milk.üîΩOpponents say, ‚ÄúCessation definitely exists because it is based on things, like, for example, cooking.‚Äù

original: dngos po la brten pa'i phyir dper na tshos pa bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang med par sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la brten pa'i phyir dper na tshos pa bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang med par sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma yin te /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position in the proof that because all phenomena are without arising, they are also without cessation.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'bras chan tshos pa ni 'bras chan gyi dngos po la brten pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du 'gag pa yang dngos po la brten pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩde skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: dper na 'bras chan tshos pa ni 'bras chan gyi dngos po la brten pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du 'gag pa yang dngos po la brten pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: For example, cooked rice exists because it is based on the entity of rice. In the same way, cessation exists because it is based on an entity.üîΩIn response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la bshad pa /üîΩgang tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de la bshad pa / gang tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: Here, in response to that, it is said:üîΩWhen the arising

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ba //üîΩde tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ba // de tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: of all phenomena is not tenable,üîΩthen the cessation

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi skye ba mi 'thad pa de'i tshe 'gag pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi skye ba mi 'thad pa de'i tshe 'gag pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: of all phenomena is not tenable.

original: tshos par bya ba dang tshos pa ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes smras so //
analyzed: tshos par bya ba dang tshos pa ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes smras so //
translated: When the arising of all phenomena is not tenable in the manner explained, then cessation is not tenable because the example is not established since that to be cooked and cooking are not established.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'gag pa ni dngos po yod pa'am med pa la brtag grang na zhes bya bas ni brtag pa de gnyi ga la yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'gag pa ni dngos po yod pa'am med pa la brtag grang na zhes bya bas ni brtag pa de gnyi ga la yang 'gag pa mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin both cases, cessation is untenable‚Äù indicates that cessation is untenable in both cases.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the former hypothesis, he says:

original: re zhig dngos po yod pa la //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po yod pa la //
translated: First, cessation of an existent thing

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩmi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me dang grang ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me dang grang ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Is not tenable.üîΩBecause of incompatibility, like heat and cold.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The subject, the thing, and the property to be established, cessation, and the example, heat, are to be applied in order.

original: dper na me dang grang ba nyid ni mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir me la grang ba nyid mi 'thad pa de bzhin du dngos po yod pa dang 'gag pa yang mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa la 'gag pa mi 'thad do
analyzed: dper na me dang grang ba nyid ni mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir me la grang ba nyid mi 'thad pa de bzhin du dngos po yod pa dang 'gag pa yang mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa la 'gag pa mi 'thad do
translated: For example, because heat and cold are incompatible, it is untenable that heat is cold. So too, because existence and cessation are incompatible, it is untenable that an existent thing ceases.

original: // de'i phyir /
analyzed: // de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore:üîΩIt is untenable that an existent thing

original: dngos dang dngos po med pa dag / gcig nyid na ni 'thad pa med //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med pa dag / gcig nyid na ni 'thad pa med //
translated: And a nonthing are the same.

original: ces bya ba smras so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.üîΩBut if you think that having become a thing,

original: ci ste yang dngos por gyur nas de nyid dang bral ba na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o snyam @145a * //
analyzed: ci ste yang dngos por gyur nas de nyid dang bral ba na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o snyam @145a * //
translated: When it is devoid of that, it is called a nonthing.

original: na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag 'di snyam du /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag 'di snyam du /
translated: If you think that,

original: sngar dngos por gyur nas de nyid dang bral ba na dngos po med pa zhes bya bas dngos po yod pa la 'gag pa 'thad par 'gyur bar sems na'o //
analyzed: sngar dngos por gyur nas de nyid dang bral ba na dngos po med pa zhes bya bas dngos po yod pa la 'gag pa 'thad par 'gyur bar sems na'o //
translated: If the opponent thinks, ‚ÄúHaving become a thing, when it is devoid of that, it is called a nonthing,‚Äù then cessation would be tenable for an existent thing.

original: de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩ'o na ni de nyid kyis don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / 'o na ni de nyid kyis don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is untenable, the author of the commentary states:üîΩBut in that case, it is clearly shown that ultimately external and internal things are essenceless,

original: dngos por gyur nas dngos po med par gyur pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ches gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: dngos por gyur nas dngos po med par gyur pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ches gsal bar bstan te /
translated: because having become things, they become non-things.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is just like an illusion and so on.

original: ma grub pa'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs nyid du yang 'gag par 'gyur bas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi bcu pa /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs nyid du yang 'gag par 'gyur bas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no / // / bam po bzhi bcu pa /
translated: Since they would cease even in the state prior to their establishment, things are essenceless.

original: brtag pa phyi ma bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to present the later analysis,

original: ci ste dngos po med pa la rtog ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te ci ste dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par rtog na de yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: ci ste dngos po med pa la rtog ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te ci ste dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par rtog na de yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBut if you imagine that a non-thing ceases,‚Äù and so on. He demonstrates that it is not tenable to imagine that a non-thing ceases.

original: dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par rtog pa dag su zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par rtog pa dag su zhe na /
translated: Who imagines that a non-thing ceases?

original: gzhan sel bar smra ba dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan sel bar smra ba dag ste /
translated: The proponents of other-exclusion.

original: de'i phyir ci ltar kha cig na re gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar kha cig na re gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: Therefore, some say that the cognition of form has an object that is not other than itself,

original: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when that is seen, the cognition of that arises.

original: 'di na gang mthong na gang gi blo skye ba de ni de'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang mthong na gang gi blo skye ba de ni de'i yul can yin te /
translated: Here, that which, when seen, the cognition of that arises, is the object of that,

original: dper na rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye bzhin no //
translated: for example, when the dewlap, etc., which is not other than the nature of a cow, etc., is seen, the cognition of a cow arises.

original: de bzhin du ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo skye bas de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo skye bas de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In the same way, when form, which is not other than the nature of taste, etc., is seen, the cognition of form arises. Therefore, the cognition of form has an object that is not other than itself.

original: de ni gzhan sel bar smra ba dag dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan sel bar smra ba dag dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: This is the syllogism of the proponents of other-exclusion that proves that cessation exists for non-things.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, the example that is similar to the predicate, the application of the example, and the conclusion.

original: dper na ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba'i phyir ba lang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas de'i
analyzed: dper na ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba'i phyir ba lang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas de'i
translated: For example, when one sees a dewlap and so on, which are not of the nature of other, such as a horse, the thought ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù arises. Therefore, since it is an object that is not of the nature of other, such as a horse,

original: yul ba lang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa de la ni so sor ma brtags par 'gog @145b pa'i tshul gyis 'gag pa yod pas /
analyzed: yul ba lang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa de la ni so sor ma brtags par 'gog @145b pa'i tshul gyis 'gag pa yod pas /
translated: the object of that thought is the nonexistence of things that are other than the nature of a cow, such as a horse. Therefore, it is an object that is a nonentity, which is a nonimplicative negation.

original: rta la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa 'gag pa yod pa de bzhin du gzugs so snyam pa'i blo yang ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo skye ba'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la sogs pa medüîΩpa'i yul can yin pas /
analyzed: rta la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa 'gag pa yod pa de bzhin du gzugs so snyam pa'i blo yang ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo skye ba'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is a subject that is not other than the nature of form,üîΩit is said that the cessation of the nonexistence of things such as taste that are other than the nature of its object, form, exists, since the mode of nonanalytical cessation exists in relation to that.

original: de'i yul gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa de la yang so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa'i tshul 'gag pa yod pas ro la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la yang 'gag pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i yul gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa de la yang so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa'i tshul 'gag pa yod pas ro la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la yang 'gag pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus they say that the cessation of the nonexistence of things such as taste exists.

original: 'di skad bstan te de dag gi gzhung las sgra'i don ni gzhan sel ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te de dag gi gzhung las sgra'i don ni gzhan sel ba yin te /
translated: This is taught: In their texts the meaning of sound is the exclusion of other.

original: dper na ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod pa'i dus na des rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal bas rta la sogs pa gzhan bsal ba de dag gi dngos po med pa de dag la ni so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa'i tshul gyis
analyzed: dper na ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod pa'i dus na des rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal bas rta la sogs pa gzhan bsal ba de dag gi dngos po med pa de dag la ni so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa'i tshul gyis
translated: For example, when the term ‚Äúcow‚Äù is uttered, it excludes all other things such as horses.üîΩThe nonexistence of those other things such as horses is not an analytical cessation.

original: 'gag pa yod pas rta la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod pa de bzhin du gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod pa'i dus na des kyang ro la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal bas ro la sogs pa gzhan bsal ba de dag
analyzed: 'gag pa yod pas rta la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod pa de bzhin du gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod pa'i dus na des kyang ro la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal bas ro la sogs pa gzhan bsal ba de dag
translated: Just as the nonexistence of horses and so on is a cessation, when the term ‚Äúform‚Äù is uttered, it excludes all other things such as taste.

original: gi dngos po med pa de dag la yang so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa'i tshul gyis 'gag pa yod pas /üîΩro la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la yang 'gag pa yod do //
analyzed: gi dngos po med pa de dag la yang so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa'i tshul gyis 'gag pa yod pas / ro la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la yang 'gag pa yod do //
translated: The nonexistence of those other things such as taste is not an analytical cessation.üîΩJust as the nonexistence of taste and so on is a cessation, the valid knowledge that establishes the exclusion of other objects of terms is as follows.

original: sgra'i don gzhan sel ba de sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i don gzhan sel ba de sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: The cognition of form has an object that is not other than itself.

original: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir dper na rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te ci ltar ba lang gi blos ba lang mthong na ba langüîΩgi blo skye ba'i phyir ba lang gi blo ni ba lang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas /üîΩba lang gi blos kyang yul ba lang ma gtogs par rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi blos kyang gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo skye ba'i phyir gzugs kyi blo ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la
analyzed: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir dper na rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te ci ltar ba lang gi blos ba lang mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba'i phyir ba lang gi blo ni ba lang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas / ba lang gi blos kyang yul ba lang ma gtogs par rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi blos kyang gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo skye ba'i phyir gzugs kyi blo ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la
translated: Just as the cognition of an ox is an object that is not other than the self of an ox, because when the cognition of an ox sees an ox, the cognition of an ox arises.üîΩJust as the cognition of an ox excludes all things that are other than the object ox, in the same way, because when the cognition of form sees form, the cognition of form arises, the cognition of form is an object that is not other than the self of form, because it is not the taste of sound and so on.

original: sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas gzugs kyi blos kyang yul gzugs ma gtogs pa ro la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal to //
analyzed: sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin pas gzugs kyi blos kyang yul gzugs ma gtogs pa ro la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan thams cad bsal to //
translated: Therefore the cognition of form excludes all things that are other than the object form, such as taste and so on.

original: ci ltar gzugs kyi blo @146a * //üîΩbdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can gyis gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pha ro la sogs pa dngos po gzhan thams cad sel ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi sgra bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can gyis kyang gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa sgra
analyzed: ci ltar gzugs kyi blo @146a * // bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can gyis gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pha ro la sogs pa dngos po gzhan thams cad sel ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi sgra bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can gyis kyang gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa sgra
translated: Just as the cognition of form,üîΩwhose object is not different from the nature of form, excludes all other things, such as sound, which are different from the nature of form, so too the cognition of sound, whose object is not different from the nature of sound, excludes all other things, such as form, which are different from the nature of sound.

original: la sogs pa dngos po gzhan thams cad sel bar byed pas sgra'i don ni gzhan sel ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa dngos po gzhan thams cad sel bar byed pas sgra'i don ni gzhan sel ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the meaning of sound is the exclusion of other.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That is not logical.

original: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that not logical?

original: de nyid kyis gtan tshigs de ma grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis gtan tshigs de ma grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, because that reason is unestablished.

original: gzhan sel ba smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid kyis gtan tshigs de ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid kyis gtan tshigs de ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The reason that the opponent states, ‚Äúbecause when one sees that, the awareness of that arises,‚Äù is itself unestablished.

original: ci ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: How is it unestablished?

original: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause when one sees that, the awareness of that arises‚Äù?

original: gal te de zhes bya ba'i sgra gzugs la snyegs te /
analyzed: gal te de zhes bya ba'i sgra gzugs la snyegs te /
translated: If the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to form,

original: gzugs de mthong na gzugs de'i blo skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des gzugs kyi blo de bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin par sgrub na ni 'o na de lta na gzugs mthong zhing gzugs kyi blo skye ba de bdag nyid las gzhanüîΩmed pa'i yul can yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs de mthong na gzugs de'i blo skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des gzugs kyi blo de bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin par sgrub na ni 'o na de lta na gzugs mthong zhing gzugs kyi blo skye ba de bdag nyid las gzhanüîΩmed pa'i yul can yin par mi rung ste /
translated: then if the reason, ‚Äúbecause when one sees that form, the awareness of that form arises,‚Äù proves that the awareness of form has an object that is not different from itself, then in that case it is not suitable that when one sees form and the awareness of form arises, that awareness of form has an object that is not different from itself.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid yod pa'i yul can yin par 'gyur bas des na gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar bsgrubs pa de mi 'grub pas gtan tshigs de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid yod pa'i yul can yin par 'gyur bas des na gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar bsgrubs pa de mi 'grub pas gtan tshigs de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the proof that the cognition of form has an object that is not different from itself is not established, that reason is not correct.

original: 'on te gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar sgrub na ni des na gzugs mthong ngo zhes bya bar yang mi rung la gzugs kyi blo skye zhes byar yang mi rung ste 'di ltar ci yang med pa'i yul
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar sgrub na ni des na gzugs mthong ngo zhes bya bar yang mi rung la gzugs kyi blo skye zhes byar yang mi rung ste 'di ltar ci yang med pa'i yul
translated: But if you prove that the cognition of form has an object that is not different from itself, then it is not tenable to say ‚ÄúHe sees form‚Äù and it is not tenable to say ‚ÄúThe cognition of form arises.‚Äù

original: can gyi blo zhig skye bas /
analyzed: can gyi blo zhig skye bas /
translated: Why? Because a cognition that has a nonexistent object arises.üîΩTherefore, just as the eye does not apprehend sound, in the same way, the cognition of form does not see form and the cognition of form does not arise.

original: des na ci ltar sgra la mig gi bzung ba nyid med pa de bzhin du blo la yang gzugs mthong ba yang med la gzugs kyi blo skye ba yang med pas de lta na ci yang med pa'i yul can gyi blo la gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi blo
analyzed: des na ci ltar sgra la mig gi bzung ba nyid med pa de bzhin du blo la yang gzugs mthong ba yang med la gzugs kyi blo skye ba yang med pas de lta na ci yang med pa'i yul can gyi blo la gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi blo
translated: Thus, in a cognition that has a nonexistent object, the cognition of the form of a vase does not exist.

original: yang med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi blo yod pa la ltos nas ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi yang ma grub pa'i phyir gzugs kyi
analyzed: yang med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi blo yod pa la ltos nas ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi yang ma grub pa'i phyir gzugs kyi
translated: Because it does not exist, the cognition of form is established as having an object that is not other than itself.üîΩBut since the specific property of the subject is not established, the reason is also not established.

original: blo @146b ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar sgrub pa de mi 'grub pas gtan tshigs de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo @146b ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya bar sgrub pa de mi 'grub pas gtan tshigs de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of form is established as having an object that is not other than itself, but that is not established, so that reason is not valid.

original: ci ste de zhes bya ba'i sgra yul med pa nyid la snyegs te /
analyzed: ci ste de zhes bya ba'i sgra yul med pa nyid la snyegs te /
translated: But if the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the nonexistence of an object,

original: yul med pa de mthong na yul med pa de'i blo skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des gzugs kyi blo de bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin par sgrub na ni des na 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul med pa de mthong na yul med pa de'i blo skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des gzugs kyi blo de bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin par sgrub na ni des na 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: and if the reason is stated as ‚Äúbecause when that nonexistence of an object is seen, the cognition of that nonexistence of an object arises,‚Äù then if that reason establishes that the cognition of form has an object that is not other than itself, then this is what is being taught:

original: blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: The cognition of form has an object that is not other than itself.

original: yul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'gyur bas gtan tshigs de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir mi 'grub pas rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'gyur bas gtan tshigs de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir mi 'grub pas rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that reason is only one part of the meaning of the thesis, it is not established. Therefore it is not logical.

original: gzhan yang / dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical because the example has the fault of not having the property to be proven.

original: 'di ltar ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo ni med pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo ni med pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition thinking ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not a subject that has a nonexistent object.

original: ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo'i yul ni ba lang gi dngos po yod pa kho na yin pas des na pha rol po'i dpe ba lang gi blo skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de la bsgrub par bya ba chos med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya
analyzed: ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo'i yul ni ba lang gi dngos po yod pa kho na yin pas des na pha rol po'i dpe ba lang gi blo skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de la bsgrub par bya ba chos med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya
translated: The object of the cognition thinking ‚Äúcow‚Äù is only the existent entity of a cow. Therefore, in the opponent‚Äôs example, ‚ÄúJust as the cognition of a cow arises,‚Äù the subject has the property to be proven, which is ‚Äúhas a nonexistent object.‚Äù

original: ba de ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba de ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that is incomplete, it has the fault of not being logical.

original: gzhan yang gzugs kyi blo ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba de la gzugs zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa gcig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs kyi blo ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa ro la sogs pa med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba de la gzugs zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa gcig go //
translated: In that statement, ‚Äúform‚Äù is one conceptual thought.

original: ro la sogs pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Taste, etc.‚Äù is a second conceptual thought.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid las zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid las zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú From the nature of form‚Äù is a third conceptual thought.

original: ro la sogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Different from taste, etc.‚Äù is a fourth conceptual thought.

original: med do zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa lnga pa ste skad cig ma gcig la rnam par rtog pa lnga dus gcig tu 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir sgra'i don gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rtog pa lnga pa ste skad cig ma gcig la rnam par rtog pa lnga dus gcig tu 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir sgra'i don gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
translated: ‚Äú Does not exist‚Äù is a fifth conceptual thought. Since it is impossible for five conceptual thoughts to occur simultaneously in a single moment, it is illogical to say that the meaning of a word is the exclusion of other.

original: de ltar gzhan sel bar smra ba dag dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par 'dod pa'i phyogs mi 'thad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan sel bar smra ba dag dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par 'dod pa'i phyogs mi 'thad par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated that it is untenable to assert that cessation exists in a nonthing,

original: da ni gzhan gang dag dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par 'dod pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gang dag dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par 'dod pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute others who assert that cessation exists in regard to a non-thing,

original: yang bshad pa /üîΩdngos po med par gyur pa la'ang /
analyzed: yang bshad pa / dngos po med par gyur pa la'ang /
translated: it is further said:üîΩCessation is not tenable

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In regard to a non-thing.

original: med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: mgo gnyis pa la ci ltar ni //
analyzed: mgo gnyis pa la ci ltar ni //
translated: Just as a second head

original: gcad du med pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: gcad du med pa de bzhin no //
translated: cannot be cut off.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper @147a * //
analyzed: dper @147a * //
translated: For example,

original: na mgo gnyis pa med pa ni med pa'i phyir gcad du med pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na mgo gnyis pa med pa ni med pa'i phyir gcad du med pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: just as a second head does not exist and cannot be cut off because it does not exist, so too cessation does not occur because a thing does not exist.

original: 'dis ni med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas 'gog pa med pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod par ston to zhes bya ba ni tshig
analyzed: 'dis ni med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas 'gog pa med pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod par ston to zhes bya ba ni tshig
translated: cessation of nonexistence.

original: le'ur byas pa gong ma 'dis ni pha rol po dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par smra ba rnams dngos po med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yang med pa nyid kyis de rnams kyi dam bcas pa la
analyzed: le'ur byas pa gong ma 'dis ni pha rol po dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par smra ba rnams dngos po med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yang med pa nyid kyis de rnams kyi dam bcas pa la
translated: This first chapter shows that the thesis of those who maintain that there is

original: chos can dngos po med pa zhes bya ba 'gag pa yod par sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan te /
analyzed: chos can dngos po med pa zhes bya ba 'gag pa yod par sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan te /
translated: cessation of nonexistence is erroneous, because the property of the subject isüîΩnot established, since the nonexistence is inferred.

original: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par dam bcas pa mi 'grub par bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par dam bcas pa mi 'grub par bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the thesis that there is cessation of nonexistence is not established by their inference.

original: yang gzhan yang khyed cag 'gag pa'i 'gag pa zhes smras pa de don dam par yod na rang gi bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur grang na /üîΩde la / 'gag pa 'gag pa gzhan dang ni //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang khyed cag 'gag pa'i 'gag pa zhes smras pa de don dam par yod na rang gi bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur grang na / de la / 'gag pa 'gag pa gzhan dang ni //
translated: Moreover, if that which is called the cessation of cessation exists ultimately, it would cease either by its own nature or by the nature of another.üîΩCessation does not make sense

original: de nyid kyis kyang 'gag mi rigs //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang 'gag mi rigs //
translated: Either in virtue of itself or another.

original: ci ltar zhe na /üîΩci ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / ci ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
translated: Why is that?üîΩJust as arising is not generated

original: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin bzhin //
translated: Either by itself or another.

original: ci ltar skye ba rang nyid kyis skyed par mi rigs zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba rang nyid kyis skyed par mi rigs zhe na /
translated: Why is it that arising is not generated by itself?

original: ci skad du /üîΩskye ba 'dis ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: ci skad du / skye ba 'dis ni ma skyes pas //
translated: As it is said:üîΩHow could this non-arisen arising

original: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar skyed //üîΩci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar skyed // ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: Generate itself?üîΩIf the arisen generates,

original: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //üîΩces smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod // ces smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What arisen is there to generate?

original: ci ltar skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed par mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it that arising is not generated by another?

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising generates it,

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: There would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste skye ba med skye na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skye na //
translated: If that which is not arisen were to arise,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur // zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then everything would arise in the same way.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang /üîΩ'gag pa 'di ni ma 'gags pas //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang / 'gag pa 'di ni ma 'gags pas //
translated: In the same way, here also,üîΩHow could this cessation, which is non-ceased,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar 'gag / ci ste 'gag pas 'gag byed na //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ci ltar 'gag / ci ste 'gag pas 'gag byed na //
translated: cause the cessation of itself? But if cessation were to cause cessation through cessation,

original: 'gags na ci zhig 'gag tu yod //
analyzed: 'gags na ci zhig 'gag tu yod //
translated: then what is being ceased would be ceased through cessation.

original: ces bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas /
analyzed: ces bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas /
translated: Thus, through the explanation of these verses,üîΩthe refutation of the arising of arising itself should be applied to the refutation of the cessation of cessation itself.

original: skye ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed ba dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'gag pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩgal te 'gag pa gzhan zhig gis //üîΩde 'gag thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed ba dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'gag pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o // gal te 'gag pa gzhan zhig gis // de 'gag thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: If cessation were to cause the cessation of thatüîΩthrough another cessation, there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste 'gag pa med 'gag na //
analyzed: ci ste 'gag pa med 'gag na //
translated: But if cessation were to cause the cessation of that without another cessation,

original: thams cad de bzhin 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: then everything would cease in the same way.

original: zhes @147b bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'dir yang skye ba gzhan gyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa gzhan gyis 'gag pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni ci ltar rtsa ba'i skye ba rang dang gzhan
analyzed: zhes @147b bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'dir yang skye ba gzhan gyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa gzhan gyis 'gag pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni ci ltar rtsa ba'i skye ba rang dang gzhan
translated: Here, following the refutation of production by another, the refutation of cessation by another should also be stated.

original: gyis skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i 'gag pa yang rang dang gzhan gyis 'gag par mi byed par bstan to //üîΩgang dag 'jig pa can rnams ni 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig go zhes zer ba de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya bas ni gang dag 'jig pa la rgyu yod par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: gyis skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rtsa ba'i 'gag pa yang rang dang gzhan gyis 'gag par mi byed par bstan to // gang dag 'jig pa can rnams ni 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig go zhes zer ba de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya bas ni gang dag 'jig pa la rgyu yod par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Just as root production does not produce itself or another, so root cessation does not cause the cessation of itself or another.üîΩThose who say that things that are perishable are destroyed by a cause of destruction should be addressed as follows.üîΩThis shows that the assertion that destruction has a cause is untenable.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par shes pa de ni de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par shes pa de ni de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is the case, it says, That which is ascertained as the cause of the destruction of something is not the cause of its destruction.

original: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is different from that, like other things that are different from it.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na 'jig pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dag ni 'jig pa de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par shes pa de yang
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'jig pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dag ni 'jig pa de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par shes pa de yang
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, other things that are different from the cause of disintegration are not causes of disintegration because they are different from that disintegration.

original: 'jig pa de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, that which is ascertained as the cause of the disintegration of something is also different from that disintegration, and therefore it is not the cause of its disintegration.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bsgrub pa rgyas pa ci skad bstan pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid dang med pa
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bsgrub pa rgyas pa ci skad bstan pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid dang med pa
translated: the opponent‚Äôs arguments and examples are refuted. Ultimately, the reason

original: nyid yin la /
analyzed: nyid yin la /
translated: and example are not established and do not exist.üîΩIf the reason and example are stated conventionally, they are contradictory.

original: kun rdzob tu gtan tshigs dang dpe dag brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs 'di'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gtan tshigs dang dpe dag brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs 'di'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of this section and the result of the valid cognition.

original: ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu'i dbang gis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu'i dbang gis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude by means of the result, as stated,

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa dag / ma grub phyir ni 'dus byas med //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa dag / ma grub phyir ni 'dus byas med //
translated: Since arising, enduring, and ceasing are not established, the produced does not exist.üîΩThe opponent might say that ultimately the aggregates, elements, and

original: de la pha rol pos don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol pos don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: faculties, which are produced, are to be regarded as having the nature of theüîΩproduced.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ma grub po zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i skabs spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ma grub po zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i skabs spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThat which you have said, ‚Äòbecause they possess the characteristics of conditioned phenomena such as arising,‚Äô is unestablished.‚Äù This is the general conclusion of the chapter and the result of valid knowledge.

original: gang dag don dam par ba lang la sogs pa 'dus byas dag yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩde dag gi mtshan nyid lkog @148a * //
analyzed: gang dag don dam par ba lang la sogs pa 'dus byas dag yod pa kho na yin te / de dag gi mtshan nyid lkog @148a * //
translated: Those who say, ‚ÄúOnly the conditioned such as cows and so on exist ultimately,üîΩbecause their characteristics such as the dewlap and so on exist,‚Äù

original: shal la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: shal la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: to them it is said, ‚ÄúThe existence of the characteristics of conditioned phenomena such as arising and so on is not established.‚Äù

original: sngar ni 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag dgag par bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag dgag par bstan to //
translated: Previously the general characteristics of conditioned phenomena such as arising, enduring, and disintegrating were taught to be negated.

original: da ni bye brag pa la sogs pas 'dus byas kyi rang rang gi mtshan nyid so sor nges pa gang yod par brtags pa dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni bye brag pa la sogs pas 'dus byas kyi rang rang gi mtshan nyid so sor nges pa gang yod par brtags pa dgag pa ston te /
translated: Now the specific characteristics of individual conditioned phenomena that are imputed by Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on are taught to be negated.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa de yang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa de yang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The proof of those is to be applied to the subject, the property to be established, and the establishing property.

original: de dag dgag pa yang sngar 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan pa bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: de dag dgag pa yang sngar 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ci skad bstan pa bzhin du byas te /
translated: The refutation of those is to be done in the same way as the previously explained inference that refutes the general characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du ci lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin nam 'on te mtshan nyid med pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du ci lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin nam 'on te mtshan nyid med pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the same way, one should investigate and analyze whether those characteristics such as the dewlap and so on have characteristics or not.

original: de la gal te de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni de lta na lkog shal la sogs pa de dag ba lang gi ba lang nyid dam 'dus byas nyid mtshon par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni de lta na lkog shal la sogs pa de dag ba lang gi ba lang nyid dam 'dus byas nyid mtshon par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If they have characteristics, then in that case those dewlaps and so on do not indicate cowhood or conditionedness,

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rdzas bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rdzas bzhin no //
translated: because they have characteristics, like the substance of a cow.

original: ci ste de dag mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir de dag rang nyid mi 'grub pas de dag gi mtshan nyid kyis gzhi mtshon par mi nus so zhes snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci ste de dag mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir de dag rang nyid mi 'grub pas de dag gi mtshan nyid kyis gzhi mtshon par mi nus so zhes snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is just as it was extensively explained earlier.

original: ci ltar sngar /
analyzed: ci ltar sngar /
translated: As it was said earlier:

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising is conditioned,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
translated: it would possess three characteristics.

original: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if arising is unconditioned,

original: ci ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //üîΩzhes bya bas don dam par skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin // zhes bya bas don dam par skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: how could it be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon?üîΩThus, ultimately arising and so on are not asserted to be conditioned phenomena that are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena,üîΩbecause they are conditioned phenomena, just like the basis of those characteristics.üîΩAnd ultimately arising is not suitable to be the characteristic of an unconditioned phenomenon,

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par skye ba 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par skye ba 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is a characteristic, like the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dang / gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'khor lo yang mtshan nyid gzhi skyes bu chen po gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dang / gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'khor lo yang mtshan nyid gzhi skyes bu chen po gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Because it is unconditioned, it is like space.üîΩIf you say that the wheel, the basis of the definition, is not ascertained because it is the definition that indicates the other basis of the definition, the great being, then that is not so.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'khor lo ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi skyes bu chen po gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa brgal ba'i @148b
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'khor lo ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi skyes bu chen po gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa brgal ba'i @148b
translated: Because the wheel, the basis of the definition, does not indicate the other basis of the definition, the great being, as conditioned, it is not the case that it is not ascertained because there is no counterexample.

original: lan dang bcas pa rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang /
analyzed: lan dang bcas pa rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang /
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the response that refutes the inference.

original: gal te mtshan nyid 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid 'dus byas na //
translated: Here, if the definition is conditioned,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //üîΩci ste mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur // ci ste mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas //
translated: then it would possess the three characteristics.üîΩBut if the definition is unconditioned,

original: ci ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
translated: how could it be the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: zhes bya bas don dam par lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas don dam par lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: Thus, in the ultimate, a crest jewel and so on is not asserted to be the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon because it is a conditioned phenomenon, like the substance of a cow, the basis of those characteristics.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang gi rdzas bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang gi rdzas bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: And in the ultimate, a crest jewel and so on is not suitable to be the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon because it is an unconditioned phenomenon, like space.üîΩ  Thus he says that his own inference is undermined.

original: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dang / gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyugs bdag chen po gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dang / gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyugs bdag chen po gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not definite because the basis of those characteristics, a cow, is also the characteristic of a great lord of cattle, the basis of those characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyugs bdag chen po gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ci rigs pas rjes su dpag pa
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyugs bdag chen po gzhan la 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ci rigs pas rjes su dpag pa
translated: Because the basis of those characteristics, the basis of the characteristics of a cow, the great lord of cattle, is not indicated by the state of being conditioned, it is not indefinite because there is no discordant side.

original: brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: The response to the objection should be applied in the appropriate way.

original: de dag la mtshan nyid gzhan dag yod na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag la mtshan nyid gzhan dag yod na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If they have other characteristics, the error of infinite regress would ensue.üîΩIf they do not have other characteristics, the error would ensue that they are not the basis of characteristics.üîΩThis should be stated.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan med na ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sngar /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan med na ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sngar /
translated: As previously stated:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //
translated: If the characteristics of conditioned states

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //üîΩgal te yod na thug pa med //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni // gal te yod na thug pa med //
translated: Have other characteristics, there is an infinite regress.

original: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If they do not have other characteristics, they are not conditioned.

original: zhes ci skad bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang /
analyzed: zhes ci skad bstan pa bzhin du 'dir yang /
translated: This should be stated here in the same way.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid so so la //üîΩ'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid so so la // 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //
translated: The characteristics of each individual thing

original: gal te yod na thug pa med //
analyzed: gal te yod na thug pa med //
translated: If there were another characteristic of the conditioned,üîΩthere would be an infinite regress.

original: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If there were not, they would not be conditioned.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: This and other similar statements should be applied appropriately.

original: gzhan dag na re don dam par 'dus byas ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don dam par 'dus byas ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: Others say that conditioned phenomena should be understood as existing ultimately,

original: gnyen po dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have an antidote.

original: 'di na gang med par shes pa de ni gnyen po dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med par shes pa de ni gnyen po dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which is known as nonexistent does not have an antidote,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: 'dus byas la ni gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par 'dus byas yod pa kho nar shes par @149a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas la ni gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par 'dus byas yod pa kho nar shes par @149a * //
translated: But conditioned phenomena have an antidote, the unconditioned. Therefore, by the power of the reason stated, conditioned phenomena should be understood as existing ultimately.

original: bya ste / des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa dag la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod cing phung po la sogs pa dag kyang 'grub bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag rigs pa can gyi rgyu thabs kyis 'dus ma
analyzed: bya ste / des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa dag la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod cing phung po la sogs pa dag kyang 'grub bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag rigs pa can gyi rgyu thabs kyis 'dus ma
translated: Therefore, the previously stated inferences are not undermined by any contradictions or errors, and the aggregates and so on are established.

original: byas yod pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas yod par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: byas yod pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas yod par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is the assertion of our schools, who, by the method of the reasoning of the logicians, establish the existence of the produced from the existence of the unproduced.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Their proofs are to be applied in order to the subject, the property to be established, the proving property, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion.

original: rjes su dpag pa des na dbu ma pas sngar smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod cing kho bo cag gi sgrub pa phung po la sogs pa dag kyang 'grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des na dbu ma pas sngar smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod cing kho bo cag gi sgrub pa phung po la sogs pa dag kyang 'grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamikas say, the previously stated inferences are not undermined by any contradictions or errors, and our proofs, the aggregates and so on, are established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: 'di la 'dus byas rab tu grub na ni de bsal bas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba rdzas cung zhig yod par brjod du yang rung grang na /
analyzed: 'di la 'dus byas rab tu grub na ni de bsal bas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba rdzas cung zhig yod par brjod du yang rung grang na /
translated: If conditioned phenomena were established, then it would be possible to say that a certain substance called ‚Äúunconditioned‚Äù exists, since it is the negation of that.

original: 'dus byas de brtags na yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir /üîΩ'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
analyzed: 'dus byas de brtags na yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir / 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
translated: But since conditioned phenomena are not found when investigated,

original: 'dus ma byas ni ci ltar 'grub //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ci ltar 'grub //
translated: then how could the unconditioned be established?

original: tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du ma skyes pas rdzas nyid du ma grags so zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du ma skyes pas rdzas nyid du ma grags so zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: Since it is not produced conventionally, like the horn of a rabbit, it is not renowned as a substance.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag mi srid pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag mi srid pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that such reasons and so on are impossible.

original: 'dus byas yod na de la ltos nas 'dus ma byas kyang ring po la ltos nas thung du 'grub pa'i tshul du 'grub pas 'dus ma byas yod pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas sgrub tu yang rung grang na /
analyzed: 'dus byas yod na de la ltos nas 'dus ma byas kyang ring po la ltos nas thung du 'grub pa'i tshul du 'grub pas 'dus ma byas yod pa'i sgo nas 'dus byas sgrub tu yang rung grang na /
translated: If conditioned phenomena existed, then in dependence on that, the unconditioned would also be established, just as shortness is established in dependence on length. Therefore it would be possible to establish conditioned phenomena from the perspective of the existence of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas ma grub pas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du ma skyes pas rdzas nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas ma grub pas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du ma skyes pas rdzas nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Since the conditioned is not established, the so-called unconditioned is like the horn of a rabbit, not renowned as a substance even conventionally, since it is not produced. Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs reason and so on are impossible.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgal te don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid ma yin par ston na de lta na de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa nyid bsal ba rjes su bsgrubs pas phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gal te don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid ma yin par ston na de lta na de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa nyid bsal ba rjes su bsgrubs pas phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon
translated: Here the opponent says:üîΩIf you teach that arising and so on are not characteristics ultimately, then in that case, since you refute their being characteristics of the conditioned, the basis of your thesis, reason, and example and so on will be undermined.

original: du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag dbu ma pa la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma grub pas phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhan la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag dbu ma pa la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma grub pas phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhan la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: This is the statement of our schools that the MƒÅdhyamika have the fault of the basis of their thesis, reason, and example and so on being undermined because they do not have characteristics and a basis of characteristics.

original: de skad ces @149b zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces @149b zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentaryüîΩsays:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is explained:

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin yang tha snyad du /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin yang tha snyad du /
translated: Although they do not exist ultimately, conventionally

original: rmi lam ci bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: rmi lam ci bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: Like dreams, like illusions,

original: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
translated: Like a city of gandharvas,

original: yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Since they are accepted as existent, there is no fault.üîΩIn order to teach the example of ‚Äúlike a dream,‚Äù it is said:üîΩJust as a dream, when analyzed, is a memory of an experience, andüîΩthe result of the contact with desired and undesired objects that is caused by the blessings of Dharma and non-Dharma,

original: rmi lam ci bzhin zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar rmi lam rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyu can yul 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rmi lam ci bzhin zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar rmi lam rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyu can yul 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: though it lacks an essence, it is the cause of the mind that thinks ‚Äúit exists‚Äù and so on, and thus it is an object.

original: des ni rmi lam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rmi lam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows the cause, result, and nature of dreams.

original: de la rmi lam gyi rgyu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi rgyu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four causes of dreams:

original: rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: memory of an experience imagined, the power of Dharma, the power of non-Dharma, and the power of a god.

original: de la yang rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa ni sngon gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yul gyi mtshan ma phyi rol na med bzhin du sems kyis rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba gnyid log pa'i tshe dran pa na rgyu des
analyzed: de la yang rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa ni sngon gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yul gyi mtshan ma phyi rol na med bzhin du sems kyis rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba gnyid log pa'i tshe dran pa na rgyu des
translated: Among them, memory of an experience imagined is when, in a previous waking state, the mind imagines the signs of an object that does not exist externally. When one falls asleep, one remembers that experience. By that cause,

original: rmi lam rmi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam rmi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one has a dream.

original: chos ni sngon gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na dge ba'i chos rgya chen po spyad pa'i rgyus gnyid log pa'i tshe na rmi lam bzang po rmi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ni sngon gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na dge ba'i chos rgya chen po spyad pa'i rgyus gnyid log pa'i tshe na rmi lam bzang po rmi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Dharma is when, in a previous waking state, one practices vast virtuous Dharma. By that cause, when one falls asleep, one has a good dream.

original: chos ma yin pa de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Non-Dharma is the opposite of that.
