original: lhas byin gyis brlabs pa ni 'phags pa k'a ty'a ya na chen po'i mthus sa ra nas rmi lam rmis pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lhas byin gyis brlabs pa ni 'phags pa k'a ty'a ya na chen po'i mthus sa ra nas rmi lam rmis pa lta bu ste /
translated: The dream that is blessed by a god is like the dream that Sara·πáa had by the power of the noble MahƒÅkƒÅtyƒÅyana.

original: rmi lam gang las rgyu de bzhi yod pa ni de dag gi rgyu can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gang las rgyu de bzhi yod pa ni de dag gi rgyu can zhes bya'o //
translated: The dream that has the four causes is called ‚Äúhaving those causes.‚Äù

original: rmi lam gyi 'bras bu ni gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi 'bras bu ni gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: The result of the dream is the experience of a desired or undesired object in the state of sleep.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te yul 'dod pa dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa dang / yul mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te yul 'dod pa dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa dang / yul mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: the perception of the approach of the desired object and the perception of the approach of the undesired object.

original: rmi lam gang la 'bras bu de dag yod pa de ni de dag dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gang la 'bras bu de dag yod pa de ni de dag dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dream that has those results is called ‚Äúhaving those results.‚Äù

original: rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang tha snyad du yod pa dang med pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang tha snyad du yod pa dang med pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The nature of the dream is that, although it is essenceless when examined, it is the cause of the cognition of existence and nonexistence conventionally, and thus it is an object.

original: nyid log pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba dang / sad pa'i gnas skabs na med pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du @150a * //
analyzed: nyid log pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba dang / sad pa'i gnas skabs na med pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du @150a * //
translated: and the object is the cause of the cognition that exists in the state of dreaming, and the object is the cause of the cognition that does not exist in the state of waking.

original: 'gyur ba'o // sgyu ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'o // sgyu ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example of illusion, he says:

original: ci ltar sgyu ma sgyu ma mkhan dang gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthu khyad par can las glang po che dang khyu mchog dang bud med dang gnas la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ba dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag ngo bo nyid med kyang
analyzed: ci ltar sgyu ma sgyu ma mkhan dang gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthu khyad par can las glang po che dang khyu mchog dang bud med dang gnas la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ba dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag ngo bo nyid med kyang
translated: Just as an illusion, such as an elephant or a bull or a woman or a house, which arises in the form of an object of the senses through the special power of a spell or a drug or a magician, is without intrinsic reality,

original: shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: but is said to exist because it is the cause of the error of cognition.

original: des kyang sgyu ma'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid bstan te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: des kyang sgyu ma'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid bstan te go rims bzhin no //
translated: By this he teaches the cause, result, and intrinsic reality of illusion, respectively.

original: dri za'i grong khyer ci bzhin du //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ci bzhin du //
translated: Like a city of gandharvas,

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says:

original: ci ltar dri za'i grong khyer 'obs rgya chen po dang sgo dang sgo khang dang / yang thog dkar po dga' ba 'tsher bag can dang khyams zla ba can dang skar khung dang / khang pa brtsegs ma dang ldan pa'i grong khyer gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci ltar dri za'i grong khyer 'obs rgya chen po dang sgo dang sgo khang dang / yang thog dkar po dga' ba 'tsher bag can dang khyams zla ba can dang skar khung dang / khang pa brtsegs ma dang ldan pa'i grong khyer gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Just as the city of the gandharvas is the cause for the arising of the idea of a city, with its great moats, gates, gatehouses, white walls, delightful and resplendent terraces, moon-like courtyards, windows, and multi-storied buildings.

original: des ni dri za'i grong khyer gyi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dri za'i grong khyer gyi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: He has thus explained the nature of the city of the gandharvas.

original: da ni dpe de gsum gyis mtshon pa'i don gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dpe de gsum gyis mtshon pa'i don gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the things illustrated by these three examples, he says:

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
translated: So too origination, so too endurance,

original: de bzhin du ni 'jig pa gsungs //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'jig pa gsungs // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: so too destruction are taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer dag ci lta ba de bzhin du kun rdzob tu skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer dag ci lta ba de bzhin du kun rdzob tu skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One has said that origination, endurance, and destruction are like a dream, an illusion, and the city of the gandharvas.

original: gang dag la ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang dag la ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why were they taught to them?

original: de'i phyir drang srong de kho na nyid mthong ba'i mig yang dag par bye ba rnams la 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs pa'i blo skye ba'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir drang srong de kho na nyid mthong ba'i mig yang dag par bye ba rnams la 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs pa'i blo skye ba'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it was said that they were taught as the cause for generating the cognition of the arising, etc. of conditioned phenomena to the seers whose eyes of seeing reality are opened.

original: rnal 'byor pa chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i blo gros kyi mig yang dag par bye ba rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi shes pa'i blo skyed pa'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i blo gros kyi mig yang dag par bye ba rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi shes pa'i blo skyed pa'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
translated: For yogis whose eyes of intelligence that see the reality of all phenomena are opened, it was taught as the cause for generating the cognition that knows the characteristics and the basis of characteristics of conditioned phenomena in order to present the system of conventional truth.

original: de la mi mkhas pa dag dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mi mkhas pa dag dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the way in which the unwise cling to things as real, it was said:

original: mi shes pa blo gros kyi mig zum pa rnams ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams skye'o gnas so 'gag go zhes yang dag pa'i don gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mi shes pa blo gros kyi mig zum pa rnams ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams skye'o gnas so 'gag go zhes yang dag pa'i don gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are closed due to ignorance, like those in dreams and so on, generate manifest pride in the meaning of reality, saying, ‚ÄúThings arise, endure, and cease.‚Äù

original: so so'i skye bo chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mi shes pa blo gros kyi mig zum pa rnams ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mi shes pa blo gros kyi mig zum pa rnams ni /
translated: Those ordinary beings whose eyes of intelligence are closed due to ignorance of the thatness of phenomena

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa bka' stsal pa de dag la dper na gnyid log pa rmi lam na bden par 'dzin pa dang / sgyu ma dang dri @150b za'i grong khyer gyi rgyus mi shes pa dag de dag la dngos por mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du 'du byed rnams don dam par yang skye'o gnas so 'gag go zhes yang dag pa'i don gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa bka' stsal pa de dag la dper na gnyid log pa rmi lam na bden par 'dzin pa dang / sgyu ma dang dri @150b za'i grong khyer gyi rgyus mi shes pa dag de dag la dngos por mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du 'du byed rnams don dam par yang skye'o gnas so 'gag go zhes yang dag pa'i don gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed
translated: generate manifest pride in the meaning of reality, saying, ‚ÄúThe arising, enduring, and ceasing of compounded phenomena that the Bhagavat taught are things that exist ultimately,‚Äù just as those who are asleep and cling to dreams as real and those who do not understand the nature of illusions and the cities of gandharvas cling to them as real.

original: do // de'i phyir de ltar mkhas pa dang mkhas pa ma yin pa dag gi tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes bya
analyzed: do // de'i phyir de ltar mkhas pa dang mkhas pa ma yin pa dag gi tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes bya
translated: Therefore, in this way, since arising and so on are accepted as existing in dependence on the conventions of the learned and the unlearned, the faults of the nonestablishment of the position, reason, and example, and so on, do not arise.

original: ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is the summary.

original: ci ltar rmi lam mthong ba dang / sgyu ma byas pa dang / dri za'i grong khyer dag skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig par brjod kyang de dag la skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig pa ci yang med pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag bka' stsal
analyzed: ci ltar rmi lam mthong ba dang / sgyu ma byas pa dang / dri za'i grong khyer dag skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig par brjod kyang de dag la skyes pa dang gnas pa dang zhig pa ci yang med pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag bka' stsal
translated: Just as when seeing a dream, a magical illusion, or a gandharva city, one says that they arise, endure, and are destroyed, but they have no arising, enduring, or destruction at all, in the same way, although the Blessed One has said that conditioned phenomena arise, endure, and are destroyed,

original: mod kyi 'on kyang de dag la skyed par byed pa dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: mod kyi 'on kyang de dag la skyed par byed pa dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa ci yang med do //
translated: nevertheless, there is nothing that causes their arising, enduring, or destruction.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu bden pa'i lugs rnam par bzhag pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams la tha snyad kyi dbang gis bka' stsal par yang khas len la /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu bden pa'i lugs rnam par bzhag pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams la tha snyad kyi dbang gis bka' stsal par yang khas len la /
translated: However, because the system of the truth of the relative is posited, the learned accept that the Buddha spoke in terms of the power of convention.

original: mi mkhas pa dag de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyod par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du yang khas len pa de'i phyir kho bo cag dbu ma pa la kun rdzob tu phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon med do 'di laüîΩkha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa gsum po dag bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum bstan to zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gsung rab 'di la rmi lam la sogs pa
analyzed: mi mkhas pa dag de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyod par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du yang khas len pa de'i phyir kho bo cag dbu ma pa la kun rdzob tu phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon med do 'di la kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa gsum po dag bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum bstan to zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gsung rab 'di la rmi lam la sogs pa
translated: And because the unwise are caused to generate pride in that, the Followers of the Middle Way accept it. Therefore, for us Followers of the Middle Way, there is no fault of our positions, reasons, examples, and so on not being established in the relative.üîΩSome say that the three examples of dreams and so on are taught in order to show that the three types of conceptions are the causes for the occurrence of the afflictions.

original: dpe gsum gsungs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: dpe gsum gsungs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: In this scripture, the three examples of dreams and so on are taught. Why are they taught?

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa'i rgyu yul yod par smra ba dag gis phyi rol gyi don yin par brtags pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa'i rgyu yul yod par smra ba dag gis phyi rol gyi don yin par brtags pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: Some proponents of consciousness only say: The cause of the engagement of the afflictions is not the object that is imputed to be an external object by those who say objects exist.üîΩThe three other conceptual thoughts are the imputed, dependent and real natures.

original: de las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa gsum po kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa dag yin pas rnam par rtog pa gsum po de dag bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba dpe gsumüîΩpo dag go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes zer te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa gsum po kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa dag yin pas rnam par rtog pa gsum po de dag bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes zer te /
translated: The three examples of dreams, illusions and gandharva cities are taught in order to illustrate those three conceptual thoughts.

original: de dag na re ci ltar rmi lam rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang chos dang chos ma yin pa dang lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyu can yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'i @151a * //
analyzed: de dag na re ci ltar rmi lam rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang chos dang chos ma yin pa dang lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyu can yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'i @151a * //
translated: They say: Just as one remembers the experience of an imputed dream, one remembers the experience of an object that is imputed to be an external object.

original: 'bras bu dang ldan pa brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba la kun brtags pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du phyi rol
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ldan pa brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba la kun brtags pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du phyi rol
translated: When the result is examined, it is devoid of intrinsic reality, but it is an object by the mere fact of being the cause of the cognition that it exists conventionally, and so on.üîΩIn the same way, even without external objects, the occurrence of the engagement of the afflictions arises by the power of imagination, due to the superimposition of the imagined, which is the conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders that arises from the cause of the accumulation of the latent propensities of conceptualization in the foundation consciousness.

original: gyi don med par yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la spros pa'i bag chags bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par sgro btags shing kun brtags pa rmi lam lta bu la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kyang
analyzed: gyi don med par yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la spros pa'i bag chags bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par sgro btags shing kun brtags pa rmi lam lta bu la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kyang
translated: The occurrence of the engagement of the afflictions arises by the power of strong adherence to the imagined, which is like a dream.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩci ltar sgyu ma sgyu ma mkhan dang gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthu khyad par can las /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩci ltar sgyu ma sgyu ma mkhan dang gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthu khyad par can las /
translated: How is it that the engagement of the afflictions arises from the imagined?

original: glang po che dang khyu mchog dang bud med dang gnas la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du byung ba dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag ngo bo nyid med kyang shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod pa sgyu ma'i rgyu gzhan gyiüîΩdbang gis byung ba la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos
analyzed: glang po che dang khyu mchog dang bud med dang gnas la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du byung ba dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag ngo bo nyid med kyang shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod pa sgyu ma'i rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos
translated: The objects that appear as the nature of an elephant, a bull, a woman, a house, and so on, which are the domain of the senses, are not intrinsically real, but they are said to exist because they are the cause of mistaken consciousness.üîΩJust as the arising of the process of affliction occurs due to the power of clinging to the arising of the illusory objects that are dependent on other conditions,

original: rgyu'i rkyen kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang can sgyu ma lta bu la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang can sgyu ma lta bu la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, the arising of the process of affliction occurs due to the power of clinging to the dependent origination of the characteristics of compounded phenomena, such as name and form, which appear as the aspects of the apprehended and the apprehender,üîΩthe causal condition of which is the illusion-like dependent nature, the foundation consciousness.

original: ci ltar dri za'i grong khyer 'obs rgya chen po dang sgo dang sgo khang dang yang thog dkar po dga' ba 'tsher bag can dang khyams zla ba can dang skar khung dang khang pa brtsegs ma dang ldan pa'i grong khyer gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu nam mkha' laüîΩyongs su grub pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs shing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i dus na /
analyzed: ci ltar dri za'i grong khyer 'obs rgya chen po dang sgo dang sgo khang dang yang thog dkar po dga' ba 'tsher bag can dang khyams zla ba can dang skar khung dang khang pa brtsegs ma dang ldan pa'i grong khyer gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu nam mkha' la yongs su grub pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs shing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i dus na /
translated: Just as a gandharva city arises as the cause of the cognition of a city with a wide moat, doors, door frames, white upper stories, delightful and radiant terraces, moonlike courtyards, windows, and multistoried buildings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang dri za'i grong khyer lta bu la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang dri za'i grong khyer lta bu la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: in the same way, when the ƒÅlaya consciousness is transformed, the entry of affliction arises through the power of clinging to the perfected nature of the body of a tathƒÅgata adorned with the major and minor marks, just as the entry of affliction arises through the power of clinging to a gandharva city.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag dgag pa dang dpe gsum po bstan pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩgzhan dag na re pha rol pos skye @151b ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag dgag pa dang dpe gsum po bstan pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / gzhan dag na re pha rol pos skye @151b ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the verses that refute those statements and present the three examples in a different way, the author of the commentary says:üîΩOthers say that arising and so on do exist because they are the objects of the mind of direct perception, because the agent exists, and because they are apprehended by an unbroken continuum, just as form is.

original: mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dang / rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes smras pa de dag ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dang / rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes smras pa de dag ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that those statements are not definitive, the three examples of dreams and so on are stated in order.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Others say means the author of the commentary himself.

original: des na slob dpon legs ldan byed nyid na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na slob dpon legs ldan byed nyid na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the master BhƒÅviveka himself says this.

original: 'di la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po dag la mngon par zhen pa yin pas pha rol po 'di dag na re skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩmngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ba ni rjes su dpag pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po dag la mngon par zhen pa yin pas pha rol po 'di dag na re skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te / mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ba ni rjes su dpag pa gcig yin no //
translated: All adversaries are attached to the three characteristics of conditioned states.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩbyed pa po yod pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ba ni rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te / byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ba ni rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The first inference of the opponent is: ‚ÄúArising, etc., definitely exist because they are the objects of a direct perception, like form.‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The second inference of the opponent is: ‚ÄúArising, etc., definitely exist because an agent exists, like form.‚Äù

original: rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ba ni rjes su dpag pa gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ba ni rjes su dpag pa gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third inference of the opponent is: ‚ÄúArising, etc., definitely exist because they are apprehended by a continuum that is not a different type, like form.‚Äù

original: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na gzugs ni mig la sogs pa mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po zhes tha snyad gdags pa rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyi rgyud tha mi dad pas spyi mthun du 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang mig la sogs pa mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na gzugs ni mig la sogs pa mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po zhes tha snyad gdags pa rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyi rgyud tha mi dad pas spyi mthun du 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang mig la sogs pa mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The inferences are applied in order to the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, form exists because it is perceived by the eye consciousness and so on, because the expression ‚Äúthe agent‚Äù is designated due to the existence of causes and conditions, and because it is apprehended as a shared object due to the continuity of sentient beings being undifferentiated.

original: byed pa po zhes tha snyad gdags pa rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyi rgyud tha mi dad pas spyi mthun du 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes tha snyad gdags pa rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnams kyi rgyud tha mi dad pas spyi mthun du 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, arising and so on exist because they are perceived by the eye consciousness and so on, because the expression ‚Äúthe agent‚Äù is designated due to the existence of causes and conditions, and because they are apprehended as a shared object due to the continuity of sentient beings being undifferentiated.

original: pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsum po de dag gi gtan tshigs de gsum ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsum po de dag gi gtan tshigs de gsum ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: The master has stated the three examples of dreams, etc., in order to show that the three reasons in those three inferences stated by the opponent are not established.

original: 'jig rten na rmi lam yang yid la sogs pa'i mngon sum gyi blo'i @152a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rmi lam yang yid la sogs pa'i mngon sum gyi blo'i @152a * //
translated: In the world, a dream is seen to be the object of a mind of direct perception such as mental consciousness.

original: gzung ba yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: gzung ba yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin nam /
translated: Therefore, is it that arising, etc., exist, because they are the objects of a mind of direct perception, like form?

original: 'on te mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rmi lam bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang po ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyi blo'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rmi lam bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang po ma grub bo //
translated: Or, is it that arising, etc., do not exist, because they are the objects of a mind of direct perception, like a dream? Since it is not definite, the first inference stated by the opponent is not established.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten na sgyu ma la yang byed pa po sgyu ma mkhan dang rgyu rkyen dag yod par mthong bas des na ci re zhig byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten na sgyu ma la yang byed pa po sgyu ma mkhan dang rgyu rkyen dag yod par mthong bas des na ci re zhig byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin
translated: So too, in the world, since a magician and his causes and conditions are seen to exist for an illusion, what is the point of saying that because the agent exists, arising, etc. exist, like form, for example?üîΩOr, because the agent exists, arising, etc. do not exist, like an illusion, for example?

original: nam / 'on te byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: nam / 'on te byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa ma grub bo //
translated: Since it is uncertain, the second reductio the opponent urges is not established.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten na dri za'i grong khyer yang rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten na dri za'i grong khyer yang rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin nam /
translated: So too, in the world, since a gandharva city is seen to be apprehended by a nondifferent mindstream, what is the point of saying that because it is apprehended by a nondifferent mindstream, arising, etc. exist, like form, for example?

original: 'on te rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pa kho nar gyur pa ma nges pas pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsum pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pa kho nar gyur pa ma nges pas pha rol pos smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsum pa ma grub ste /
translated: Since this is not ascertained, the third inference of the opponent is not established.

original: re zhig de dag ni rig pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa sun byung nas don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du yod par khas blangs par bstan pa yin no
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni rig pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa sun byung nas don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du yod par khas blangs par bstan pa yin no
translated: Having refuted the opponent‚Äôs proofs through reasoning, Candrakƒ´rti now teaches that ultimately arising and so on do not exist inherently but are accepted as existing conventionally, like dreams and so on.

original: // da ni de nyid theg pa che chung gi tshad mas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: // da ni de nyid theg pa che chung gi tshad mas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now he will establish this through the valid knowledge of the Great and Lesser vehicles.

original: de la re zhig theg pa chung ngu'i lung gi tshad mas bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig theg pa chung ngu'i lung gi tshad mas bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, in order to demonstrate the establishment through the valid knowledge of scripture of the Lesser Vehicle, he says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyan thos kyi theg pa la bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyan thos kyi theg pa la bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle that although the self and entities connected to the self are not real, they appear that way.

original: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Feelings are like water bubbles,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: Perceptions are like mirages,

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
translated: Formations are like banana trees,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //üîΩde nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes // de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //
translated: And consciousness is like an illusion.

original: zhes gsungs la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This was said by the one who sees reality.üîΩIn the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, although all phenomena are ultimately without a self and entities connected to the self, they appear in the form of a self and entities connected to the self.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la don dam par chos thams cad gang zag bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin @152b yang kun rdzob tu bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa da ltar snang ba'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la don dam par chos thams cad gang zag bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin @152b yang kun rdzob tu bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa da ltar snang ba'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa
translated: Therefore, one should not cling to them as real.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par 'gyur bas de'i gnyen por phung po dag dbu ba rdos pa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par 'gyur bas de'i gnyen por phung po dag dbu ba rdos pa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Since it would be an affliction-obscuration, the antidote to that is stated as: ‚ÄúThe aggregates are like a mass of foam, etc.‚Äù

original: don dam par gang zag bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu dbu ba rdos pa la sogs pa dang 'dra ba tsam du khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par gang zag bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu dbu ba rdos pa la sogs pa dang 'dra ba tsam du khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the self and the intrinsic reality of the person are ultimately non-existent, and conventionally, they should be accepted as merely like a mass of foam, etc.

original: de la / gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: de la / gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam

original: zhes bya ba ni brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot withstand analysis.

original: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Sensation is like a water bubble

original: zhes bya ba ni byung nas 'jig cing med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byung nas 'jig cing med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises and disintegrates.

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: Ideation is like a mirage

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par sgro gtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par sgro gtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a misapprehension.

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
translated: Conditioning factors are like a plantain tree

original: zhes bya ba ni snying po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an essence is not observed.

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature is not perceived.

original: de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //
translated: The one who sees reality has declared

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is to say, the Bhagavan Buddha has declared.

original: kha cig las ni nyi ma'i gnyen kyis  bka' stsal to zhes kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig las ni nyi ma'i gnyen kyis  bka' stsal to zhes kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: In some sources, it is said that the kinsman of the sun has declared.

original: theg pa chen po'i lung gi tshad mas bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lung gi tshad mas bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the proof by the valid cognition of scriptural transmission of the Mahayana,

original: theg pa chen po la yang 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang de ltar snang zhing de ltar bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang de ltar snang zhing de ltar bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por /
translated: it says in the Mahayana also, although conditioned things are essenceless, they appear that way and are taught that way, as antidotes to the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩLike a star, a cataract, a lamp,üîΩan illusion, a dewdrop, a water bubble,

original: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur //
analyzed: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur //
translated: a dream, a flash of lightning, and a cloud,

original: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
analyzed: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
translated: conditioned things should be seen.

original: zhes gsungs pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: theg pa chen po la don dam par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa de ltar snang zhing don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs
analyzed: theg pa chen po la don dam par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa de ltar snang zhing don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs
translated: In the Mahayana, although all phenomena are ultimately natureless, conventionally they appear in the aspect of having a nature like an illusion and so on. Although ultimately they are natureless, conventionally they appear as mere natures like an illusion and so on.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam du snang ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib par 'gyur bas de'i gnyen por 'dus byas thams cad skar ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs pas don dam par ngo bo
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam du snang ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib par 'gyur bas de'i gnyen por 'dus byas thams cad skar ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs pas don dam par ngo bo
translated: In order to teach this, the statement ‚ÄúAll conditioned phenomena are like a star and so on‚Äù is made as an antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience that arise from clinging to them.

original: nyid med pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu skar ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba tsam du khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyid med pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu skar ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba tsam du khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore it teaches that ultimately they are natureless and that conventionally they should be accepted as mere natures like a star and so on.

original: de la / skar ma rab rib mar me dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: de la / skar ma rab rib mar me dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: The four aspects of the characteristic of the conditioned are indicated by this verse, beginning with ‚Äúlike a star, a cataract, a lamp,‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / @153a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / @153a * //
translated: the characteristic of intrinsic nature,

original: ro myong ba'i yul gyi mtshan nyid dang / nyes dmigs rjes su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ro myong ba'i yul gyi mtshan nyid dang / nyes dmigs rjes su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the object of experience, the characteristic of the realization of the disadvantage, and the characteristic of the realization of the escape.

original: de la phung po lnga'i bdag nyid dngos po ci ltar snang ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs pas byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga'i bdag nyid dngos po ci ltar snang ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs pas byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
translated: The appearance of things, which is the nature of the five aggregates, is called ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù because it is created by the aggregation of causes and conditions.

original: de dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of intrinsic nature of all of them is

original: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // zhes bya ba dpe gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // zhes bya ba dpe gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: indicated by the three examples, ‚Äúlike a star, a cataract, a lamp.‚Äù

original: skar ma zhes bya bas ni ci ltar skar ma rnams mtshan mo snang bar 'gyur gyi nyin mo mi snang bar de bzhin du 'dus byas 'di yang ma rig pa'i nyes pa'i mun pa yod na snang gi ye shes kyi nyi ma'i snang ba 'byung ba na mi
analyzed: skar ma zhes bya bas ni ci ltar skar ma rnams mtshan mo snang bar 'gyur gyi nyin mo mi snang bar de bzhin du 'dus byas 'di yang ma rig pa'i nyes pa'i mun pa yod na snang gi ye shes kyi nyi ma'i snang ba 'byung ba na mi
translated: The word ‚Äústar‚Äù indicates that just as stars shine at night but do not shine during the day, so also this conditioned world is seen when the darkness of the fault of nescience is present, but is not seen when the light of the sun of intuition arises.

original: snang bas skar ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang bas skar ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should see the nature of conditioned things as like a star.

original: rab rib ces bya bas ni gang zag dang chos su lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dus byas ni don med par snang ba'i rgyus rab rib lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab rib ces bya bas ni gang zag dang chos su lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dus byas ni don med par snang ba'i rgyus rab rib lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcataract‚Äù indicates that the nature of conditioned things, which is the adherence to the views of personality and substantiality, should be seen as like a cataract, because it is the cause of seeing unreal things.

original: mar me zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni las kyi ras dang sred pa'i snum la brten te skye zhing 'bar bas mar me lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar me zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni las kyi ras dang sred pa'i snum la brten te skye zhing 'bar bas mar me lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúlamp‚Äù indicates that the characteristic of consciousness arises and shines forth in dependence on the wick of action and the oil of craving, and thus it should be seen as like a lamp.

original: ro myong ba'i yul kyi  mtshan nyid ni sgyu ma'i dpes bstan te /
analyzed: ro myong ba'i yul kyi  mtshan nyid ni sgyu ma'i dpes bstan te /
translated: The characteristic of the object of the experience of pleasure is indicated by the example of a magical creation.

original: nor ba'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor ba'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears as a false object.

original: nyes dmigs rjes su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes dmigs rjes su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic of the realization of the disadvantages is twofold:

original: mi rtag par rjes su rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal bar rjes su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag par rjes su rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal bar rjes su rtogs pa'o //
translated: the realization of impermanence and the realization of suffering.

original: de la zil pa'i dpes ni mi rtag par rjes su rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la zil pa'i dpes ni mi rtag par rjes su rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of the dew illustrates the realization of impermanence,

original: yun ring du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not last long.

original: chu bur gyi dpes ni sdug bsngal bar rjes su rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: chu bur gyi dpes ni sdug bsngal bar rjes su rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of the bubble illustrates the realization of suffering,

original: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu yin la tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu yin la tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because feeling is like a water bubble, and whatever feeling there is, that is suffering here.

original: tshor ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal du rig par bya ste /
translated: All feeling should be known as the suffering of the three kinds of suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / gang dag de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed de dag ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / gang dag de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed de dag ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The feeling of suffering and the formative forces that are associated with it are the suffering of suffering.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / gang dag de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed de dag ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / gang dag de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed de dag ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Pleasant feeling and the formative forces that are associated with it are suffering because of the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / gang dag de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed de dag ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / gang dag de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed de dag ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling and the formative forces that are associated with it are suffering because of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs @153b pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang zag dang chos stong par rjes su rtogs pa'i dmigs pa des nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs @153b pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang zag dang chos stong par rjes su rtogs pa'i dmigs pa des nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the realization of the means of deliverance refers to the means of deliverance which is the objective support for the realization of the emptiness of the personal entity and of the dharmas.

original: rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur //
analyzed: rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur //
translated: Like a dream, a flash of lightning, a cloud.

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the three examples.

original: de la rmi lam gyi dpes ni 'das pa'i 'dus byas de dag bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis su rjes su rtogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi dpes ni 'das pa'i 'dus byas de dag bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis su rjes su rtogs pa bstan to //
translated: The example of the dream indicates the realization of the past formative forces as being devoid of the two kinds of self.

original: glog gi dpes ni da ltar byung ba rnams gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang mi ldan pas rang bzhin gzung du med pa'i phyir bdag med pa gnyis po de rjes su rtogs pa bstan to //üîΩsprin gyi dpes ni de'i sa bon gnas ngan len ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid sprin lta bus sems nam mkha' lta bu la 'bras bu skyed pa rnams gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang mi ldan pas rang bzhin gzung du med pa'i phyir bdag med pa gnyis po
analyzed: glog gi dpes ni da ltar byung ba rnams gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang mi ldan pas rang bzhin gzung du med pa'i phyir bdag med pa gnyis po de rjes su rtogs pa bstan to // sprin gyi dpes ni de'i sa bon gnas ngan len ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid sprin lta bus sems nam mkha' lta bu la 'bras bu skyed pa rnams gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang mi ldan pas rang bzhin gzung du med pa'i phyir bdag med pa gnyis po
translated: The example of the lightning bolt shows that one should realize the two kinds of no-self by the fact that present things, being neither one nor many, have no apprehended nature.

original: de rjes su rtogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de rjes su rtogs pa bstan to //
translated: The example of the cloud shows that one should realize the two kinds of no-self by the fact that the seeds of that, the negative tendencies, which are like clouds, produce results in the sky of the mind, and are neither one nor many and so have no apprehended nature.

original: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
analyzed: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
translated: One should see conditioned things in this way.

original: zhes bya bas ni dpe rnam pa dgu po de dag gis mtshon pa'i don gyi dngos po bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dpe rnam pa dgu po de dag gis mtshon pa'i don gyi dngos po bstan te /
translated: This shows the actual meaning illustrated by the nine examples.

original: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid dngos po ci ltar snang ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs pas byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid dngos po ci ltar snang ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs pas byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
translated: The five aggregates, the nature of which is to appear as things, are dependently arisen, and are called ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù because they are produced by the aggregation of causes and conditions.

original: 'dus byas thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa de ltar blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa de ltar blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The characteristics of all conditioned things should be seen in this way.

original: de dag gis ni 'di la byang chub sems dpas rtag tu 'dus byas thams cad rang bzhin de ltar brtag pa la 'dun pa dang / smon lam gyis gnas par bya ba dang / rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di la byang chub sems dpas rtag tu 'dus byas thams cad rang bzhin de ltar brtag pa la 'dun pa dang / smon lam gyis gnas par bya ba dang / rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba dang /
translated: These passages show that bodhisattvas should always be intent on investigating the nature of all conditioned things in this way, that they should be established in it by means of aspirational prayers, that they should accomplish it by means of meditative concentration,

original: g-yeng ba tshar gcad nas sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus mtha' dag rnam par 'jog pas zab pa dang rgya che ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: g-yeng ba tshar gcad nas sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus mtha' dag rnam par 'jog pas zab pa dang rgya che ba yang bstan to //
translated: that they should control their minds by eliminating distractions, and that they should be profound and vast by means of the complete arrangement of the body of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir 'di la skrag pa'i gnas med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la skrag pa'i gnas med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no basis for fear in this.

original: blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags nas bzod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa yin te /üîΩde ltar rigs pa dang lung gi tshad mas ci skad bstan pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gsung rab dang dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la kun rdzob tu yang bdag dang chos su nye bar gdags pa'i dngos po thams cad med do snyam du sems pa'iüîΩskrag pa'i gnas med do //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags nas bzod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa yin te / de ltar rigs pa dang lung gi tshad mas ci skad bstan pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gsung rab dang dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la kun rdzob tu yang bdag dang chos su nye bar gdags pa'i dngos po thams cad med do snyam du sems pa'i skrag pa'i gnas med do //
translated: This is the conclusion and the exhortation to take it up.

original: blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis kun rdzob tu bdag dang chos su nye bar gdags pa'i gzhi 'dus byas kyi skye ba la @154a * //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis kun rdzob tu bdag dang chos su nye bar gdags pa'i gzhi 'dus byas kyi skye ba la @154a * //
translated: Thus, because of the valid cognitions of reasoning and scripture, there is no basis for fear that in this treatise of the middle way, the scriptures of the Tathagata, all things that are the bases of the conventional designations of self and phenomena do not exist even conventionally.üîΩThe wise should generate patience after thorough investigation.

original: sogs pa dag rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du tha snyad gdags su yod pa dang / don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yongs su brtags nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab dang dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la bzod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes slob dpon legs ldan byed nyid de skad ces zer ro //
analyzed: sogs pa dag rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du tha snyad gdags su yod pa dang / don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yongs su brtags nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab dang dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la bzod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes slob dpon legs ldan byed nyid de skad ces zer ro //
translated: This is what the master Bhavaviveka himself says.

original: gzhan dag na re bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams bdag med pa'i dper sgyu ma dang brag ca dang gzugs brnyan dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang dbu brdos pa dang chu'i chu bur dang chu shing gi phung po dag bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams bdag med pa'i dper sgyu ma dang brag ca dang gzugs brnyan dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang dbu brdos pa dang chu'i chu bur dang chu shing gi phung po dag bstan te /
translated: Others say that the Lord taught that magical illusions, echoes, reflections, mirages, dreams, the circle made by swinging a glowing ember, water bubbles, and masses of plantain trees are examples of the selflessness of compounded phenomena.

original: 'di la de bzhin nyid dam ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ni 'ga' yang med kyi 'di dag ni spros pa yang yin la 'di dag ni brdzun pa yang yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin nyid dam ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ni 'ga' yang med kyi 'di dag ni spros pa yang yin la 'di dag ni brdzun pa yang yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: He also said that in these there is no such thing as reality or unerring reality, and that these are conceptual elaborations and also false.

original: chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bya ba la bdag med bzhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bya ba la bdag med bzhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don te /

translated: The master Buddhapalita explains the meaning of the root text in this way.üîΩThe master Bhavaviveka criticizes that explanation in this way.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita says that the three characteristics such as arising are like the three examples such as dreams.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita explains the meaning of the root text in this way.

translated: The master Bhavaviveka criticizes that explanation in this way.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita says that the three characteristics such as arising are like the three examples such as dreams.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita explains the meaning of the root text in this way.üîΩThe master Bhavaviveka criticizes that explanation in this way.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita says that the three characteristics such as arising are like the three examples such as dreams.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita explains the meaning of the root text in this way.üîΩThe master Bhavaviveka criticizes that explanation in this way.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita says that the three characteristics such as arising are like the three examples such as dreams.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita explains the meaning of the root text in this way.üîΩThe master Bhavaviveka criticizes that explanation in this way.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita says that the three characteristics such as arising are like the three examples such as dreams.üîΩThe master Buddhapalita explains the meaning of the root text in this way.

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de la 'dir bdag tu snang ba ni nor ba'i de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag ces bya ba'i sgra yang bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir de dag la bdag gzhan yang med la rang nyid kyang ma yin te /

original: dbang phyug ma yin pa bzhin pas khungs des ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la gang zag bdag med pa'i sgra'i don bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid bstan par mi nus so //

analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
