original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: Form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither conditioned nor unconditioned.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa ni skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin /üîΩ'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa ni skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin / 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin no //
translated: Form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither phenomena that arise nor phenomena that cease.üîΩForm, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither phenomena that arise nor phenomena that cease.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas med de byis pa rmongs pa rnams ni mo gsham gyis rmi lam na bu mthong ba de bzhin du 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas med de byis pa rmongs pa rnams ni mo gsham gyis rmi lam na bu mthong ba de bzhin du 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs
translated: and ‚Äúapart from conceptualization, there is no compounded or uncompounded, but fools, being ignorant, apprehend the compounded and uncompounded as if they were like a son of a barren woman seen in a dream.‚Äù

original: pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚Äúthose proofs are established.‚Äù

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
translated: Thus, the quality of the teaching that compounded phenomena are essenceless is that those scriptures that inspire confidence are established.

original: de'i phyir kho bo rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyi 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyi 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, I do not teach that compounded phenomena are essenceless through mere dry sophistry.

original: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do //
translated: For, those scriptures exist.

original: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag 'dir bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis
analyzed: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag 'dir bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis
translated: The master‚Äôs own words:

original: mkhyen rlabs yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mkhyen rlabs yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The waves of his knowledge.üîΩThis concludes the commentary on the seventh chapter, the ‚ÄúExamination of Arising, Enduring, and Ceasing,‚Äù in the root text of the Lamp of Wisdom, Fundamental Wisdom.

original: rab tu byed pa bdun pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye @156a * //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bdun pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye @156a * //
translated: This commentary was composed by the master Avalokitavrata.

original: bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: It is complete.

original: // / bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
translated: CHAPTER EIGHTüîΩExamination of the Prior Entity

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eighth chapter is begun for the sake of the meaning of the teaching of the lack of own-being of the aggregates, etc., by the refutation of the special adverse condition of emptiness.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúsake‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúfor the sake of the meaning‚Äù should be regarded here as having the sense of cause in the sense of commitment, and as having the sense of connection with the text that will follow.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of the sense of cause in the sense of commitment,

original: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, the refutation of the special adverse condition of emptiness is stated.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byasüîΩnas de skad smras te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Since the treatise author, in the first chapter of the Treatise on the Middle Way, sets forth the thesis that all things are unarisen, here he speaks from the perspective of the reason for engaging in that thesis, just as it was set forth by the treatise author.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is his position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The position of the opponent, who is not in accord with that, is

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩphung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: as follows.üîΩThe opponent asserts that the aggregates, constituents, and bases exist inherently.üîΩThe ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs presentation of the prior position that the aggregates, constituents, and bases exist.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is presented below in the lines: ‚ÄúUltimately, the aggregates, constituents, and bases do exist.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas /üîΩbyed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩgzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas / byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro // gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, in dependence on those,üîΩtaught the agent and action.üîΩThe refutation of those is as follows:üîΩIn consideration of the refutation of those, the eighth chapter is begun.üîΩIn consideration of the meaning of the text that will be explained below, it is said that the eighth chapter is begun in consideration of the meaning of the teaching of the essencelessness of the aggregates and so on.

original: byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad ces smras so //
translated: The meaning of the text of the eighth chapter, the analysis of the agent and action, that will be explained below is the teaching of the essencelessness of the aggregates and so on. Therefore, it is said in consideration of that.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de thob ce na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de thob ce na /
translated: What is the result of this chapter? By what process is that result attained?

original: phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med @156b pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med @156b pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching of the realitylessness of such things as the aggregates is the result of this chapter.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
translated: And that result is attained by the process of refuting the special resistances to emptiness.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary first teaches the result of the means and the means in this introductory section of the chapter.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúHere someone might say,‚Äù etc.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag de ltar bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag de ltar bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Although the aggregates, elements, and sense bases have been refuted in this way, those of our own faction who are attached to them will not tolerate that.

original: de'i phyir don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, they say, ‚ÄúThe aggregates, elements, and sense bases certainly exist ultimately,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: because the BhagavƒÅn taught the agent and action in dependence on them.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are the subject, the property to be established, and the establishing property, respectively.

original: 'di na gang med pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn did not teach the agent and action in dependence on that which does not exist.üîΩFor example, it is like the tail of a donkey or the horn of a rabbit.

original: dper na bong bu dang rnga mo'i rva dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na bong bu dang rnga mo'i rva dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar class.

original: phung po la sogs pa dag la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa 'di yod de /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa 'di yod de /
translated: The Lord has taught the agent and action in dependence on the aggregates, etc.

original: legs par spyad pa'i chos spyad bya //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i chos spyad bya //
translated: One should practice the Dharma of good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa de mi spyad //üîΩchos spyod 'jig rten 'di dang ni //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa de mi spyad // chos spyod 'jig rten 'di dang ni //
translated: One should not practice bad conduct.üîΩOne who practices the Dharma dwells happily

original: pha rol du yang bde bar gnas //
analyzed: pha rol du yang bde bar gnas //
translated: in this world and the next.

original: zhes byed pa po dang las kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes byed pa po dang las kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: This is the application of the analogy.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og mas ni byed pa po bstan la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og mas ni byed pa po bstan la /
translated: The second half of the verse teaches the agent,

original: phyed gong mas ni las bstan to //
analyzed: phyed gong mas ni las bstan to //
translated: and the first half teaches the action.

original: las bstan pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir de la chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: las bstan pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir de la chos mngon pa las /
translated: In order to explain the characteristics of the action that has been taught, the Abhidharma states:

original: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúAction is threefold by the categories of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.‚Äù

original: de la dge ba yang ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas blang ba dang don dam pa ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o nyes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de la dge ba yang ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas blang ba dang don dam pa ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o nyes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las /
translated: Virtue is fourfold: virtue by nature, virtue concomitant with that, virtue that is adopted, and virtue that is ultimate.üîΩThe Abhidharmako≈õa states,

original: don dam dge ba thar ba ste //
analyzed: don dam dge ba thar ba ste //
translated: Ultimate virtue is liberation.

original: ngo bo rtsa ba ngo tsha khrel //
analyzed: ngo bo rtsa ba ngo tsha khrel //
translated: By nature, it is the roots of virtue, shame, and embarrassment.

original: mtshungs ldan de dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan de dang ldan pa ste //
translated: Concomitant virtue is possessing that.

original: kun nas bslang ba bya la sogs //üîΩzhes bya bas ngo bo nyid kyis @157a * //
analyzed: kun nas bslang ba bya la sogs // zhes bya bas ngo bo nyid kyis @157a * //
translated: Adopted virtue is action and so on.

original: 'phrod pa'i sman dang / de dang ldan pa'i sman khu dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i sman mar la sogs pa'i dpes ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sags pa gsum pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrod pa'i sman dang / de dang ldan pa'i sman khu dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i sman mar la sogs pa'i dpes ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sags pa gsum pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //
translated: Virtue by nature is the three roots of virtue such as nonattachment and so on, shame hri and embarrassment apatrapa.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i dge ba ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i dge ba ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Concomitant virtue is mental factors that are concomitant with those.üîΩAdopted virtue is action and so on.

original: kun nas bslang ba'i dge ba ni de dag gis kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas bslang ba'i dge ba ni de dag gis kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams so //
translated: Virtue that is instigated is the actions of body, speech, and mind instigated by those.

original: don dam pa pa'i dge ba ni thar pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i dge ba ni thar pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Liberation is the ultimate virtue.

original: mi dge ba yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba dang / 'khor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba dang / 'khor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Nonvirtue is also of four types, by way of its nature, concomitance, instigation, and samsaric existence.

original: 'khor ba'i mi dge ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pa thams cad de log par lta ba la sogs pa 'khor ba pa'i mi dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mi dge ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pa thams cad de log par lta ba la sogs pa 'khor ba pa'i mi dge ba rnams so //
translated: Samsaric nonvirtue is all that is included in samsara, such as wrong views and so on.üîΩNeutral states are of four types: those arisen from karmic maturation, those arisen from deportment, those arisen from craftsmanship, and those arisen from emanation.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang spyod lam las byung ba dang bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang sprul pa las byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o zhes 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang spyod lam las byung ba dang bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang sprul pa las byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o zhes 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las
translated: The four types of neutral states are those arisen from karmic maturation, those arisen from deportment, those arisen from craftsmanship, and those arisen from emanation.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba las skyes pa'i 'bras bu dang / spyod lam byed pa las byung ba'i sems dang / bzo'i gnas byed pa las byung ba'i sems dang / sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'i sems dag ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba las skyes pa'i 'bras bu dang / spyod lam byed pa las byung ba'i sems dang / bzo'i gnas byed pa las byung ba'i sems dang / sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'i sems dag ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The result born from the cause of karmic maturation, the mind arisen from the cause of deportment, the mind arisen from the cause of craftsmanship, and the mind arisen from the cause of emanation are neutral.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the reason stated, it is concluded that the aggregates, elements, and bases exist ultimately. This is the result of the valid knowledge.

original: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyis bong bu'i rva la sogs pa med pa gang dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gang dag la
analyzed: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyis bong bu'i rva la sogs pa med pa gang dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gang dag la
translated: Here the BhagavƒÅn did not teach an agent and action in dependence on nonexistents such as the horns of a donkey, but he did teach them in dependence on the aggregates, elements, and bases.

original: brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The agent and action are taught in dependence, and they exist ultimately.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir gal te don dam par de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dod na ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dir gal te don dam par de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dod na ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Here, if you assert the reason, ‚Äúbecause the agent and action are taught in dependence on them ultimately,‚Äù then it is not established.

original: 'on te dbyug pas ma bzlog pa'i phyir tha snyad du 'dor na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dbyug pas ma bzlog pa'i phyir tha snyad du 'dor na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: But if you assert it conventionally because it is not refuted by a stick, then it is contradictory and it is an establishment of what is already established.

original: @157b bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan to zhes byar yang dpe med de /
analyzed: @157b bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan to zhes byar yang dpe med de /
translated: And there is no example of the statement, ‚ÄúThe Blessed One taught the agent and action in dependence on them ultimately.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because in that way, ultimately, there are no things.

original: de'i phyir ci ltar de dag mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste 'di la byed pa po de yang yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar de dag mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste 'di la byed pa po de yang yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: In this regard, the agent would be one who is already existent,

original: ma yin par gyur pa'am /üîΩyin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa zhig las byed par 'gyur zhing las kyang yin par gyur pa'am ma yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ma yin par gyur pa'am / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa zhig las byed par 'gyur zhing las kyang yin par gyur pa'am ma yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: one who is not yet existent,üîΩor one who is both existent and not yet existent.üîΩAnd the action would be one that is already existent, one that is not yet existent,

original: yin pa dang ma yin par gyur ba zhig byed pa po'i bya bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yin pa dang ma yin par gyur ba zhig byed pa po'i bya bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: or one that is both existent and not yet existent.

original: de dag rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag phung po la sogs pa dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par phung po
analyzed: de dag rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag phung po la sogs pa dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par phung po
translated: Since all of these are completely untenable, therefore the statement ‚Äúbecause they are taught‚Äù is a reason that the opponent uses to prove that the aggregates and so on exist ultimately.

original: dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pas bsgrub par bya ba yang mi 'grub par bstan to //
analyzed: dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pas bsgrub par bya ba yang mi 'grub par bstan to //
translated: But since the meaning of the reason is not established, the probandum is also not established.

original: de la 'dir 'grel pa byed pas byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i mu rnam pa drug nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'grel pa byed pas byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i mu rnam pa drug nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Here, the author of the commentary posits six alternatives with respect to the analysis of the agent and action.

original: de la yang mu dang po gsum ni byed pa po brtag pa yin la /
analyzed: de la yang mu dang po gsum ni byed pa po brtag pa yin la /
translated: Among them, the first three alternatives are the analysis of the agent.

original: mu tha ma gsum ni las brtag pa yin no //üîΩde la byed pa po brtag pa'i mu gsum ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las mi byed pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las mi byed pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mu tha ma gsum ni las brtag pa yin no // de la byed pa po brtag pa'i mu gsum ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las mi byed pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las mi byed pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las mi byed pa'o //
translated: The last three alternatives are the analysis of the action.üîΩAmong them, the three alternatives of the analysis of the agent are that that which is an agent does not perform that which is an action, that that which is not an agent does not perform that which is an action, and that that which is and is not an agent does not perform that which is and is not an action.

original: las brtag pa'i mu gsum ni las yin par gyur pa byed pa po'i bya ba yin pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po'i bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: las brtag pa'i mu gsum ni las yin par gyur pa byed pa po'i bya ba yin pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po'i bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The three alternatives of the analysis of the action are that that which is an action is the activity of an agent, that that which is not an action is the activity of an agent, and that that which is and is not an action is the activity of an agent.

original: de dag kyang byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par 'gyur ba byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /üîΩlas ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par 'gyur ba byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: That which is a real agent does not perform a real action, that which is a real action is not the action of a real agent, that which is a real agent does not perform an unreal action,üîΩthat which is an unreal action is not the action of a real agent, that which is a real agent does not perform an action that is both real and unreal, that which is an action that is both real and unreal is not the action of a real agent,

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin @158a * //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin @158a * //
translated: that which is a real agent does not perform an action that is neither real nor unreal, and that which is an action that is neither real nor unreal is not the action of a real agent.

original: par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: An existent action is not performed by an existent agent and a nonexistent object, a nonexistent agent does not perform an existent object, an existent action is not performed by a nonexistent agent, and a nonexistent object is not performed by a nonexistent agent.

original: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang / byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: An existent action is not performed by an existent and nonexistent agent, an existent and nonexistent object is not performed by an existent agent, an existent and nonexistent object is not performed by a nonexistent agent, an existent and nonexistent action is not performed by an existent agent, and an existent and nonexistent action is not performed by a nonexistent agent.

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: That which is and is not an agent does not perform that which is and is not an action.üîΩThat which is an action is not performed by that which is and is not an agent.üîΩ

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa rnam pa dgus de dag rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa rnam pa dgus de dag rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: One should understand that they are completely untenable in all aspects through the analysis of the nine possibilities: 1. That which is a real agent does not perform a real action, 2. that which is a real action is not performed by a real agent, 3. that which is a real agent does not perform an unreal action, 4. that which is an unreal action is not performed by a real agent, 5. that which is an unreal agent does not perform a real action, 6. that which is an unreal agent does not perform an unreal action, 7. that which is a real and unreal agent does not perform a real action, 8. that which is a real and unreal agent does not perform an unreal action, and 9. that which is a real and unreal agent does not perform a real and unreal action.

original: de la re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa dang po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa dang po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: With regard to that, in order to demonstrate the first position, that which is a real agent does not perform a real action and that which is a real action is not performed by a real agent, it says:

original: byed po yin par gyur pa de //
analyzed: byed po yin par gyur pa de //
translated: That which is a real agent

original: las su gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: las su gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: Does not perform a real action.

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa dang las yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir de la byed pa po yin par gyur pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa dang las yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir de la byed pa po yin par gyur pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of the agent and the object, he says: ‚ÄúThe agent is one who is engaged in activity.

original: las yin par gyur pa yang bya ba dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa yang bya ba dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The object is also one that is engaged in activity.‚Äù

original: des de mi byed pa dang / de de'i bya ba ma yin par sgrub pa ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: des de mi byed pa dang / de de'i bya ba ma yin par sgrub pa ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The proof that he does not perform that and that is not his activity will be shown later.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa /
translated: The agent who is not engaged in activity

original: las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbyed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa gnyis pa'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir / byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
translated: does not perform the object that is not engaged in activity, and the object that is not engaged in activity is not the activity of the agent who is not engaged in activity. In order to demonstrate the position of the second alternative, he says:üîΩThe agent who is not engaged in activity

original: las su ma gyur mi byed do //
analyzed: las su ma gyur mi byed do //
translated: does not perform the object that is not engaged in activity.

original: 'di yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: de yang phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de yang phyogs yin no //
translated: This is also a possibility.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of the non-existent agent and the non-existent action, he says:

original: de la yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa dang / las ma yin par @158b gyur pa ni de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa dang / las ma yin par @158b gyur pa ni de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, the non-existent agent and the non-existent action are the opposite of that.

original: dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag par snga ma'i skabs su bstan pa las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag par snga ma'i skabs su bstan pa las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The thesis is stated in the context of the previous section: the opposite of that.

original: byed pa po dang las dang mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dang mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of the agent, action, and non-action, he says: The agent is the doer of the action.

original: las zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: Action is what is to be done.

original: mi byed do zhes bya ba ni bya ba mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mi byed do zhes bya ba ni bya ba mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Non-action is not doing what is to be done.

original: des de mi byed pa dang de de'i bya ba ma yin par sgrub pa yang 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: des de mi byed pa dang de de'i bya ba ma yin par sgrub pa yang 'og nas ston to //
translated: He will later demonstrate how that does not do it and how that is not its action.

original: de la re zhig dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa snga ma bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya bas ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa dang po ston to //
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa snga ma bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya bas ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa dang po ston to //
translated: First, in order to establish the former point that was asserted, ‚ÄúThe explanation,‚Äù demonstrates the first hypothesis that an existent agent does not perform an existent action, and an existent action is not the activity of an existent agent.

original: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: ‚ÄúAn existent does not have activity.‚Äù

original: ces bya bas ni byed pa po dgag pa'i sgrub pa'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya bas ni byed pa po dgag pa'i sgrub pa'i chos bstan to //
translated: This teaches the property of the probandum that refutes the agent.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: byed pa po gang bya ba la mi ltos pa zhig byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod na de la bya ba dang las med de bya ba med par yang de grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byed pa po gang bya ba la mi ltos pa zhig byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod na de la bya ba dang las med de bya ba med par yang de grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you assert that an agent does not depend on activity, then that would be the nature of the agent, but that would not have activity and object, because it would be established without activity.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa ni snga nas bya ba dang ldan pa yin pas de la da las byed pa'i bya ba gnyis pa med pas byed pa po yin par gyur pa ni las mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa ni snga nas bya ba dang ldan pa yin pas de la da las byed pa'i bya ba gnyis pa med pas byed pa po yin par gyur pa ni las mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Since the one who is an agent is already an agent, he does not have a second action of acting. Therefore, the one who is an agent is not established as an agent.

original: de'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pa las khyad par yod par yang mi rigs pas byed pa po las byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pa las khyad par yod par yang mi rigs pas byed pa po las byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since it is illogical that there is a difference between the one who has action and the one who does not have action, the statement ‚ÄúThe agent performs the action‚Äù is untenable.üîΩThis is what the master intends.

original: gal te byed pa po snga nas byed pa dang ldan pa de la da las byed pa'i bya ba gnyis pa med pa yang las byed do zhes brtag na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po snga nas byed pa dang ldan pa de la da las byed pa'i bya ba gnyis pa med pa yang las byed do zhes brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that the one who is an agent, who is already an agent, performs an action even though he does not have a second action of acting,

original: bya ba dang ldan pa las byed pa las khyad par yod par yang mi rigs pas byed pa po yin par gyur pa las byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa las byed pa las khyad par yod par yang mi rigs pas byed pa po yin par gyur pa las byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: since it is illogical that there is a difference between the one who has action and the one who does not have action, the statement ‚ÄúThe one who is an agent performs the action‚Äù is untenable. This is what the author of the treatise intends.

original: yang na / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yang na / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: Or, the one who is an agent does not have action.

original: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na rtsa ba des ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na rtsa ba des ni /
translated: This is the statement of the example that is similar to the case in question.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe bstan ta /
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe bstan ta /
translated: Or, by this root text, the example that is similar to the case in question is taught, namely, that an existent agent does not perform an existent action.

original: mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos byed pa po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dag yod pa de 'dir dpe nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin byed pa po yin par gyur pa gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos byed pa po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dag yod pa de 'dir dpe nyid du bya'o //
translated: The example is this: when Devadatta, who is an existent agent, does not perform the action of going, which is an existent action, and when Devadatta, who is an existent agent, does not perform the action of sacrificing, which is an existent action, then in these cases, Devadatta is an existent agent because he performs the action of existing.

original: da ni de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩdon dam par byed pa po yin par gyur @159a * //
analyzed: da ni de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur @159a * //
translated: Now, in order to teach the measure of that, he says, ‚ÄúHere, the inference is as follows.‚Äù

original: pa lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te btags pa dang / mu stegs byed gyis  yongs su brtags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed de /
analyzed: pa lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te btags pa dang / mu stegs byed gyis  yongs su brtags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed de /
translated: In the ultimate, Devadatta, who is an existent agent, who is dependent and imputed, and who is imagined by tƒ´rthikas, does not perform virtuous and nonvirtuous actions in the continuum of Devadatta.

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang ; dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang ; dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject is ‚Äúbecause he is an agent,‚Äù the predicate is ‚Äúfor example, Yaj√±adatta,‚Äù and the example is ‚Äújust as Yaj√±adatta, being an agent, does not perform virtuous or nonvirtuous action in Devadatta‚Äôs continuum.‚ÄùüîΩFor example, Yaj√±adatta, being an agent, does not perform virtuous or nonvirtuous action in Devadatta‚Äôs continuum because he is an agent.

original: dper na byed pa po yin par gyur pa mchod sbyin ni byed pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed pa de bzhin du /üîΩbyed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba chos 'di pa dag gis phung po lnga la brten te gang zag ces brtags pa dang gzhan mu stegs byed pa dag gis nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu zhes bya bar yongs su brtags pa yang /
analyzed: dper na byed pa po yin par gyur pa mchod sbyin ni byed pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed pa de bzhin du / byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba chos 'di pa dag gis phung po lnga la brten te gang zag ces brtags pa dang gzhan mu stegs byed pa dag gis nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu zhes bya bar yongs su brtags pa yang /
translated: Similarly, Devadatta, who is an agent, does not perform virtuous or nonvirtuous action in his own continuum because he is an agent.

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed do //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud la las yin par gyur pa dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed do //
translated: This is because Devadatta, who is an agent, does not perform virtuous or nonvirtuous action in his own continuum because he is an agent.üîΩThe subject is ‚ÄúDevadatta, who is an agent,‚Äù the predicate is ‚Äúthis person imputed by us in dependence on the five aggregates,‚Äù and the example is ‚Äúthe inner acting person imputed by the tƒ´rthikas.‚Äù

original: yang na byed pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar btags pa ma yin pa ci ltar gzegs zan pa dag gis bdag byed pa po nyid du brtags pa lta bu de dag gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga
analyzed: yang na byed pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar btags pa ma yin pa ci ltar gzegs zan pa dag gis bdag byed pa po nyid du brtags pa lta bu de dag gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga
translated: The former inference

original: mas ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba chos 'di pa dang / gzhan ma stegs byed dag gis gang zag dang skyes bu zhes nye bar btags pa de las yin par gyur pa mi byed par dgag pa bstan to //üîΩ'dir ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar btags pa ma yin pa ci ltar gzegs zan pa dag gis bdag byed pa po nyid du brtags pa lta bu de /
analyzed: mas ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba chos 'di pa dang / gzhan ma stegs byed dag gis gang zag dang skyes bu zhes nye bar btags pa de las yin par gyur pa mi byed par dgag pa bstan to // 'dir ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar btags pa ma yin pa ci ltar gzegs zan pa dag gis bdag byed pa po nyid du brtags pa lta bu de /
translated: teaches the refutation of the nonperformance of that which is an existent object, called ‚ÄúDevadatta,‚Äù who is an existent agent, and the imputation of the person and the individual by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: las yin par gyur pa mi byed par dgag pa ston to //
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa mi byed par dgag pa ston to //
translated: Here, it teaches the refutation of the nonperformance of that which is an existent object, like the Vai≈õe·π£ikas imputing the self to be an agent.

original: don dam par bdag lhas byin ni lhas byin gya rgyud la las mi byed de dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na las yin par gyur pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud la las mi byed pa de bzhin du byed pa po yin par gyur pa bdag lhas byin zhes bya ba dngos po yin
analyzed: don dam par bdag lhas byin ni lhas byin gya rgyud la las mi byed de dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na las yin par gyur pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud la las mi byed pa de bzhin du byed pa po yin par gyur pa bdag lhas byin zhes bya ba dngos po yin
translated: The meaning of the syllogism is: Ultimately, Devadatta does not perform the action in the continuum of Devadatta because he is an entity, like an action.üîΩThe subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are applied in order.üîΩFor example, virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that are actions do not perform actions ultimately in the continuum of Devadatta because they are entities.

original: pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud la las mi byed de /
analyzed: pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud la las mi byed de /
translated: In the same way, the self that is Devadatta, who is the agent, does not perform actions ultimately in the continuum of Devadatta because he is an entity.

original: re zhig rjes su dpag pa de gnyis kyis ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig rjes su dpag pa de gnyis kyis ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa bstan to //
translated: These two inferences demonstrate that an agent who is an entity does not perform an action that is an entity.

original: da ni de'i zhar la las yin par gyur pa byed pa po @159b yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par grub pa phyogs su byas te rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ni byed pa po bdag lhas
analyzed: da ni de'i zhar la las yin par gyur pa byed pa po @159b yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par grub pa phyogs su byas te rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ni byed pa po bdag lhas
translated: Now, in terms of the consequence of that, in order to teach the inference that the action of a real agent is not a real action, it is said:

original: byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: ultimately, the action in the continuum of Devadatta is not the action of the self that is the agent Devadatta.

original: las yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: las yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because it is an action, like something else that is an action.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na lhas byin las gzhan pa mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa ni las yin pa'i phyir don dam par byed pa po bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin las gzhan pa mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa ni las yin pa'i phyir don dam par byed pa po bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the action that is an action in the continuum of Yaj√±adatta, who is other than Devadatta, is not ultimately the action of the self that is the agent Devadatta because it is an action.

original: lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa yang las yin pa'i phyir don dam par byed pa po bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las yin par gyur pa yang las yin pa'i phyir don dam par byed pa po bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the karma that is the karma of Devadatta‚Äôs continuum is karma, ultimately the self, Devadatta, is not the agent of the action.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is undermined by inference. This is the conclusion, and it is the result of the valid knowledge.

original: gang dag gi phyogs la byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par 'dod pa dag gi phyogs ma grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dag gi phyogs la byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba yin par 'dod pa dag gi phyogs ma grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The position of those who assert that the existent agent performs the existent action and that the existent action is the action of the existent agent is not established.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin //
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin //
translated: But what is the meaning of that thesis?

original: ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyis las la byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyis las la byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that in Devadatta‚Äôs continuum, the agent is different from the karma?

original: 'on te byed pa po med pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma gsum gyis byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don lhas byin nyid rang gi rgyud la las mi byed pa dang lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las rang gi bya ba ma yin par bstan pa desüîΩ/ ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las kyi byed pa po rang nyid ma yin na de la byed pa po gzhan zhig yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa po med pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma gsum gyis byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed pa dang / las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don lhas byin nyid rang gi rgyud la las mi byed pa dang lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las rang gi bya ba ma yin par bstan pa des / ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las kyi byed pa po rang nyid ma yin na de la byed pa po gzhan zhig yod pa yin nam /
translated: The meaning of the reason is that Devadatta himself does not perform the action in his own continuum, and that the action in Devadatta‚Äôs continuum is not his own activity.üîΩSo how could it be imagined that Devadatta‚Äôs action has another agent,

original: 'on te byed pa po ye med pa yin zhes ga la gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te byed pa po ye med pa yin zhes ga la gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
translated: or that it has no agent at all?üîΩWhat is the point of this?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshul dri ba yin no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshul dri ba yin no //
translated: This is a question about the method.

original: de'i lan du gal te byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba ni de lta na sngar dbu ma pas byed pa po dang las dgag par dam bcas la /
analyzed: de'i lan du gal te byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba ni de lta na sngar dbu ma pas byed pa po dang las dgag par dam bcas la /
translated: Thus, previously the Madhyamika stated the thesis that refutes the agent and action.

original: de 'dir byed pa po gzhan yod par khas blangs pas dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: de 'dir byed pa po gzhan yod par khas blangs pas dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: But here, since the other agent is accepted as existing, the thesis is undermined.üîΩBut if the agent does not exist, then there is no example.

original: ci ste byed pa po med pa yin na ni dpe med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na 'dir byed pa po med par sgrub pas /
analyzed: ci ste byed pa po med pa yin na ni dpe med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na 'dir byed pa po med par sgrub pas /
translated: If that is so, then here the agent is established as nonexistent.

original: sngar dper na mchod sbyin pa zhin no @160a * //
analyzed: sngar dper na mchod sbyin pa zhin no @160a * //
translated: Previously, the example was stated, ‚ÄúFor example, like a sacrifice,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúFor example, like an action,‚Äù and ‚ÄúFor example, like something other than that.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba dang las bzhin no zhes bya ba dang de las gzhan bzhin no zhes dpe bstan pa dag bsal bas des na dpe snga ma dag bsgrub par bya bas stong pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang las bzhin no zhes bya ba dang de las gzhan bzhin no zhes dpe bstan pa dag bsal bas des na dpe snga ma dag bsgrub par bya bas stong pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Since those examples are refuted, the previous examples are not suitable because they are empty of the probandum.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs nga ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs nga ma yin no //
translated: That is not correct.

original: bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: agent in the continuum of Devadatta. It is presented as an example.üîΩSince ‚ÄúI am the sacrificer‚Äù is a statement that the self does not exist as theüîΩagent in the continuum of Devadatta, who is the agent, it is presented as an

original: kho bos khyed pa po yin par gyur pa bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir des na byed pa po gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dam bcasüîΩpa nyams pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: kho bos khyed pa po yin par gyur pa bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir des na byed pa po gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dam bcas pa nyams pa yang ma yin la /
translated: example. Therefore, since there is no other agent, the thesis is not undermined.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since the nonagent is presented as an example, the example is not nonexistent.üîΩTherefore, the conclusion is that since the agent does not depend on action,üîΩit is not tenable that the agent and action exist in the case of the agent who is

original: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba la mi ltos pa la byed pa po nyid du rtog pa la bya ba dang las mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba la mi ltos pa la byed pa po nyid du rtog pa la bya ba dang las mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: not dependent on action.

original: de ltar re zhig rtsa ba dang po'i bshad pa de dag gis ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rtsa ba dang po'i bshad pa de dag gis ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa bstan nas /
translated: consideration that an existent agent does not perform an existent action hasüîΩbeen presented.üîΩIn the context of that, it has also been shown that it is not the case that an

analyzed: de'i zhar la las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par grub pa yang bstan to //
translated: existent action is performed by an existent agent.üîΩNow, in order to present the consideration that it is not the case that an

original: da ni rtsa ba gnyis pa'i bshad pa las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba gnyis pa'i bshad pa las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin par brtag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: existent action is performed by an existent agent, the second root text isüîΩstated:

original: las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
translated: An action would exist without an agent.

original: byed pa po des de ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byed pa po des de ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because that action would not be performed by that agent.

original: gang gi tshe byed pa po yin par gyur pa de las mi byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed pa po yin par gyur pa de las mi byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When an existent agent does not perform an action,üîΩif you imagine that an action exists without being performed, then that action

original: gal te mi byed pa'i las yin par rtog na las de la yang byed pa po med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi byed pa'i las yin par rtog na las de la yang byed pa po med par 'gyur te /
translated: would be without an agent.

original: byed pa po des las de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po des las de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that action would not be performed by that agent.

original: des na las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na las yin par gyur pa byed pa po yin par gyur pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, an existent action is not the activity of an existent agent.

original: yang na / las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na / las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
translated: Or, an action would exist without an agent.

original: zhes bya ba ni las yin par gyur par rtog pa la las kyang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po la mi ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las yin par gyur par rtog pa la las kyang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po la mi ltos pa yin te /
translated: This is because if you imagine that an existent action is an action, then it would not depend on an agent because it would be the intrinsic reality of an action.üîΩThis is because intrinsic reality is not dependent.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang na rtsa ba des ni ji ltar sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang na rtsa ba des ni ji ltar sngar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Or, by this root text, just as in the context of the analysis of how an existent agent does not perform an existent action,

original: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúAn existent has no activity.‚ÄùüîΩIf you assert that an agent does not depend on activity, then it would have no activity and no action because it would be established without activity.

original: ces bya bas byed pa po gang bya ba la mi ltos pa zhig byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid @160b du 'dod na de la bya ba dang las med de bya ba med par yang de grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang las
analyzed: ces bya bas byed pa po gang bya ba la mi ltos pa zhig byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid @160b du 'dod na de la bya ba dang las med de bya ba med par yang de grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang las
translated: In the same way, here also, if you imagine that an existent action is an action, then it would not depend on an agent because it would be the intrinsic reality of an action.

original: yin par gyur par rtog pa la las kyang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po lam ltos par yang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur bas byed pa po'i bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na byed pa pos ma byas pa nyid kyi las su 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni byed pa po des de ma byas pa'i phyir dang / las yin par gyur par rtog pa des na byed pa pos ma byas pa nyid kyi las su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yin par gyur par rtog pa la las kyang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po lam ltos par yang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur bas byed pa po'i bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro // des na byed pa pos ma byas pa nyid kyi las su 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni byed pa po des de ma byas pa'i phyir dang / las yin par gyur par rtog pa des na byed pa pos ma byas pa nyid kyi las su 'gyur bas /
translated: The action would not be the action of the agent who is in the process of acting.üîΩHere the inference is the same as before.üîΩThe agent who is in the process of acting does not perform the action that is in the process of occurring.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te brtags pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtag pa'i bya ba ma yin te /üîΩlas yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi las bzhin no //üîΩyang na don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ni bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te brtags pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtag pa'i bya ba ma yin te / las yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi las bzhin no // yang na don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ni bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: The virtuous and nonvirtuous karma in the continuum of Devadatta is not the action of a self because it is karma, like the karma of a sacrifice.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na byed pa po bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na byed pa po bzhin no //
translated: Or, the karma in the continuum of Devadatta is not the action of the self Devadatta because it is an entity, like the agent.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las byed pa po gzhan gyi bya ba yin nam 'on te bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las byed pa po gzhan gyi bya ba yin nam 'on te bya ba ma yin /
translated: What is the meaning of that thesis? Is the karma in the continuum of Devadatta the action of another agent or is it not an action?

original: des cir 'gyur gal te byed pa po gzhan gyi bya ba yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur gal te byed pa po gzhan gyi bya ba yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: What follows from that? If it is the action of another agent, then your thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste bya ba ma yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bya ba ma yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /
translated: If it is not an action, then there is no example.

translated: That is not logical.üîΩBecause the example itself is presented as the action of Devadatta,üîΩthe agent of the action of killing, is not established.

original: 'dir las phyogs su byas pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir las phyogs su byas pa la sbyar bar bya'o //

original: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: An existent does not perform an action.

original: byed pa po yang las med 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po yang las med 'gyur //

analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed par brtag pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang brgal ba dang lan dag ston te /üîΩde yang sngar /
